text: XIV.  THE BLACK SPOT IS ERASED FROM THE MAP OF THE WORLD AND THERE IS

text: CITY OF ENDLESS NIGHT
title: City of Endless Night

text: CHAPTER I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: THE RED AND BLACK AND GOLD STRUGGLE FOR
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: SUPREMACY ON THE CHANGING MAP OF THE WORLD
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: When but a child of seven my uncle placed me in a private school in
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: which one of the so-called redeemed sub-sailors was a teacher of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: German language. As I look back now, in the light of my present
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: knowledge, I better comprehend the docile humility and carefully
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: nurtured ignorance of this man. In his class rooms he used as a text a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: description of German life, taken from the captured submarine. From this
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: book he had secured his own conception of a civilization of which he
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: really knew practically nothing. I recall how we used to ask Herr
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Meineke if he had actually seen those strange things of which he taught
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: us. To this he always made answer, "The book is official, man's
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: observation errs."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "He can talk it," said my playmates who attended the public schools
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: where all teaching of the language of the outcast nation was prohibited.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: They invariably elected me to be "the Germans," and locked me up in the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: old garage while they rained a stock of sun-dried clay bombs upon the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: roof and then came with a rush to "batter down the walls of Berlin" by
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: breaking in the door, while I, muttering strange guttural oaths, would
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: be led forth to be "exterminated."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: On rainy days I would sometimes take my favoured playmates into my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: uncle's library where five great maps hung in ordered sequence on the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: panelled wall.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The first map was labelled "The Age of Nations--1914," and showed the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: black spot of Germany, like in size to many of the surrounding
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: countries, the names of which one recited in the history class.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The second map--"Germany's Maximum Expansion of the First World
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: War--1918"--showed the black area trebled in size, crowding into the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: pale gold of France, thrusting a hungry arm across the Hellespont
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: towards Bagdad, and, from the Balkans to the Baltic, blotting out all
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: else save the flaming red of Bolshevist Russia, which spread over the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Eastern half of Europe like a pool of fresh spilled blood.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Third came "The Age of the League of Nations, 1919--1983," with the gold
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of democracy battling with the spreading red of socialism, for the black
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of autocracy had erstwhile vanished.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The fourth map was the most fascinating and terrible. Again the black of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: autocracy appeared, obliterating the red of the Brotherhood of Man,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: spreading across half of Eurasia and thrusting a broad black shadow to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the Yellow Sea and a lesser one to the Persian Gulf. This map was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: labelled "Maximum German Expansion of the Second World War, 1988," and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: lines of dotted white retreated in concentric waves till the line
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: This same year was the first date of the fifth map, which was labelled
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "A Century of the World State," and here, as all the sea was blue, so
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: all the land was gold, save one black blot that might have been made by
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: a single spattered drop of ink, for it was no bigger than the Irish
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Island. The persistence of this remaining black on the map of the world
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: troubled my boyish mind, as it has troubled three generations of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: United World, and strive as I might, I could not comprehend why the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: great blackness of the fourth map had been erased and this small blot
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: alone remained.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: When I returned from school for my vacation, after I had my first year
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of physical science, I sought out my uncle in his laboratory and asked
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: him to explain the mystery of the little black island standing adamant
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: in the golden sea of all the world.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "That spot," said my uncle, "would have been erased in two more years if
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: a Leipzig professor had not discovered The Ray. Yet we do not know his
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: name nor how he made his discovery."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But just what is The Ray?" I asked.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "We do not know that either, nor how it is made. We only know that it
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: destroys the oxygen carrying power of living blood. If it were an
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: emanation from a substance like radium, they could have fired it in
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: projectiles and so conquered the earth. If it were ether waves like
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: electricity, we should have been able to have insulated against it, or
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: they should have been able to project it farther and destroy our
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: aircraft, but The Ray is not destructive beyond two thousand metres in
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the air and hardly that far in the earth."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Then why do we not fly over and land an army and great guns and batter
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: down the walls of Berlin and he done with it?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "That, as you know if you studied your history, has been tried many
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: times and always with disaster. The bomb-torn soil of that black land is
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: speckled white with the bones of World armies who were sent on landing
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: invasions before you or I was born. But it was only heroic folly, one
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: gun popping out of a tunnel mouth can slay a thousand men. To pursue the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: gunners into their catacombs meant to be gassed; and sometimes our
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: forces were left to land in peace and set up their batteries to fire
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: against Berlin, but the Germans would place Ray generators in the ground
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: beneath them and slay our forces in an hour, as the Angel of Jehovah
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: withered the hosts of the Assyrians."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But why," I persisted, "do we not tunnel under the Ray generators and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: dig our way to Berlin and blow it up?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: My uncle smiled indulgently. "And that has been tried too, but they can
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: hear our borings with microphones and cut us off, just as we cut them
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: off when they try to tunnel out and place new generators. It is too
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: slow, too difficult, either way; the line has wavered a little with the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: years but to no practical avail; the war in our day has become merely a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: watching game, we to keep the Germans from coming out, they to keep us
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: from penetrating within gunshot of Berlin; but to gain a mile of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: worthless territory either way means too great a human waste to be worth
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the price. Things must go on as they are till the Germans tire of their
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: sunless imprisonment or till they exhaust some essential element in
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: their soil. But wars such as you read of in your history, will never
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: happen again. The Germans cannot fight the world in the air, nor in the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: sea, nor on the surface of the earth; and we cannot fight the Germans in
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the ground; so the war has become a fixed state of standing guard; the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: hope of victory, the fear of defeat have vanished; the romance of war
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: is dead."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But why, then," I asked, "does the World Patrol continue to bomb the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: roof of Berlin?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Politics," replied my uncle, "military politics, just futile display of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: pyrotechnics to amuse the populace and give heroically inclined young
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: men a chance to strut in uniforms--but after the election this fall such
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: folly will cease."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: My uncle had predicted correctly, for by the time I again came home on
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: my vacation, the newly elected Pacifist Council had reduced the aerial
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: activities to mere watchful patroling over the land of the enemy. Then
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: came the report of an attempt to launch an airplane from the roof of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Berlin. The people, in dire panic lest Ray generators were being carried
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: out by German aircraft, had clamoured for the recall of the Pacifist
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Council, and the bombardment of Berlin was resumed.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: During the lull of the bombing activities my uncle, who stood high with
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the Pacifist Administration, had obtained permission to fly over Europe,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and I, most fortunate of boys, accompanied him. The plane in which we
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: travelled bore the emblem of the World Patrol. On a cloudless day we
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: sailed over the pock-marked desert that had once been Germany and came
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: within field-glass range of Berlin itself. On the wasted, bomb-torn land
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: lay the great grey disc--the city of mystery. Three hundred metres high
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: they said it stood, but so vast was its extent that it seemed as flat
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and thin as a pancake on a griddle.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "More people live in that mass of concrete," said my uncle, "than in the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: whole of America west of the Rocky Mountains." His statement, I have
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: since learned, fell short of half the truth, but then it seemed
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: appalling. I fancied the city a giant anthill, and searched with my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: glass as if I expected to see the ants swarming out. But no sign of life
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: was visible upon the monotonous surface of the sand-blanketed roof, and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: high above the range of naked vision hung the hawk-like watchers of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: World Patrol.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The lure of unravelled secrets, the ambition for discovery and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: exploration stirred my boyish veins. Yes, I would know more of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: strange race, the unknown life that surged beneath that grey blanket of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: mystery. But how? For over a century millions of men had felt that same
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: longing to know. Aviators, landing by accident or intent within the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: lines, had either returned with nothing to report, or they had not
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: returned. Daring journalists, with baskets of carrier pigeons, had on
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: foggy nights dropped by parachute to the roof of the city; but neither
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: they nor the birds had brought back a single word of what lay beneath
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the armed and armoured roof.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: My own resolution was but a boy's dream and I returned to Chicago to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: take up my chemical studies.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: CHAPTER II
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I EXPLORE THE POTASH MINES OF STASSFURT
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: AND FIND A DIARY IN A DEAD MAN'S POCKET
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: When I was twenty-four years old, my uncle was killed in a laboratory
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: explosion. He had been a scientist of renown and a chemical inventor who
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: had devoted his life to the unravelling of the secrets of the synthetic
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: foods of Germany. For some years I had been his trusted assistant. In
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: our Chicago laboratory were carefully preserved food samples that had
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: been taken from the captured submarines in years gone by; and what to me
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: was even more fascinating, a collection of German books of like origin,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: which I had read with avidity. With the exception of those relating to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: submarine navigation, I found them stupidly childish and decided that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: they had been prepared to hide the truth and not reveal it.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: My uncle had bequeathed me both his work and his fortune, but despairing
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of my ability worthily to continue his own brilliant researches on
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: synthetic food, I turned my attention to the potash problem, in which I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: had long been interested. My reading of early chemical works had given
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: me a particular interest in the reclamation of the abandoned potash
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: mines of Stassfurt. These mines, as any student of chemical history will
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: know, were one of the richest properties of the old German state in the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: days before the endless war began and Germany became isolated from the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: rest of the world. The mines were captured by the World in the year
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: 2020, and were profitably operated for a couple of decades. Meanwhile
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the German lines were forced many miles to the rear before the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: impregnable barrier of the Ray had halted the progress of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: World Armies.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: A few years after the coming of the Ray defences, occurred what history
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: records as "The Tragedy of the Mines." Six thousand workmen went down
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: into the potash mines of Stassfurt one morning and never came up again.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The miners' families in the neighbouring villages died like weevils in
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: fumigated grain. The region became a valley of pestilence and death, and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: all life withered for miles around. Numerous governmental projects were
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: launched for the recovery of the potash mines but all failed, and for
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: one hundred and eleven years no man had penetrated those
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: accursed shafts.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Knowing these facts, I wasted no time in soliciting government aid for
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: my project, but was content to secure a permit to attempt the recovery
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: with private funds, with which my uncle's fortune supplied me in
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: abundance.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: In April, 2151, I set up my laboratory on the edge of the area of death.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I had never accepted the orthodox view as to the composition of the gas
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that issued from the Stassfurt mines. In a few months I was gratified to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: find my doubts confirmed. A short time after this I made a more
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: unexpected and astonishing discovery. I found that this complex and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: hitherto misunderstood gas could, under the influence of certain
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: high-frequency electrical discharges, be made to combine with explosive
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: violence with the nitrogen of the atmosphere, leaving only a harmless
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: residue. We wired the surrounding region for the electrical discharge
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and, with a vast explosion of weird purple flame, cleared the whole area
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of the century-old curse. Our laboratory was destroyed by the explosion.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: It was rebuilt nearer the mine shafts from which the gas still slowly
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: issued. Again we set up our electrical machinery and dropped our cables
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: into the shafts, this time clearing the air of the mines.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: A hasty exploration revealed the fact that but a single shaft had
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: remained intact. A third time we prepared our electrical machinery. We
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: let down a cable and succeeded in getting but a faint reaction at the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: bottom of the shaft. After several repeated clearings we risked descent.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Upon arrival at the bottom we were surprised to find it free from water,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: save for a trickling stream. The second thing we discovered was a pile
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of huddled skeletons of the workmen who had perished over a century
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: previous. But our third and most important discovery was a boring from
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: which the poisonous gas was slowly issuing. It took but a few hours to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: provide an apparatus to fire this gas as fast as it issued, and the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: potash mines of Stassfurt were regained for the world.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: My associates were for beginning mining operations at once, but I had
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: been granted a twenty years' franchise on the output of these mines, and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I was in no such haste. The boring from which this poisonous vapour
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: issued was clearly man-made; moreover I alone knew the formula of that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: gas and had convinced myself once for all as to its man-made origin. I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: sent for microphones and with their aid speedily detected the sound of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: machinery in other workings beneath.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: It is easy now to see that I erred in risking my own life as I did
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: without the precaution of confiding the secret of my discovery to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: others. But those were days of feverish excitement. Impulsively I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: decided to make the first attack on the Germans as a private enterprise
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and then call for military aid. I had my own equipment of poisonous
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: bombs and my sapping and mining experts determined that the German
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: workings were but eighty metres beneath us. Hastily, among the crumbling
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: skeletons, we set up our electrical boring machinery and began sinking a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: one-metre shaft towards the nearest sound.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: After twenty hours of boring, the drill head suddenly came off and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: rattled down into a cavern. We saw a light and heard guttural shouting
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: below and the cracking of a gun as a few bullets spattered against the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: roof of our chamber. We heaved down our gas bombs and covered over our
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: shaft. Within a few hours the light below went out and our microphones
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: failed to detect any sound from the rocks beneath us. It was then
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: perhaps that I should have called for military aid, but the uncanny
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: silence of the lower workings proved too much for my eager curiosity. We
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: waited two days and still there was no evidence of life below. I knew
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: there had been ample time for the gas from our bombs to have been
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: dissipated, as it was decomposed by contact with moisture. A light was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: lowered, but this brought forth no response.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I now called for a volunteer to descend the shaft. None was forthcoming
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: from among my men, and against their protest I insisted on being lowered
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: into the shaft. When I was a few metres from the bottom the cable parted
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and I fell and lay stunned on the floor below.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: When I recovered consciousness the light had gone out. There was no
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: sound about me. I shouted up the shaft above and could get no answer.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The chamber in which I lay was many times my height and I could make
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: nothing out in the dark hole above. For some hours I scarcely stirred
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and feared to burn my pocket flash both because it might reveal my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: presence to lurking enemies and because I wished to conserve my battery
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: against graver need.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: But no rescue came from my men above. Only recently, after the lapse of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: years, did I learn the cause of their deserting me. As I lay stunned
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: from my fall, my men, unable to get answer to their shoutings, had given
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: me up for dead. Meanwhile the apparatus which caused the destruction of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the German gas had gone wrong. My associates, unable to fix it, had fled
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: from the mine and abandoned the enterprise.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: After some hours of waiting I stirred about and found means to erect a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: rough scaffold and reach the mouth of the shaft above me. I attempted to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: climb, but, unable to get a hold on the smooth wet rock, I gave up
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: exhausted and despairing. Entombed in the depths of the earth, I was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: either a prisoner of the German potash miners, if any remained alive, or
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: a prisoner of the earth itself, with dead men for company.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Collecting my courage I set about to explore my surroundings. I found
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: some mining machinery evidently damaged by the explosion of our gas
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: bombs. There was no evidence of men about, living or dead. Stealthily I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: set out along the little railway track that ran through a passage down a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: steep incline. As I progressed I felt the air rapidly becoming colder.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Presently I stumbled upon the first victim of our gas bombs, fallen
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: headlong as he was fleeing. I hurried on. The air seemed to be blowing
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: in my face and the cold was becoming intense. This puzzled me for at
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: this depth the temperature should have been above that on the surface of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the earth.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: After a hundred metres or so of going I came into a larger chamber. It
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: was intensely cold. From out another branching passage-way I could hear
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: a sizzling sound as of steam escaping. I started to turn into this
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: passage but was met with such a blast of cold air that I dared not face
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: it for fear of being frozen. Stamping my feet, which were fast becoming
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: numb, I made the rounds of the chamber, and examined the dead miners
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that were tumbled about. The bodies were frozen.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: One side of this chamber was partitioned off with some sort of metal
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: wall. The door stood blown open. It felt a little warmer in here and I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: entered and closed the door. Exploring the room with my dim light I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: found one side of it filled with a row of bunks--in each bunk a corpse.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Along the other side of the room was a table with eating utensils and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: back of this were shelves with food packages.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I was in danger of freezing to death and, tumbling several bodies out of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the bunks, I took the mattresses and built of them a clumsy enclosure
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and installed in their midst a battery heater which I found. In this
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: fashion I managed to get fairly warm again. After some hours of huddling
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I observed that the temperature had moderated.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: My fear of freezing abated, I made another survey of my surroundings and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: discovered something that had escaped my first attention. In the far end
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of the room was a desk, and seated before it with his head fallen
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: forward on his arms was the form of a man. The miners had all been
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: dressed in a coarse artificial leather, but this man was dressed in a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: woven fabric of cellulose silk.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The body was frozen. As I tumbled it stiffly back it fell from the chair
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: exposing a ghastly face. I drew away in a creepy horror, for as I looked
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: at the face of the corpse I suffered a sort of waking nightmare in which
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I imagined that I was gazing at my own dead countenance.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I concluded that my normal mind was slipping out of gear and proceeded
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to back off and avail myself of a tube of stimulant which I carried in
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: my pocket.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: This revived me somewhat, but again, when I tried to look upon the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: frozen face, the conviction returned that I was looking at my own
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: dead self.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I glanced at my watch and figured out that I had been in the German mine
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: for thirty hours and had not tasted food or drink for nearly forty
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: hours. Clearly I had to get myself in shape to escape hallucinations. I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: went back to the shelves and proceeded to look for food and drink.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Happily, due to my work in my uncle's laboratory, these synthetic foods
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: were not wholly strange to me. I drank copiously of a non-alcoholic
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: chemical liquor and warmed on the heater and partook of some nitrogenous
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and some starchy porridges. It was an uncanny dining place, but hunger
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: soon conquers mere emotion, and I made out a meal. Then once more I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: faced the task of confronting this dead likeness of myself.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: This time I was clear-headed enough. I even went to the miners' lavatory
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and, jerking down the metal mirror, scrutinized my own reflection and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: reassured myself of the closeness of the resemblance. My purpose framed
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: in my mind as I did this. Clearly I was in German quarters and was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: likely to remain there. Sooner or later there must be a rescuing party.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Without further ado, I set about changing my clothing for that of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: German. The fit of the dead man's clothes further emphasized the closeness
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of the physical likeness. I recalled my excellent command of the German
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: language and began to wonder what manner of man I was supposed to be in
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: this assumed personality. But my most urgent task was speedily to make
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: way with the incriminating corpse. With the aid of the brighter
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: flashlight which I found in my new pockets, I set out to find a place to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: hide the body.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The cold that had so frightened me had now given way to almost normal
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: temperature. There was no longer the sound of sizzling steam from the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: unexplored passage-way. I followed this and presently came upon another
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: chamber filled with machinery. In one corner a huge engine, covered with
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: frost, gave off a chill greeting. On the floor was a steaming puddle of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: liquid, but the breath of this steam cut like a blizzard. At once I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: guessed it. This was a liquid air engine. The dead engineer in the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: corner helped reveal the story. With his death from the penetrating gas,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: something had gone wrong with the engine. The turbine head had blown
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: off, and the conveying pipe of liquid air had poured forth the icy blast
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that had so nearly frozen me along with the corpses of the Germans. But
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: now the flow of liquid had ceased, and the last remnants were
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: evaporating from the floor. Evidently the supply pipe had been shut off
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: further back on the line, and I had little time to lose for rescuers
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: were probably on the way.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Along one of the corridors running from the engine room I found an open
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: water drain half choked with melting ice. Following this I came upon a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: grating where the water disappeared. I jerked up the grating and dropped
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: a piece of ice down the well-like shaft. I hastily returned and dragged
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: forth the corpse of my double and with it everything I had myself
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: brought into the mine. Straightening out the stiffened body I plunged it
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: head foremost into the opening. The sound of a splash echoed within the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: dismal depths.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I now hastened back to the chamber into which I had first fallen and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: destroyed the scaffolding I had erected there. Returning to the desk
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: where I had found the man whose clothing I wore, I sat down and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: proceeded to search my abundantly filled pockets. From one of them I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: pulled out a bulky notebook and a number of loose papers. The freshest
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of these was an official order from the Imperial Office of Chemical
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Engineers. The order ran as follows:
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Capt. Karl Armstadt
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Laboratory 186, E. 58.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Report is received at this office of the sound of sapping
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: operations in potash mine D5. Go at once and verify the same
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and report of condition of gas generators and make analyses
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of output of the same.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Evidently I was Karl Armstadt and very happily a chemical engineer by
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: profession. My task of impersonation so far looked feasible--I could
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: talk chemical engineering.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The next paper I proceeded to examine was an identification folder done
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: up in oiled fabric. Thanks to German thoroughness it was amusingly
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: complete. On the first page appeared what I soon discovered to be __
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: pedigree for four generations back. The printed form on which all this
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: was minutely filled out made very clear statements from which I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: determined that my father and mother were both dead.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I, Karl Armstadt, twenty-seven years of age, was the fourteenth child of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: my mother and was born when she was forty-two years of age. According to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the record I was the ninety-seventh child of my father and born when he
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: was fifty-four. As I read this I thought there was something here that I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: misunderstood, although subsequent discoveries made it plausible enough.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: There was no further record of my plentiful fraternity, but I took heart
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that the mere fact of their numerical abundance would make unlikely any
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: great show of brotherly interest, a presumption which proved
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: quite correct.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: On the second page of this folder I read the number and location of my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: living quarters, the sources from which my meals and clothing were
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: issued, as well as the sizes and qualities of my garments and numerous
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: other references to various details of living, all of which seemed
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: painstakingly ridiculous at the time.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I put this elaborate identification paper back into its receptacle and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: opened the notebook. It proved to be a diary kept likewise in thorough
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: German fashion. I turned to the last pages and perused them hastily.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The notes in Armstadt's diary were concerned almost wholly with his
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: chemical investigations. All this I saw might be useful to me later but
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: what I needed more immediately was information as to his personal life.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I scanned back hastily through the pages for a time without finding any
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: such revelations. Then I discovered this entry made some months
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: previously:
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I cannot think of chemistry tonight, for the vision of Katrina dances
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: before me as in a dream. It must be a strange mixture of blood-lines
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that could produce such wondrous beauty. In no other woman have I seen
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: such a blackness of hair and eyes combined with such a whiteness of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: skin. I suppose I should not have danced with her--now I see all my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: resolutions shattered. But I think it was most of all the blackness of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: her eyes. Well, what care, we live but once!"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I read and re-read this entry and searched feverishly in Armstadt's
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: diary for further evidence of a personal life. But I only found tedious
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: notes on his chemical theories. Perhaps this single reference to a woman
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: was but a passing fancy of a man otherwise engrossed in his science. But
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: if rescuers came and I succeeded in passing for the German chemist the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: presence of a woman in my new role of life would surely undo all my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: effort. If no personal acquaintance of the dead man came with the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: rescuing party I saw no reason why I could not for the time pass
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: successfully as Armstadt. I should at least make the effort and I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: reasoned I could best do this by playing the malingerer and appearing
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: mentally incompetent. Such a ruse, I reasoned, would give me opportunity
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to hear much and say little, and perhaps so get my bearings in the new
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: role that I could continue it successfully.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Then, as I was about to return the notebook to my pocket, my hopes sank
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: as I found this brief entry which I had at first scanning overlooked:
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "It is twenty days now since Katrina and I have been united. She does
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: not interfere with my work as much as I feared. She even lets me talk
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: chemistry to her, though I am sure she understands not one word of what
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I tell her. I think I have made a good selection and it is surely a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: permanent one. Therefore I must work harder than ever or I shall not
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: get on."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: This alarmed me. Yet, if Armstadt had married he made very little fuss
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: about it. Evidently it concerned him chiefly in relation to his work.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: But whoever and whatever Katrina was, it was clear that her presence
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: would be disastrous to my plans of assuming his place in the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: German world.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Pondering over the ultimate difficulty of my situation, but with a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: growing faith in the plan I had evolved for avoiding immediate
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: explanations, I fell into a long-postponed sleep. The last thing I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: remember was tumbling from my chair and sprawling out upon the floor
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: where I managed to snap out my light before the much needed sleep quite
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: overcame me.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I was awakened by voices, and opened my eyes to find the place brightly
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: lighted. I closed them again quickly as some one approached and prodded
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: me with the toe of his boot.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Here is a man alive," said a voice above me.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "He is Captain Armstadt, the chemist," said another voice, approaching;
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "this is good. We have special orders to search for him."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The newcomer bent over and felt my heart. I was quite aware that it was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: functioning normally. He shook me and called me by name. After repeated
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: shakings I opened my eyes and stared at him blankly, but I said nothing.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Presently he left me and returned with a stretcher. I lay inertly as I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: was placed thereon and borne out of the chamber. Other stretcher-bearers
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: were walking ahead. We passed through the engine room where mechanics
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: were at work on the damaged liquid air engine. My stretcher was placed
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: on a little car which moved swiftly along the tunnel.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: We came into a large subterranean station and I was removed and brought
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: before a bevy of white garbed physicians. They looked at my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: identification folder and then examined me. Through it all I lay limp
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and as near lifeless as I could simulate, and they succeeded in getting
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: no speech out of me. The final orders were to forward me post haste to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the Imperial Hospital for Complex Gas Cases.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: After an eventless journey of many hours I was again unloaded and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: transferred to an elevator. For several hundred metres we sped upward
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: through a shaft, while about us whistled a blast of cold, crisp air. At
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: last the elevator stopped and I was carried out to an ambulance that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: stood waiting in a brilliantly lighted passage arched over with grey
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: concrete. I was no longer beneath the surface of the earth but was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: somewhere in the massive concrete structure of the City of Berlin.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: After a short journey our ambulance stopped and attendants came out and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: carried my litter through an open doorway and down a long hall into the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: spacious ward of a hospital.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: From half closed eyes I glanced about apprehensively for a black-haired
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: woman. With a sigh of relief I saw there were only doctors and male
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: attendants in the room. They treated me most professionally and gave no
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: sign that they suspected I was other than Capt. Karl Armstadt, which
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: fact my papers so eloquently testified. The conclusion of their
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: examination was voiced in my presence. "Physically he is normal," said
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the head physician, "but his mind seems in a stupor. There is no remedy,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: as the nature of the gas is unknown. All that can be done is to await
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the wearing off of the effect."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I was then left alone for some hours and my appetite was troubling me.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: At last an attendant approached with some savoury soup; he propped me up
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and proceeded to feed me with a spoon.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I made out from the conversation about me that the other patients were
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: officers from the underground fighting forces. An atmosphere of military
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: discipline pervaded the hospital and I felt reassured in the conclusion
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that all visiting was forbidden.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Yet my thoughts turned repeatedly to the black-eyed Katrina of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Armstadt's diary. No doubt she had been informed of the rescue and was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: waiting in grief and anxiety to see him. So both she and I were awaiting
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: a tragic moment--she to learn that her husband or lover was dead, I for
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the inevitable tearing off of my protecting disguise.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: After some days the head physician came to my cot and questioned me. I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: gazed at him and knit my brows as if struggling to think.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "You were gassed in the mine," he kept repeating, "can you remember?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Yes," I ventured, "I went to the mine, there was the sound of boring
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: overhead. I set men to watch; I was at the desk, I heard shouting, after
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that I cannot remember."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "They were all dead but you," said the doctor.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "All dead," I repeated. I liked the sound of this and so kept on
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: mumbling "All dead, all dead."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: My plan was working nicely. But I realized I could not keep up this role
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: for ever. Nor did I wish to, for the idleness and suspense were
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: intolerable and I knew that I would rather face whatever problems my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: recovery involved than to continue in this monotonous and meaningless
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: existence. So I convalesced by degrees and got about the hospital, and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: was permitted to wait on myself. But I cultivated a slowness and brevity
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of speech.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: One day as I sat reading the attendant announced, "A visitor to see you,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: sir."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Trembling with excitement and fear I tensely waited the coming of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: visitor.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Presently a stolid-faced young man followed the attendant into the room.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "You remember Holknecht," said the nurse, "he is your assistant at the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: laboratory."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I stared stupidly at the man, and cold fear crept over me as he, with
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: puzzled eyes, returned my gaze.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "You are much changed," he said at last. "I hardly recognize you."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I have been very ill," I replied.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Just then the head physician came into the room and seeing me talking to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: a stranger walked over to us. As I said nothing, Holknecht introduced
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: himself. The medical man began at once to enlarge upon the peculiarities
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of my condition. "The unknown gas," he explained, "acted upon the whole
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: nervous system and left profound effects. Never in the records of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: hospital has there been so strange a case."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Holknecht seemed quite awed and completely credulous.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "His memory must be revived," continued the head physician, "and that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: can best be done by recalling the dominating interest of his mind."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Captain Armstadt was wholly absorbed in his research work in the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: laboratory," offered Holknecht.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Then," said the physician, "you must revive the activity of those
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: particular brain cells."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: With that command the laboratory assistant was left in charge. He took
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: his new task quite seriously. Turning to me and raising his voice as if
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to penetrate my dulled mentality, he began, "Do you not remember our
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: work in the laboratory?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Yes, the laboratory, the laboratory," I repeated vaguely.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Holknecht described the laboratory in detail and gradually his talk
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: drifted into an account of the chemical research. I listened eagerly to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: get the threads of the work I must needs do if I were to maintain my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: role as Armstadt.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Knowing now that visitors were permitted me, I again grew apprehensive
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: over the possible advent of Katrina. But no woman appeared, in fact I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: had not yet seen a woman among the Germans. Always it was Holknecht and,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: strictly according to his orders, he talked incessant chemistry.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The day I resumed my normal wearing apparel I was shown into a large
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: lounging room for convalescents. I seated myself a short distance apart
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: from a group of officers and sat eyeing another group of large, hulking
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: fellows at the far end of the room. These I concluded to be common
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: soldiers, for I heard the officers in my ward grumbling at the fact that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: they were quartered in the same hospital with men of the ranks.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Presently an officer came over and took a seat beside me. "It is very
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: rarely that you men in the professional service are gassed," he said.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "You must have a dull life, I do not see how you can stand it."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But certainly," I replied, "it is not so dangerous."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "And for that reason it must be stupid--I, for one, think that even in
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the fighting forces there is no longer sufficient danger to keep up the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: military morale. Danger makes men courageous--without danger courage
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: declines--and without courage what advantage would there be in the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: military life?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Suppose," I suggested, "the war should come to an end?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But how can it?" he asked incredulously. "How can there be an end to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the war? We cannot prevent the enemy from fighting."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But what," I ventured, "if the enemy should decide to quit fighting?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "They have almost quit now," he remarked with apparent disgust; "they
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: are losing the fighting spirit--but no wonder--they say that the World
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: State population is so great that only two per cent of its men are in
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the fighting forces. What I cannot see is how a people so peaceful can
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: keep from utter degeneration. And they say that the World State soldiers
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: are not even bred for soldiering but are picked from all classes. If
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: they should decide to quit fighting, as you suggest, we also would have
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to quit--it would intolerable--it is bad enough now."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But could you not return to industrial life and do something
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: productive?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Productive!" sneered the fighter. "I knew that you professional men had
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: no courage--it is not to be expected--but I never before heard even one
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of your class suggest a thing like that--a military man do something
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: productive! Why don't you suggest that we be changed to women?" And with
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that my fellow patient rose and, turning sharply on his metal heel,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: walked away.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The officer's attitude towards his profession set me thinking, and I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: found myself wondering how far it was shared by the common soldiers. The
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: next day when I came out into the convalescent corridor I walked past
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the group of officers and went down among the men whose garments bore no
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: medals or insignia. They were unusually large men, evidently from some
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: specially selected regiment. Picking out the most intelligent looking
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: one of the group I sat down beside him.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Is this the first time you have been gassed?" I inquired.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Third time," replied the soldier.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I should think you would have been discharged."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Discharged," said the soldier, in a perplexed tone, "why I am only
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: forty-four years old, why should I be discharged unless I get in an
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: explosion and lose a leg or something?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But you have been gassed three times," I said, "I should think they
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: ought to let you return to civil life and your family."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The soldier looked hard at the insignia of my rank as captain. "You
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: professional officers don't know much, do you? A soldier quit and do
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: common labor, now that's a fine idea. And a family! Do you think I'm a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Hohenzollern?" At the thought the soldier chuckled. "Me with a family,"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: he muttered to himself, "now that's a fine idea."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I saw that I was getting on dangerous ground but curiosity prompted a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: further question: "Then, I suppose, you have nothing to hope for until
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: you reach the age of retirement, unless war should come to an end?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Again the soldier eyed me carefully. "Now you do have some queer ideas.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: There was a man in our company who used to talk like that when no
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: officers were around. This fellow, his name was Mannteufel, said he
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: could read books, that he was a forbidden love-child and his father was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: an officer. I guess he was forbidden all right, for he certainly wasn't
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: right in his head. He said that we would go out on the top of the ground
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and march over the enemy country and be shot at by the flying planes,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: like the roof guards, if the officers had heard him they would surely
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: have sent him to the crazy ward--why he said that the war would be over
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: after that, and we would all go to the enemy country and go about as we
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: liked, and own houses and women and flying planes and animals. As if the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Royal House would ever let a soldier do things like that."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Well," I said, "and why not, if the war were over?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Now there you go again--how do you mean the war was over, what would
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: all us soldiers do if there was no fighting?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "You could work," I said, "in the shops."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But if we worked in the shops, what would the workmen do?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "They would work too," I suggested.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The soldier was silent for a time. "I think I get your idea," he said.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "The Eugenic Staff would cut down the birth rates so that there would
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: only be enough soldiers and workers to fill the working jobs."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "They might do that," I remarked, wishing to lead him on.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Well," said the soldier, returning to the former thought, "I hope they
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: won't do that until I am dead. I don't care to go up on the ground to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: get shot at by the fighting planes. At least now we have something over
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: our heads and if we are going to get gassed or blown up we can't see it
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: coming. At least--"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Just then the officer with whom I had talked the day before came up. He
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: stopped before us and scowled at the soldier who saluted in hasty
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: confusion.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I wish, Captain," said the officer addressing me, "that you would not
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: take advantage of these absurd hospital conditions to disrupt discipline
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: by fraternizing with a private."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: At this the soldier looked up and saluted again.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Well?" said the officer.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "He's not to blame, sir," said the soldier, "he's off his head."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: CHAPTER III
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: IN A BLACK UTOPIA THE BLOND BROOD BREEDS AND SWARMS
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: It was with a strange mixture of eagerness and fear that I received the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: head physician's decision that I would henceforth recover my faculties
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: more rapidly in the familiar environment of my own home.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: A wooden-faced male nurse accompanied me in a closed vehicle that ran
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: noiselessly through the vaulted interior streets of the completely
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: roofed-in city. Once our vehicle entered an elevator and was let down a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: brief distance. We finally alighted in a street very like the one on
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: which the hospital was located, and filed down a narrow passage-way. My
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: companion asked for my keys, which I found in my clothing. I stood by
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: with a palpitating heart as he turned the lock and opened the door.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The place we entered was a comfortably furnished bachelor's apartment.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Books and papers were littered about giving evidence of no disturbance
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: since the sudden leaving of the occupant. Immensely relieved I sat down
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: in an upholstered chair while the nurse scurried about and put the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: place in order.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "You feel quite at home?" he asked as he finished his task.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Quite," I replied, "things are coming back to me now."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "You should have been sent home sooner," he said. "I wished to tell the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: chief as much, but I am only a second year interne and it is forbidden
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: me to express an original opinion to him."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I am sure I will be all right now," I replied.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: He turned to go and then paused. "I think," he said, "that you should
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: have some notice on you that when you do go out, if you become confused
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and make mistakes, the guards will understand. I will speak to Lieut.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Forrester, the Third Assistant, and ask that such a card be sent you."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: With that he took his departure.
