text: of the Germans by our good old God and the divine mind of the House of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Hohenzollern."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The boys were now dismissed for a recess and went into the gymnasium to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: play leap frog. But the sad-eyed Bruno promptly returned and saluted.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "You may speak," said the master.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I wish, Herr Teacher," said Bruno, "to petition you for permission to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: fight with Conrad."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But you must not begin a fight," admonished the master, "unless you can
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: attach to your opponent the odium of causing the strife."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But he did cause the odium," said Bruno; "he stuck it into my leg with
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: a pin while I was reciting. The Herr Father saw him do it, "--and the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: boy turned his eyes towards me in sad and serious appeal.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The schoolmaster glanced at me inquiringly and I corroborated the lad's
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: accusation.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Then," said the master, "you have a _casus belli_ that is actually
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: true, and if you can make Conrad admit his guilt I will exchange your
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: mark for his."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Bruno saluted again and started to leave. Then he turned back and said,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But Conrad is two kilograms heavier than I am, and he may not
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: admit it."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Then," said the teacher, "you must know that I cannot exchange the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: marks, for victory in a fight compensates for the fault that caused it.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: But if you wish I will change the marks now, but then you cannot fight."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But I wish to fight," said Bruno, "and so does Conrad. We arranged it
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: before recitation that he was to stick me with the pin."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Such diplomacy!" exulted the master when the lad had gone, "and to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: think that they can only be chemists!"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: As the evening hour drew near which I had set for my call on the first
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of the potential mothers assigned me by the Eugenic Staff, I re-read the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: rules for my conduct:
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "On the occasion of this visit you must wear a full dress uniform,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: including all orders, decorations and badges of rank and service to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: which you are entitled. This is very important and you should call
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: attention thereto and explain the full dignity and importance of your
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: rank and decorations.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "When you call you will first present the card of authorization. You
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: will then present your identification folder and extol the worth and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: character of your pedigree.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Then you will ask to see the pedigree of the woman, and will not fail
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to comment favourably thereon. If she be already a mother you will
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: inquire in regard to her children. If she be not a mother, you will
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: supplicate her to speak of her potential children. You will extol the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: virtue of her offspring--or her visions thereof,--and will not fail to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: speak favourably of their promise of becoming great chemists whose
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: service will redound to the honour of the German race and the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Royal House.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "After the above mentioned matters have been properly spoken of, you may
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: compliment the mother upon her own intelligence and fitness as a mother
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of scientists. But you will refrain from all reference to her beauty of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: person, lest her thoughts be diverted from her higher purpose to matters
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of personal amours.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "You will not prolong your call beyond the hours consistent with dignity
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and propriety, nor permit the mother to perceive your disposition
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: toward her."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Surely nothing in such formal procedure could be incompatible with my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: own ideals of propriety. Taking with me my card of authorization bearing
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the name "Frau Karoline, daughter of Ernest Pfeiffer, Director of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Perfume Works," I now ventured to the Level of Maternity.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Countless women passed me as I walked along. They were erect of form and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: plain of feature, with expressions devoid of either intelligence or
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: passion. Garbed in formless robes of sombre grey, like saints
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of song and story, they went their way with solemn resignation. Some of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: them led small children by the hand; others pushed perambulators
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: containing white robed infants being taken to or from the nurseries for
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: their scheduled stays in the mothers' individual apartments.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The actions of the mothers were as methodical as well trained nurses. In
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: their faces was the cold, pallid light of the mother love of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: madonnas of art, uncontaminated by the fretful excitement of the mother
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: love in a freer and more uncertain world.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Even the children seemed wooden cherubim. They were physically healthy
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: beyond all blemish, but they cooed and smiled in a subdued manner.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Already the ever present "_verboten_" of an ordered life seemed to have
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: crept into the small souls and repressed the instincts of anarchy and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the aspirations of individualism. As I walked among these madonnas of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: science and their angelic offspring, I felt as I imagined a man of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: earthly passions would feel if suddenly loosed in a mediaeval and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: orthodox heaven; for everything about me breathed peace, goodness,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and coldness.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: At the door of her apartment Frau Karoline greeted me with formal
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: gravity. She was a young woman of twenty years, with a high forehead and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: piercing eyes. Her face was mobile but her manner possessed the dignity
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of the matron assured of her importance in the world. Her only child was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: at the nursery at the time, in accordance with the rules of the level
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that forbids a man to see his step-children. But a large photograph,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: aided by Frau Karoline's fulsome description and eulogies, gave me a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: very clear picture of the high order of the young chemist's intelligence
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: though that worthy had but recently passed his first birthday.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The necessary matters of the inspection of pedigrees and the signing of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: my card of authorization had been conducted by the young mother with the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: cool self-possession of a well disciplined school-mistress. Her attitude
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and manner revealed the thoroughness of her education and training for
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: her duties and functions in life. And yet, though she relieved me so
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: skilfully of what I feared would be an embarrassing situation, I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: conceived an intense dislike for this most exemplary young mother, for
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: she made me feel that a man was a most useless and insignificant
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: creature to be tolerated as a necessary evil in this maternal world.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Surely," said Frau Karoline, as I returned her pedigree, "you could not
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: do better for your first born child than to honour me with his
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: motherhood. Not only is my pedigree of the purest of chemical lines,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: reaching back to the establishment of the eugenic control, but I myself
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: have taken the highest honours in the training for motherhood."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Yes," I acknowledged, "you seem very well trained."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I am particularly well versed," she continued, "in maternal psychology;
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and I have successfully cultivated calmness. In the final tests before
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: my confirmation for maternity I was found to be entirely free from
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: erotic and sentimental emotions."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But," I ventured, "is not maternal love a sentimental emotion?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "By no means," replied Frau Karoline. "Maternal love of the highest
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: order, such as I possess, is purely intellectual; it recognizes only the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: passions for the greatness of race and the glory of the Royal House.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Such love must be born of the intellect; that is why we women of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: scientific group are the best of all mothers. Thus, were I not wholly
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: free from weak sentimentality, I might desire that my second child be
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: sired by the father of my first, but the Eugenic Office has determined
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that I would bear a stronger child from a younger father, therefore I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: acquiesced to their change of assignment without emotion, as becomes a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: proper mother of our well bred race. My first child is extremely
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: intellectual but he is not quite perfect physically, and a mother such
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: as I should bear only perfect children. That alone is the supreme purpose
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of motherhood. Do you not see that I am fitted for perfect motherhood?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Yes," I replied, as I recalled that my instructions were to pay
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: compliments, "you seem to be a perfect mother."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: But the cold and logical perfection of Frau Karoline dampened my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: curiosity and oppressed my spirit of adventure, and I closed the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: interview with all possible speed and fled headlong to the nearest
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: elevator that would carry me from the level.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: In my first experience I had suffered nothing worse than an embarrassing
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: half hour, so, with more confidence I pressed the bell the second
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: evening, at the apartment of Frau Augusta, daughter of Gustave Schnorr,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Authority on Synthetic Nicotine.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Frau Augusta was a woman of thirty-five. She was well-preserved, more
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: handsome and less coldly inhuman than the younger woman.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "We will get the formalities over since you have been told they are
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: necessary," said Frau Augusta, as she reached for my card and folder
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and, at the same time, handing me her own pedigree.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Peering over the top of the chart that recorded the antecedents of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Gustave Schnorr, I saw his daughter going through my own folder with the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: business-like dispatch of a society dowager examining the "character" of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: a new housemaid.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Ah, yes," she said, raising her brows. "I thought I knew the family.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Your Uncle Otto was my second mate. He is the father of my third son and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: my twin girls. I have no more promising children. Have you ever met him?
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: He is in the aluminum tempering laboratories."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I could only stare stupidly, struck dumb with embarrassment.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "No, I suppose not," went on Frau Augusta, "it is hardly to be expected
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: since you have upwards of a hundred uncles." She arose and, going toward
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: a shelf where half a dozen pictures of half a dozen men reposed in an
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: orderly row, took the second one of the group and handed it to me.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "He is a fine man," she said, with a very full degree of pride for a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: past and partial possession. "I fear the Staff erred in transferring
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: him, but then of course the twin girls were most unexpected and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: unfortunate since the Armstadt line is supposed to sire seventy-five per
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: cent, male offspring.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "What do you think? Isn't the Eugenic Office a little unfair at times?
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: My fifth man thought so. He said it was a case of politics. I don't
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: know. I thought politics was something ancient that they had in old
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: books like churches and families."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I am sure I do not know," I murmured, as I fumbled the portrait of my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: putative uncle.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Of course," continued the voluble Fran Augusta, "you must not think I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: am criticizing the authorities. It is all very necessary. And for the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: most part I think they have done very well by me. My ten children have
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: six fathers. All of them but the first were men of most gracious manner
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and superior intelligence. The first one had his paternity right
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: revoked, so I feel satisfied on that score, even if his son is not
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: gifted--and yet the boy has beautiful hair--I think he would make an
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: excellent violinist. But then perhaps he wouldn't have been able to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: play, so maybe it is all right, though I would think music would be more
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: easily learned than chemistry. But then since I cannot read either I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: ought not to judge. I will show you his picture. I may as well show you
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: all their pictures. I don't see why you elected fathers should not see
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: our children--but then I suppose it might produce quarrels. Some women
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: are so foolish and insist on talking about the children they have
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: already borne in a way that makes a man feel that his own children could
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: never come up to them. Now I never do that. Why should one? The future
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: is always more interesting than the past. I haven't a single child that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: has not won the porcelain cross for obedience. Even my youngest--he is
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: only fourteen months--obeys as if he were a full grown man. Some say
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: mental and physical excellence are not correlated--but that is a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: prejudice because of those great labour beasts. There isn't one of my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: children that has fallen below the minimum growth standards, except my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: third daughter, and her father was undersized, so it is no fault
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of mine."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: As the loquacious mother chattered on, she produced an album, through
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: which I now turned, inspecting the annual photographs of her blond
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: brood, each of which was labelled with the statistics of physical growth
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and the tests of psychic development.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Strive as I might I could think of no comments to make, but the mother
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: came to the rescue. Unfastening the binding of the loose leaf album she
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: hastily shuffled the sheets and brought into an orderly array on the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: table before me ten photographs all taken at the age of one year. "That
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: is the only fair way to view them," she said, "for of course one cannot
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: compare the picture of a boy of fifteen with an infant of one year. But
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: at an equal age the comparison is fair to all and now you can surely
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: tell me which is the most intelligent."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I gazed hopelessly at the infantile portraits which, despite their
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: varied paternity, looked as alike as a row of peas in a pod.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Oh, well," said Frau Augusta, "after all is it fair to ask you, since
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the twins are your cousins?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Desperately I wondered which were the twins.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "They resemble you quite remarkably, don't you think so? Except that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: your hair is quite dark for an Armstadt." Frau Augusta turned and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: glanced furtively at my identification folder. "Of course! your mother.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I had almost forgotten who your mother was, but now I remember, she had
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: most remarkably dark hair. It will probably prove a dominant
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: characteristic and your children will also be dark haired. Now I should
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: like that by way of a change."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I became alarmed at this turn of the conversation toward the more
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: specific function of my visit, and resolved to make my exit with all
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: possible speed "consistent with dignity and propriety."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Meanwhile, as she reassembled the scattered sheets of the portrait
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: album, the official mother chattered on concerning her children's
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: attributes, while I shifted uneasily in my chair and looked about the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: room for my hat--forgetting in my embarrassment that I was dwelling in a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: sunless, rainless city and possessed no hat.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: At last there was a lull in the monologue and I arose and said I must be
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: going.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Frau Augusta looked pained and I recalled that I had not yet
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: complimented her upon her intelligence and fitness to be the mother of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: coming generations of chemical scientists, but I stubbornly resolved not
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to resume my seat.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "You are young," said Frau Augusta, who had risen and shifted her
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: position till she stood between me and the door. "Surely you have not
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: yet made many calls on the maternity level." Then she sighed, "I do not
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: see why they assign a man only three names to select from. Surely they
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: could be more liberal." She paused and her face hardened. "And to think
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that you men are permitted to call as often as you like upon those
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: degenerate hussies who have been forbidden the sacred duties of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: motherhood. It is a very wicked institution, that level of lust--some
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: day we women--we mothers of Berlin--will rise in our wrath and see that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: they are banished to the mines, for they produce nothing but sin and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: misery in this man-made world."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Yes," I said, "the system is very wrong, but--"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But the authorities, you need not say it, I have heard it all before,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the authorities, always the authorities. Why should men always be the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: authorities? Why do we mothers of Berlin have no rights? Why are we not
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: consulted in these matters? Why must we always submit?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Then suddenly, and very much to my surprise, she placed her hands upon
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: my shoulders and said hoarsely: "Tell me about the Free Level. Are the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: women there more beautiful than I?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "No," I said, "very few of them are beautiful, and those of the labour
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: groups are most gross and stupid."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Then why," wailed Frau Augusta, "was I not allowed to go? Why was I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: penned up here and made to bear children when others revel in the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: delights of love and song and laughter?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But," I said, shocked at this unexpected revelation of character,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "yours is the more honourable, more virtuous life. You were chosen for
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: motherhood because you are a woman of superior intelligence."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "It's a lie," cried Frau Augusta. "I have no intelligence. I want none.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: But I am as beautiful as they. But no, they would not let me go. They
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: penned me up here with these saintly mothers and these angelic children.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Children, children everywhere, millions and millions of them, and not a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: man but doctors, and you elected fathers who are sent here to bring us
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: pain and sorrow. You say nothing of love--your eyes are cold. The last
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: one said he loved me--the brute! He came but thrice, when my child was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: born he sent me a flower. But that is the official rule. And I hate him,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and hate his child that has his lying eyes."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The distraught woman covered her face with her hands and burst into
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: violent weeping.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: When she had ceased her sobs I tried to explain to her the philosophy of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: contentment with life's lot. I told her of the seamy side of the gown
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that cloaks licentiousness and of the sorrows and bitterness of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: ashes of burned out love. With the most iridescent words at my command I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: painted for her the halo of the madonna's glory, and translated for her
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the English verse that informs us that there is not a flower in any
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: land, nor a pearl in any sea, that is as beautiful and lovely as any
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: child on any mother's knee.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: But I do not think I altogether consoled Frau Augusta for my German
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: vocabulary was essentially scientific, not poetic. But I made a noble
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: effort and when I left her I felt very much the preacher, for the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: function of the preacher, not unlike death, is to make us cling to those
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: ills we have when we would fly to others that we know not of.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: There remained but one card unsigned of the three given me.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Frau Matilda, daughter of Siegfried Oberwinder, Analine Analyst, was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: registered as eighteen and evidently an inexperienced mother-elect as I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: was a father-elect. The nature of the man is to hold the virgin above
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the madonna, and in starting on my third journey to the maternity level,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I found hitherto inexperienced feelings tugging at my heartstrings and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: resolved that whatever she might be, I would be dignified and formal yet
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: most courteous and kind.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: My ring was answered by a slender, frightened girl. She was so shy that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: she could only nod for me to enter. I offered my card and folder,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: smiling to reassure her, but she retreated precipitously into a far
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: corner and sat staring at me beseechingly with big grey eyes that seemed
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the only striking feature of her small pinched face.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I am sorry if I frighten you," I said, "but of course you know that I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: am sent by the eugenic authorities. I will not detain you long. All that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: is really necessary is for you to sign this card."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: She timidly signed the card and returned it to the corner of the table.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I felt extremely sorry for the fluttering creature; and, knowing that I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: could not alter her lot, I sought to speak words of encouragement. "If
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: you find it hard now," I said, "it is only because you are young and a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: stranger to life, but you will be recompensed when you know the joys of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: motherhood."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: At my words a look of consecrated purpose glowed in the girl's white
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: face. "Oh, yes," she said eagerly. "I wish very much to be a mother. I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: have studied so hard to learn. I wish only to give myself to the holy
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: duties of maternity. But I am so afraid."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But you need not be afraid of me," I said. "This is only a formal call
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: which I have made because the Eugenic Staff ordered it so. But it seems
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to me that some better plan might be made for these meetings. Some
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: social life might be arranged so that you would become acquainted with
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the men who are to be the fathers of your children under less
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: embarrassing circumstances."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I try so hard not to be afraid of men, for I know they are necessary to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: eugenics."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Yes," I said dryly, "I suppose they are, though I think I would prefer
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to put it that the love of man and woman is necessary to parenthood."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Oh, no," she said in a frightened voice, "not that, that is very
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: wicked."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "So you were taught that you should not love men? No wonder you are
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: afraid of them."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I was taught to respect men for they are the fathers of children," she
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: replied.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Then," I asked, deciding to probe the philosophy of the education for
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: maternity, "why are not the fathers permitted to enjoy their fatherhood
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and live with the mother and the children?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Frau Matilda now gazed at me with open-mouthed astonishment. "What a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: beautiful idea!" she exclaimed with rapture.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Yes, I rather like it myself--the family--"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

author: Hastings, Milo

text: "That is what we were talking about."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But the family is forbidden. It is very wrong, very uneugenic. You must
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: be a wicked man to speak to me of that."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "You have been taught some very foolish ideas," I replied.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and I want to do what is right and loyal. I passed all my examinations.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I am a good mother-elect, and you say these forbidden things to me. You
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: talk of love and families. You insult me. And if you select me, I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: shall--I shall claim exemption,--" and with that she rose and darted
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: through the inner door.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I waited for a time and then gently approached the door, which I saw had
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: swung to with springs and had neither latch nor lock. My gentle rap upon
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the hollow panel was answered by a muffled sob. I realized the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: hopelessness of further words and silently turned from the door and left
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the apartment.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The streets of the level were almost deserted for the curfew had rung
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and the lights glowed dim as in a hospital ward at night. I hurried
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: silently along, shut in by enclosing walls and the lowering ceiling of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the street. From everywhere I seemed to feel upon me the beseeching,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: haunting grey eyes of Frau Matilda. My soul was troubled, for it seemed
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to stagger beneath the burden of its realization of a lost humanity. And
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: with me walked grey shadows of other men, felt-footed through the gloom,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and they walked hurriedly as men fleeing from a house of death.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: My next duty as a German father-elect was to report to the Eugenic
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Office. There at least I could deal with men; and there I went, nursing
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: rebellion yet trying my utmost to appear outwardly calm.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: To the clerk I offered my three signed cards by way of introduction.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "And which do you select?" asked the oldish man over his rimless
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: glasses.

author: Hastings, Milo

text: "None."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Ah, but you must."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "That is most unusual."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But does it ever happen?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Well, yes," admitted the clerk, "but only by Petition Extraordinary to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the Chief of the Staff. But it is most unusual, and if he refuses to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: grant it you may be dishonoured even to the extent of having your
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: election to paternity suspended, may be even permanently cancelled."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "You mean"--I stammered.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Exactly--you refuse to accept any one of the three women when all are
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: most scientifically selected for you. Does it not throw some doubts upon

author: Hastings, Milo

text: your own psychic fitness for mating at all? If I may suggest, Herr

author: Hastings, Milo

title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo
