title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Yes, now; how do I go about it?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "You must first consult the Investigator."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: After a few formalities I was conducted to that official.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "You refuse to make selection?" inquired the Investigator.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Yes."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Why?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Because," I replied, "I am engaged upon some chemical research of most
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: unusual nature--"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Yes," nodded the Investigator, "I have just looked that up. The more
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: reason you should be honoured with paternity."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Perhaps," I said, "you are not informed of the grave importance of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: research. If you will consult Herr von Uhl of the Chemical Staff--"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Entirely unnecessary," he retorted; "paternity is also important.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Besides it takes but little time. No more than you need for recreation."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But I do not find it recreation. I have not been able to concentrate my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: mind on my work since I received notice of my election to paternity."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But you were warned against this," he said; "you have no right to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: permit the development of disturbing romantic emotions. They may be bad
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: for your work, but they are worse for eugenics. So, if you have made
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: romantic love to the mothers of Berlin, your case must be investigated."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But I have not."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Then why has this disturbed you?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Because," I replied, "this system of scientific paternity offends my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: instincts."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The investigator ogled me craftily. "What system would you prefer
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: instead?" he asked.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I saw he was trying to trap me into disloyal admissions. "I have nothing
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to propose," I stated. "I only know that I find the paternity system
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: offensive to me, and that the position I am placed in incapacitates me
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: for my work."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The investigator made some notes on a pad.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "That is all for the present," he said. "I will refer your case to the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Chief."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Two days later I received an order to report at once to Dr. Ludwig
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Zimmern, Chief of the Eugenic Staff.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The Chief, with whom I was soon cloistered, was a man of about sixty
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: years. His face revealed a greater degree of intelligence than I had yet
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: observed among the Germans, nor was his demeanour that of haughty
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: officiousness, for a kindly warmth glowed in his soft dark eyes.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I have a report here," said Dr. Zimmern, "from my Investigator. He
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: recommends that your rights of paternity be revoked on the grounds that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: he believes yours to be a case of atavistic radicalism. In short he
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: thinks you are rebellious by instinct, and that you are therefore unsafe
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to father the coming generation. It is part of the function of this
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: office to breed the rebellious instinct out of the German race. What
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: have you to say in answer to these charges?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I do not want to seem rebellious," I stammered, "but I wish to be
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: relieved of this duty."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Very well," said Zimmern, "you may be relieved. If you have no
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: objection I will sign the recommendation as it stands."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Surely, I thought, this man does not seem very bitter toward my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: traitorous instincts.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Zimmern smiled and eyed me curiously. "You know," he said, "that to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: possess a thought and to speak of it indiscreetly are two
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: different things."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Certainly," I replied, emboldened by his words. "A man cannot do
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: original work in science if he possesses a mind that never thinks
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: contrary to the established order of things."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The clerks in the outer office must have thought my case a grievous one
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: for I was closeted with their chief for nearly an hour. Though our
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: conversation was vague and guarded, I knew that I had discovered in Dr.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Ludwig Zimmern, Chief of the Eugenic Staff, a man guilty himself of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: very crime of possessing rebellious instincts for which he had decided
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: me unfit to sire German children. And when I finally took my leave I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: carried with me his private card and an invitation to call at his
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: apartment to continue our conversation.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: In the weeks that followed, my acquaintance with the Chief of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Eugenic Staff ripened rapidly into a warm friendship. The frank manner
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: in which he revealed his dissatisfaction with the state of affairs in
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Germany pleased me greatly. Zimmern was interested in my chemical
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: researches and quickly comprehended their importance.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I know so little of chemistry," he deplored, "yet on it our whole life
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: hangs. That is why I am so glad of an opportunity to talk to you. I do
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: not approve of so much ignorance of each other's work on the part of our
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: scientists. Our old university system was better. Then a scientist in
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: any field knew something of the science in all fields. But now we are
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: specialized from childhood. Take, for example, yourself. You are at work
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: on a great problem by which all of our labour stands to be undone if you
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: chemists do not solve it, and yet you do not understand how we will all
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: be undone. I think you should know more of what it means, then you will
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: work better. Is it not so?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Perhaps," I said, "but I have little time. I am working too hard now."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Then," said Zimmern, "you should spend more time in pleasure on the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Free Level. Two days ago I conferred with the Emperor's Advisory Staff,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and I learned that grave changes are threatened. That is one reason I am
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: so interested in this protium on which you chemists are working. If you
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: do not solve this problem and replenish the food supply, the Emperor has
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: decided that the whole Free Level with its five million women must be
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: abolished. His Majesty will have no half-way measures. He is afraid to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: take part of these women away, lest the intellectual workers rebel like
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the labourers did in the last century when their women were taken away
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: piecemeal."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But what will His Majesty do with these five million women?" I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: inquired, eagerly desirous to learn more.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Do? What can he do with the women?" exclaimed Dr. Zimmern in a low
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: pitched but vibrant voice. "He thinks he will make workers of them. He
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: does not seem to appreciate how specialized they are for pleasure. He
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: will make machine tenders of them to relieve the workmen, who are to be
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: made soldiers. He would make surface soldiers out of these blind moles
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of the earth, put amber glasses on them and train them to run on the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: open ground and carry the war again into the sunlight. It is folly,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: sheer folly, and madness. His Majesty, I fear, reads too much of old
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: books. He always was historically inclined."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: On a later occasion Zimmern gave me the broad outlines of the history of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: German Eugenics.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Our science of applied Eugenics," he said, "began during the Second
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: World War. Our scientists had long known that the same laws of heredity
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: by which plants and animals had been bred held true with man, but they
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: had been afraid to apply those laws to man because the religion of that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: day taught that men had souls and that human life was something too
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: sacred to be supervised by science. But William III was a very fearless
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: man, and he called the scientists together and asked them to outline a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: plan for the perfection of the German race.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "At first all they advocated was that paternity be restricted to the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: superior men. This broke up the old-fashioned family where every man
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: chose his own wife and sired as many children as he liked. There were
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: great mutterings about that, and if we had not been at war, there would
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: have been rebellion. The Emperor told the people it was a military
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: necessity. The death toll of war then was great and there was urgent
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: need to increase the birth rate, so the people submitted and women soon
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: ceased to complain because they could no longer have individual
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: husbands. The children were supported by the state, and if they had
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: legitimate fathers of the approved class they were left in the mothers'
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: care. As all women who were normal and healthy were encouraged to bear
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: children, there was a great increase in the birth rate, which came near
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: resulting in the destruction of the race by starvation.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "As soon as a sufficient number of the older generation that had
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: believed in the religious significance of the family and marriage system
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: had died out, the ambitious eugenists set about to make other reforms.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The birth rate was cut down by restricting the privilege of motherhood
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to a selected class of women. The other women were instructed in the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: arts of pleasing man and avoiding maternity, and that is where we have
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the origin of our free women. In those days they were free to associate
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: with men of all classes. Indeed any other plan would at first have been
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: impossible.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "A second fault was that the superior men for whom paternity was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: permitted were selected from the official and intellectual classes. The
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: result was that the quality of the labourers deteriorated. So two
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: strains were established, the one for the production of the intellectual
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: workers, and the other for producing manual workers. From time to time
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: this specialization has increased until now we have as many strains of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: inheritance as there are groups of useful characteristics known to be
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: hereditary.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "We have produced some effects," mused Zimmern, "which were not
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: anticipated, and which have been calling forth considerable criticism.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: His Majesty sends me memorandums nearly every year, after he reviews the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: maternity levels, insisting that the feminine beauty of the race is, as
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: a whole, deteriorating. And yet this is logical enough. With the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: exception of our small actor-model strain, the characteristics for which
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: we breed have only the most incidental relation to feminine beauty. The
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: type of the labour female is, as you have seen, a buxom, fleshly beauty;
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: youth and full nutrition are essential to its display, and it soon fades.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: In the scientific strains it seems that the power of original thought
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: correlates with a feminine type that is certainly not beautiful.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Doubtless not understanding this you may have felt that you were
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: discriminated against in your assignment. But the clerical mind
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: with its passion for monotonous repetition of petty mental processes
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: seems to correlate with the most exquisite and refined feminine
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: features. Those scintillating beauties on the Free Level who have
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: ever at their beck our wisest men are from our clerical strain,--but
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of course they are only the rejects. It is unfortunate that you cannot
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: see the more privileged specimens in the clerical maternity level.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But I digress to that which is of no consequence. The beauty of women is
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: unimportant but the number of women is very important. When some women
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: were specialized for motherhood then there were surplus women. At first
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: they made workers of them. The war was then conducted on a larger scale
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: than now. We had not yet fully specialized the soldier class. All the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: young men went to war; and, when they came back and went to work, they
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: became bitterly jealous of the women workers and made an outcry that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: those who could not fight should not work. The men workers drove the women
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: from industry, hoping thereby each to possess a mistress. As a result the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: great number of unproductive women was a drain upon the state. All sorts
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of schemes were proposed to reduce the number of female births but most of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: these were unscientific. In studying the records it was found that the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: offspring of certain men were predominantly males. By applying this
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: principle of selection we have, with successive generations, been able to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: reduce the proportion of female births to less than half the old rate.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But the sexual impulse of the labourers made them restless and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: rebellious, and the support of the free women for these millions of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: workers was a great economic waste. When animals had been bred to large
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: size and great strength their sexuality had decreased, while their power
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: as beasts of burden increased. The same principle applied to man has
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: resulted in more docile workers. By beginning with the soldiers and mine
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: workers, who were kept away from women, and by combining proper training
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: with the hereditary selection, we solved that problem and removed all
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: knowledge of women from the minds of the workmen."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But how about paternity among the workers?" I asked.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Those who are selected are removed to special isolated quarters. They
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: are told they are being taken to serve as His Majesty's body guard; and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: they never go back to mingle with their fellows."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I then related for the doctor my conversation with the workman who asked
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: me about women.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "So," said Zimmern, "there has been a leak somewhere; knowledge is hard
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to bottle. Still we have bottled most of it and the labourer accepts his
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: loveless lot. But it could not be done with the intellectual worker."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Dr. Zimmern smiled cynically. "At least," he added, "we don't propose to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: admit that it can be done. And that, Col. Armstadt, is what I was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: remarking about the other evening. Unless you chemists can solve the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: protium problem, Germany must cut her population swiftly, if we do not
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: starve out altogether. His Majesty's plan to turn the workmen into
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: soldiers and make workers of the free women will not solve it. It is too
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: serious for that. The Emperor's talk about the day being at hand is all
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: nonsense. He knows and we know that these mongrel herds, as he calls the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: outside enemy, are not so degenerate.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "We may have improved the German stock in some ways by our scientific
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: breeding, but science cannot do much in six generations, and what we
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: have accomplished, I as a member of the Eugenist Staff, can assure you
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: has really been attained as much by training as by breeding, though the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: breeding is given the credit. Our men are highly specialized, and once
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: outside the walls of Berlin they will find things so different that this
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: very specialization will prove a handicap. The mongrel peoples are more
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: adaptable. Our workmen and soldiers are large in physique, but dwarfed
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of intellect. The enemy will beat us in open war, and, even if we should
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: be victorious in war, we could not rule them. Either we solve this food
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: business or we all turn soldiers and go out into the blinding sunlight
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and die fighting."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I ventured as a wild remark: "At least, if we get outside there will be
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: plenty of women."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The older man looked at me with the superiority of age towards youth.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Young man," he said, "you have not read history; you do not understand
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: this love and family doctrine; it exists in the outside world today just
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: as it did two centuries ago. The Germans in the days of the old surface
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: wars made too free with the enemy's women, and that is why they ran us
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: into cover here and penned us up. These mongrel people will fight for
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: their women when they will fight for nothing else. We have not bred all
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the lust out of our workmen either. It is merely dormant. Once they are
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: loosed in the outer world they will not understand this thing and they
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: will again make free with the enemy's women, and then we shall all be
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: exterminated."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Dr. Zimmern got up and filled a pipe with synthetic tobacco and puffed
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: energetically as he walked about the room. "What do you say about this
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: protium ore?" he asked; "will you be able to solve the problem?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Yes," I said, "I think I shall."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I hope so," replied my host, "and yet sometimes I do not care; somehow
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I want this thing to come to an end. I want to see what is outside there.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I think, perhaps, I would like to fly.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "What troubles me is that I do not see how we can ever do it. We have
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: bred and trained our race into specialization and stupidity. We wouldn't
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: know how to go out and join this World State if they would let us."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Dr. Zimmern paced the room in silence for a time. "Do you know," he
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: said, "I should like to see a negro, a black man with kinky hair--it
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: must be queer."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Yes," I answered, "there must be many queer things out there."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: CHAPTER VI
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: IN WHICH I LEARN THAT COMPETITION IS STILL
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: THE LIFE OF THE OLDEST TRADE IN THE WORLD
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: When I told Dr. Zimmern that I should solve the problem of the increase
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of the supply of protium I may have been guilty of speaking of hopes as
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: if they were certainties. My optimism was based on the discovery that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the exact chemical state of the protium in the ore was unknown, and that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: it did not exist equally in all samples of the ore.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: After some further months of labour I succeeded in determining the exact
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: chemical ingredients of the ore, and from this I worked rapidly toward a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: new process of extraction that would greatly increase the total yield of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the precious element. But this fact I kept from my assistants whose work
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I directed to futile researches while I worked alone after hours in
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: following up the lead I had discovered.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: During the progress of this work I was not always in the laboratory. I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: had become a not infrequent visitor to the Level of the Free Women. The
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: continuous carnival of amusement had an attraction for me, as it must
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: have had for any tired and lonely man. But it was not merely the lure of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: sensuous pleasures that appealed to me, for I was also fascinated with
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the deeper and more tragic aspect of life beneath the gaudy surface of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: hectic joy.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Some generalities I had picked up from observation and chance
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: conversations. As a primary essential to life on the level I had quickly
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: learned that money was needed, and my check book was in frequent demand.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The bank provided an aluminum currency for the pettier needs of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: recreational life, but neither the checks nor the currency had had value
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: on other levels, since there all necessities were supplied without cost
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and luxuries were unobtainable. This strange retention of money
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: circulation and general freedom of personal conduct exclusively on the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Free Level puzzled me. Thus I found that food and drink were here
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: available for a price, a seeming contradiction to the strict limitations
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of the diet served me at my own quarters. At first it seemed I had
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: discovered a way to defeat that limitation--but there was the weigher to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: be considered.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: It was a queer ensemble, this life in the Black Utopia of Berlin, a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: combination of a world of rigid mechanistic automatism in the regular
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: routine of living with rioting individual license in recreational
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: pleasure. The Free Level seemed some ancient Bagdad, some Bourbon Court,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: some Monte Carlo set here, an oasis of flourishing vice in a desert of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: sterile law-made, machine-executed efficiency and puritanically ordered
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: life. Aided by a hundred ingenious wheels and games of chance, men and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: women gambled with the coin and credit of the level. These games were
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: presided over by crafty women whose years were too advanced to permit of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: a more personal means of extracting a living from the grosser passions
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of man. Some of these aged dames were, I found, quite highly regarded
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and their establishments had become the rendezvous for many younger
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: women who by some arrangement that I could not fathom plied their
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: traffic in commercialized love under the guidance of these subtler women
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: who had graduated from the school of long experience in preying
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: upon man.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: But only the more brilliant women could so establish themselves for the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: years of their decline. There were others, many others, whose beauty had
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: faded without an increase in wit, and these seemed to be serving their
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: more fortunate sisters, both old and young, in various menial
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: capacities. It was a strange anachronism in this world where men's more
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: weighty affairs had been so perfectly socialized, to find woman
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: retaining, evidently by men's permission, the individualistic right to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: exploit her weaker sister.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The thing confounded me, and yet I recalled the well known views of our
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: sociological historians who held that it was woman's greater
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: individualism that had checked the socialistic tendencies of the world.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Had the Germans then achieved and maintained their rigid socialistic
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: order by retaining this incongruous vestige of feminine commercialism as
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: a safety valve for the individualistic instincts of the race?
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: They called it the Free Level, and I marvelled at the nature of this
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: freedom. Freedom for licentiousness, for the getting and losing of money
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: at the wheels of fortune, freedom for temporary gluttony and the mild
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: intoxication of their flat, ill-flavoured synthetic beer. A tragic
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: symbol it seemed to me of the ignobility of man's nature, that he will
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: be a slave in all the loftier aspects of living if he can but retain his
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: freedom for his vices and corruptions. Had the Germans then, like the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: villain of the moral play, a necessary part in the tragedy of man; did
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: they exist to show the other races of the earth the way they
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: should not go? But the philosophy of this conception collapsed when I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: recalled that for more than a century the world had lost all sight of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the villain and yet had not in the least deteriorated from a lack of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: horrible example.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: From these vaguer speculations concerning the Free Level of Berlin that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: existed like a malformed vestigial organ in the body of that socialized
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: state, my mind came back to the more human, more personal side of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: problem thus presented me. I wanted to know more of the lives of these
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: women who maintained Germany's remnant of individualism.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: To what extent, I asked myself, have the true instincts of womanhood and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the normal love of man and child been smothered out of the lives of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: these girls? What secret rebellions are they nursing in their hearts? I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: wondered, too, from what source they came, and why they were selected
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: for this life, for Zimmern had not adequately enlightened me on
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: this point.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Pondering thus on the secret workings in the hearts of these girls, I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: sat one evening amid the sensuous beauty of the Hall of Flowers. I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: marvelled at how little the Germans seemed to appreciate it, for it was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: far less crowded than were the more tawdry places of revelry. Here
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: within glass encircling walls, preserved through centuries of artificial
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: existence, feeding from pots of synthetic soil and stimulated by
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: perpetual light, marvellous botanical creations flourished and flowered
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: in prodigal profusion. Ponderous warm-hued lilies floated on the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: sprinkled surface of the fountain pool. Orchids, dangling from the metal
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: lattice, hung their sensuous blossoms in vapour-laden air. Luxurious
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: vines, climatized to this unreal world, clambered over cosy arbours, or
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: clung with gripping fingers to the mossy concrete pillars.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I was sitting thus in moody silence watching the play of the fountain,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: when, through the mist, I saw the lonely figure of a girl standing in
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the shadows of a viny bower. She was toying idly with the swaying
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: tendrils. Her hair was the unfaded gold of youth. Her pale dress of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: silvery grey, unmarred by any clash of colour, hung closely about a form
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of wraith-like slenderness.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I arose and walked slowly toward her. As I approached she turned toward
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: me a face of flawless girlish beauty, and then as quickly turned away as
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: if seeking a means of escape.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I did not mean to intrude," I said.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: She did not answer, but when I turned to go, to my surprise, she stepped
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: forward and walked at my side.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Why do you come here alone?" she asked shyly, lifting a pensive
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: questioning face.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Because I am tired of all this tawdry noise. But you," I said, "surely
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: you are not tired of it? You cannot have been here long."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "No," she replied, "I have not. Only thirty days"; and her blue eyes
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: gleamed with childish pride.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "And that is why you seem so different from them all?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Timidly she placed her hand upon my arm. "So you," she said gratefully,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "you understand that I am not like them-that is, not yet."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "You do not act like them," I replied, "and what is more, you act as if
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: you did not want to be like them. It surely cannot be merely that you
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: are new here. The other girls when they come seem so eager for this
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: life, to which they have long been trained. Were you not trained for
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: it also?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Yes," she admitted, "they tried to train me for it, but they could not
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: kill my artist's soul, for I was not like these others, born of a strain
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: wherein women can only be mothers, or, if rejected for that, come here.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I was born to be a musician, a group where women may be something more
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: than mere females."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Then why are you here?" I asked.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Because," she faltered, "my voice was imperfect. I have, you see, the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: soul of an artist but lack the physical means to give that soul
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: expression. And so they transferred me to the school for free women,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: where I have been courted by the young men of the Royal House. But of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: course you understand all that."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Yes," I said, "I know something of it; but my work has always so
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: absorbed me that I have not had time to think of these matters. In fact,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I come to the Free Level much less than most men."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: For a moment, it seemed, her eyes hardened in cunning suspicion, but as
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I returned her intent gaze I could fathom only the doubts and fears of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: childish innocence.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Please let us sit down," I said; "it is so beautiful here; and then
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: tell me all about yourself, how you have lived your childhood, and what
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: your problems are. It may be that I can help you."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "There is not much to tell," she sighed, as she seated herself beside
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: me. "I was only eight years old when the musical examiners condemned my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: voice and so I do not remember much about the music school. In the other
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: school where they train girls for the life on the Free Level, they
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: taught us dancing, and how to be beautiful, and always they told us that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: we must learn these things so that the men would love us. But the only
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: men we ever saw were the doctors. They were always old and serious and I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: could not understand how I could ever love men. But our teachers would
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: tell us that the other men would be different. They would be handsome
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and young and would dance with us and bring us fine presents. If we were
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: pleasing in their sight they would take us away, and we should each have
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: an apartment of our own, and many dresses with beautiful colours, and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: there would be a whole level full of wonderful things and we could go
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: about as we pleased, and dance and feast and all life would be love and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: joy and laughter.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Then, on the 'Great Day,' when we had our first individual dresses--for
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: before we had always worn uniforms--the men came. They were young
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: military officers and members of the Royal House who are permitted to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: select girls for their own exclusive love. We were all very shy at
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: first, but many of the girls made friends with the men and some of them
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: went away that first day. And after that the men came as often as they
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: liked and I learned to dance with them, and they made love to me and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: told me I was very beautiful. Yet somehow I did not want to go with
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: them. We had been told that we would love the men who loved us. I don't
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: know why, but I didn't love any of them. And so the two years passed and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: they told me I must come here alone. And so here I am."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "And now that you are here," I said, "have you not, among all these men
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: found one that you could love?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "No," she said, with a tremor in her voice, "but they say I must."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "And how," I asked, "do they enforce that rule? Does any one require
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: you--to accept the men?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Yes," she replied. "I must do that--or starve."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "And how do you live now?" I asked.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "They gave me money when I came here, a hundred marks. And they make me
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: pay to eat and when my money is gone I cannot eat unless I get more. And
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the men have all the money, and they pay. They have offered to pay me,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: but I refused to take their checks, and they think me stupid."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The child-like explanation of her lot touched the strings of my heart.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "And how long," I asked, "is this money that is given you when you come
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: here supposed to last?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Not more than twenty days," she answered.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But you," I said, "have been here thirty days!"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: She looked at me and smiled proudly. "But I," she said, "only eat one
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: meal a day. Do you not see how thin I am?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The realization that any one in this scientifically fed city could be
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: hungry was to me appalling. Yet here was a girl living amidst luxurious
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: beauty, upon whom society was using the old argument of hunger to force
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: her acceptance of the love of man.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I rose and held out my hand. "You shall eat again today," I said.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I would rather not," she demurred. "I have not yet accepted favours
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: from any man."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But you must. You are hungry," I protested. "The problem of your
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: existence here cannot be put off much longer. We will go eat and then we
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: will try and find some solution."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Without further objection she walked with me. We found a secluded booth
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: in a dining hall. I ordered the best dinner that Berlin had to offer.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: During the intervals of silence in our rather halting dinner
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: conversation, I wrestled with the situation. I had desired to gain
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: insight into the lives of these girls. Yet now that the opportunity was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: presented I did not altogether relish the role in which it placed me.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The apparent innocence of the confiding girl seemed to open an easy way
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: for a personal conquest--and yet, perhaps because it was so obvious and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: easy, I rebelled at the unfairness of it. To rescue her, to aid her to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: escape--in a free world one might have considered these more obvious
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: moves, but here there was no place for her to escape to, no higher
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: social justice to which appeal could be made. Either I must accept her
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: as a personal responsibility, with what that might involve, or desert
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: her to her fate. Both seemed cowardly--yet such were the horns of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: dilemma and a choice must be made. Here at least was an opportunity to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: make use of the funds that lay in the bank to the credit of the name I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: bore, and for which I had found so little use. So I decided to offer her
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: money, and to insist that it was not offered as the purchase price
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of love.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "You must let me help you," I said, "you must let me give you money."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But I do not want your money," she replied. "It would only postpone my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: troubles. Even if I do accept your money, I would have to accept money
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: from other men also, for you cannot pay for the whole of a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: woman's living."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Why not," I asked, "does any rule forbid it?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "No rule, but can so young a man as you afford it?"
