title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: ponder over the wonders of the great unknown world. Moreover, I no
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: longer felt so grievously concerned, for the calamity which had
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: overshadowed her had been for the while removed. And I had, too, my own
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: struggle to cherish her innocence, and that without the usual help
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: extended by conventional society. So I made brave resolutions and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: explained the urgency of my work and insisted that I could not see her
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: for five days.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Hungrily she pleaded for a quicker return; and I stubbornly resisted the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: temptation. "No," I insisted, "not tomorrow, nor the next day, but I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: will come back in three days at the same hour that I came tonight."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Then taking her in my arms, I kissed her in feverish haste and tore
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: myself from the enthralling lure of her presence.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: When I reached the cafe the following evening to keep my appointment
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: with Zimmern, the waiter directed me to one of the small enclosed
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: booths. As I entered, closing the door after me, I found myself
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: confronting a young woman.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Are you Col. Armstadt?" she asked with a clear, vibrant voice. She
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: smiled cordially as she gave me her hand. "I am Marguerite. Dr. Zimmern
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: has gone to bring Col. Hellar, and he asked me to entertain you until
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: his return."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The friendly candour of this greeting swept away the grey walls of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Berlin, and I seemed again face to face with a woman of my own people.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: She was a young woman of distinctive personality. Her features, though
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: delicately moulded, bespoke intelligence and strength of character that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I had not hitherto seen in the women of Berlin. Framing her face was a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: luxuriant mass of wavy brown hair, which fell loosely about her
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: shoulders. Her slender figure was draped in a cape of deep blue
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: cellulose velvet.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Dr. Zimmern tells me," I said as I seated myself across the table from
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: her, "that you are a dear friend of his."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: A swift light gleamed in her deep brown eyes. "A very dear friend," she
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: said feelingly, and then a shadow flitted across her face as she added,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Without him life for me would be unbearable here."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "And how long, if I may ask, have you been here?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "About four years. Four years and six days, to be exact. I can keep
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: count you know," and she smiled whimsically, "for I came on the day of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: my birth, the day I was sixteen."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "That is the same for all, is it not?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "No one can come here before she is sixteen," replied Marguerite, "and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: all must come before they are eighteen."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But why did you come at the first opportunity?" I asked, as I mentally
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: compared her confession with that of Bertha who had so courageously
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: postponed as long as she could the day of surrender to this life of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: shamefully commercialized love.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "And why should I not come?" returned Marguerite. "I had a chance to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: come, and I accepted it. Do you think life in the school for girls of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: forbidden birth is an enjoyable one?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I wanted to press home the point of my argument, to proclaim my pride in
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Bertha's more heroic struggle with the system, for this girl with whom I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: now conversed was obviously a woman of superior intelligence, and it
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: angered me to know that she had so easily surrendered to the life for
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: which German society had ordained her. But I restrained my speech, for I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: realized that in criticizing her way of life I would be criticizing her
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: obvious relation to Zimmern, and like all men I found myself inclined to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: be indulgent with the personal life of a man who was my friend.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Moreover, I perceived the presumptuousness of assuming a superior air
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: towards an established and accepted institution. Yet, strive as I might
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to be tolerant, I felt a growing antagonism towards this attractive and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: cultured girl who had surrendered without a struggle to a life that to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: me was a career of shame--and who seemed quite content with her
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: surrender.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Do you like it here?" I asked, knowing that my question was stupid, but
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: anxious to avoid a painful gap in what was becoming, for me, a difficult
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: conversation.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Marguerite looked at me with a queer penetrating gaze. "Do I like it
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: here?" she repeated. "Why should you ask, and how can I answer? Can I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: like it or not like it, when there was no choice for me? Can I push out
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the walls of Berlin?"--and she thrust mockingly into the air with a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: delicately chiselled hand--"It is a prison. All life is a prison."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Yes," I said, "it is a prison, but life on this level is more joyful
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: than on many others."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Her lip curled in delicate scorn. "For you men--of course--and I suppose
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: it is for these women too--perhaps that is why I hate it so, because
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: they do enjoy it, they do accept it. They sell their love for food and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: raiment, and not one in all these millions seems to mind it."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "In that," I remarked, "perhaps you are mistaken. I have not come here
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: often as most men do, but I have found one other who, like you, rebels
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: at the system--who in fact, was starving because she would not sell
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: her love."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Marguerite flashed on me a look of pitying suspicion as she asked: "Have
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: you gone to the Place of Records to look up this rebel against the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: sale of love?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: A fire of resentment blazed up in me at this question. I did not know
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: just what she meant by the Place of Records, but I felt that this woman
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: who spoke cynically of rebellion against the sale of love, and yet who
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: had obviously sold her love to an old man, was in no position to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: discredit a weaker woman's nobler fight.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "What right," I asked coldly, "have you to criticize another whom you do
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: not know?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I am sorry," replied Marguerite, "if I seem to quarrel with you when I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: was left here to entertain you, but I could not help it--it angers me to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: have you men be so fond of being deceived, such easy prey to this
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: threadbare story of the girl who claims she never came here until forced
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to do so. But men love to believe it. The girls learn to use the story
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: because it pays."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: A surge of conflicting emotion swept through me as I recalled the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: child-like innocence of Bertha and compared it with the critical
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: scepticism of this superior woman. "It only goes to show," I thought,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "what such a system can do to destroy a woman's faith in the very
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: existence of innocence and virtue."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Marguerite did not speak; her silence seemed to say: "You do not
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: understand, nor can I explain--I am simply here and so are you, and we
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: have our secrets which cannot be committed to words."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: With idle fingers she drummed lightly on the table. I watched those
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: slender fingers and the rhythmic play of the delicate muscles of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: bare white arm that protruded from the rich folds of the blue velvet
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: cape. Then my gaze lifted to her face. Her downcast eyes were shielded
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: by long curving lashes; high arched silken brows showed dark against a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: skin as fresh and free from chemist's pigment as the petal of a rose. In
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: exultant rapture my heart within me cried that here was something fine
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of fibre, a fineness which ran true to the depths of her soul.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: In my discovery of Bertha's innocence and in my faith in her purity and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: courage I had hoped to find relief from the spiritual loneliness that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: had grown upon me during my sojourn in this materialistic city. But that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: faith was shaken, as the impression Bertha had made upon my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: over-sensitized emotions, now dimmed by a brighter light, flickered pale
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: on the screen of memory. The mere curiosity and pity I had felt for a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: chance victim singled out among thousands by the legend of innocence on
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: a pretty face could not stand against the force that now drew me to this
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: woman who seemed to be not of a slavish race--even as Dr. Zimmern seemed
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: a man apart from the soulless product of the science he directed. But as
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I acknowledged this new magnet tugging at the needle of my floundering
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: heart, I also realized that my friendship for the lovable and courageous
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Zimmern reared an unassailable barrier to shut me into outer darkness.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The thought proved the harbinger of the reality, for Dr. Zimmerman
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: himself now entered. He was accompanied by Col. Hellar of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Information Staff, a man of about Zimmern's age. Col. Hellar bore
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: himself with a gracious dignity; his face was sad, yet there gleamed
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: from his eye a kindly humor.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Marguerite, after exchanging a few pleasantries with Col. Hellar and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: myself, tenderly kissed the old doctor on the forehead, and slipped out.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "You shall see much of her," said Zimmern, "she is the heart and fire of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: our little group, the force that holds us together. But tonight I asked
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: her not to remain"--the old doctor's eyes twinkled with merriment,--"for
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: a young man cannot get acquainted with a beautiful woman and with ideas
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: at the same time."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "And now," said Zimmern, after we had finished our dinner, "I want Col.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Hellar to tell you more of the workings of the Information Service."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "It is a very complex system," began Hellar. "It is old. Its history
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: goes back to the First World War, when the military censorship began by
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: suppressing information thought to be dangerous and circulating
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: fictitious reports for patriotic purposes. Now all is much more
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: elaborately organized; we provide that every child be taught only the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: things that it is decided he needs to know, and nothing more. Have you
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: seen the bulletins and picture screens in the quarters for the workers?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Yes," I replied, "but the lines were all in old German type."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "And that," said Hellar, "is all that the workers and soldiers can read.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The modern type could be taught them in a few days, but we see to it
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that they have no opportunity to learn it. As it is now, should they
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: find or steal a forbidden book, they cannot read it."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But is it not true," I asked, "that at one time the German workers were
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: most thoroughly educated?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "It is true," said Hellar, "and because of that universal education
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Germany was defeated in the First World War. The English contaminated
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the soldiers by flooding the trenches with democratic literature dropped
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: from airplanes. Then came the Bolshevist regime in Russia with its
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: passion for revolutionary propaganda. The working men and soldiers read
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: this disloyal literature and they forced the abdication of William the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Great. It was because of this that his great grandson, when the House of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Hohenzollern was restored to the throne, decided to curtail universal
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: education.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But while William III curtailed general education he increased the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: specialized education and established the Information Staff to supervise
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the dissemination of all knowledge."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "It is an atrocious system," broke in Zimmern, "but if we had not
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: abolished the family, curtailed knowledge and bred soldiers and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: workers from special non-intellectual strains this sunless world of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: ours could not have endured."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Quite so," said Hellar, "whether we approve of it or not certainly
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: there was no other way to accomplish the end sought. By no other plan
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: could German isolation have been maintained."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But why was isolation deemed desirable?" I enquired.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Because," said Zimmern, "it was that or extermination. Even now we who
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: wish to put an end to this isolation, we few who want to see the world
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: as our ancestors saw it, know that the price may be annihilation."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "So," repeated Hellar, "so annihilation for Germany, but better so--and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: yet I go on as Director of Information; Dr. Zimmern goes on as Chief
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Eugenist; and you go on seeking to increase the food supply, and so we
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: all go on as part of the diabolic system, because as individuals we
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: cannot destroy it, but must go on or be destroyed by it. We have riches
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: here and privileges. We keep the labourers subdued below us, Royalty
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: enthroned above us, and the World State at bay about us, all by this
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: science and system which only we few intellectuals understand and which
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: we keep going because we can not stop it without being destroyed by
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the effort."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But we shall stop it," declared Zimmern, "we must stop it--with
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Armstadt's help we can stop it. You and I, Hellar, are mere cogs; if we
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: break others can take our places, but Armstadt has power. What he knows
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: no one else knows. He has power. We have only weakness because others
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: can take our place. And because he has power let us help him find
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: a way."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "It seems to me," I said, "that the way must be by education. More men
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: must think as we do."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But they can not think," replied Hellar, "they have nothing to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: think with."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But the books," I said, "there is power in knowledge."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But," said Hellar, "the labourer can not read the forbidden book and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the intellectual will not, for if he did he would be afraid to talk
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: about it, and what a man can not talk about he rarely cares to read. The
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: love or hatred of knowledge is a matter of training. It was only last
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: week that I was visiting a boy's school in order to study the effect of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: a new reader of which complaint had been made that it failed
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: sufficiently to exalt the virtue of obedience. I was talking with the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: teacher while the boys assembled in the morning. We heard a great
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: commotion and a mob of boys came in dragging one of their companions who
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: had a bruised face and torn clothing. "Master, he had a forbidden book,"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: they shouted, and the foremost held out the tattered volume as if it
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: were loathsome poison. It proved to be a text on cellulose spinning.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Where the culprit had found it we could not discover but he was sent to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the school prison and the other boys were given favours for
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: apprehending him."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But how is it," I asked, "that books are not written by free-minded
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: authors and secretly printed and circulated?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: At this question my companions smiled. "You chemists forget," said
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Hellar, "that it takes printing presses to make books. There is no press
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: in all Berlin except in the shops of the Information Staff. Every paper,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: every book, and every picture originates and is printed there. Every
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: news and book distributor must get his stock from us and knows that he
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: must have only in his possession that which bears the imprint for his
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: level. That is why we have no public libraries and no trade in
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: second-hand books.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "In early life I favoured this system, but in time the foolishness of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the thing came to perplex, then to annoy, and finally to disgust me. But
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I wanted the money and honour that promotion brought and so I have won
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to my position and power; with my right hand I uphold the system and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: with my left hand I seek to pull out the props on which it rests. For
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: twenty years now I have nursed the secret traffic in books and risked my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: life many times thereby, yet my successes have been few and scattered.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Every time the auditors check my stock and accounts I tremble in fear,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: for embezzling books is more dangerous than embezzling credit at
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the bank."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But who," I asked, "write the books?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "For the technical books it is not hard to find authors," explained
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Hellar, "for any man well schooled in his work can write of it. But the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: task of getting the more general books written is not so easy. For then
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: it is not so much a question of the author knowing the things of which
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: he writes but of knowing what the various groups are to be permitted
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to know.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "That writing is done exclusively by especially trained workers of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Information Service. I myself began as such a writer and studied long
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: under the older masters. The school of scientific lying, I called it,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: but strange to say I used to enjoy such work and did it remarkably well.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: As recognition of my ability I was commissioned to write the book 'God's
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Anointed.' Through His Majesty's approval of my work I now owe my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: position on the Staff.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "His Majesty," continued Hellar, "was only twenty-six years of age when
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: he came to the throne, but he decided at once that a new religious book
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: should be written in which he would be proclaimed as 'God's Anointed
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: ruler of the World.'
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I had never before spoken with the high members of the Royal House, and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I was trembling with eagerness and fear as I was ushered into His
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Majesty's presence. The Emperor sat at his great black table; before him
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: was an old book. He turned to me and said, 'Have you ever heard of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Christian Bible?'
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "My Chief had informed me that the new book was to be based on the old
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Bible that the Christians had received from the Hebrews. So I said,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: 'Yes, Your Majesty, I am familiar with many of its words.'
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "He looked at me with a gloating suspicion. 'Ah, ha,' he said, 'then
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: there is something amiss in the Information Service--you are in the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: third rank of your service and the Bible is permitted only to the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: first rank.'
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I saw that my statement unless modified would result in an embarrassing
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: investigation. 'I have never read the Christian Bible,' I said, 'but my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: mother must have read it for when as a child I visited her she quoted to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: me long passages from the Bible.'
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "His Majesty smiled in a pleased fashion. 'That is it,' he said, 'women
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: are essentially religious by nature, because they are trusting and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: obedient. It was a mistake to attempt to stamp out religion. It is the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: doctrine of obedience. Therefore I shall revive religion, but it shall
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: be a religion of obedience to the House of Hohenzollern. The God of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Hebrews declared them to be his chosen people. But they proved a servile
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and mercenary race. They traded their swords for shekels and became a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: byword and a hissing among the nations--and they were scattered to the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: four corners of the earth. I shall revive that God. And this time he
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: shall chose more wisely, for the Germans shall be his people. The idea
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: is not mine. William the Great had that idea, but the revolution swept
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: it away. It shall be revived. We shall have a new Bible, based upon the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: old one, a third dispensation, to replace the work of Moses and Jesus.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: And I too shall be a lawgiver--I shall speak the word of God.'"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Hellar paused; a smile crept over his face. Then he laughed softly and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to himself--but Dr. Zimmern only shook his head sadly.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Yes, I wrote the book," continued Hellar. "It required four years, for
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: His Majesty was very critical, and did much revising. I had a long
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: argument with him over the question of retaining Hell. I was bitterly
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: opposed to it and represented to His Majesty that no religion had ever
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: thrived on fear of punishment without a corresponding hope of reward.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: 'If you are to have no Heaven,' I insisted, 'then you must have
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: no Hell.'
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "'But we do not need Heaven,' argued His Majesty, 'Heaven is
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: superfluous. It is an insult to my reign. Is it not enough that a man is
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: a German, and may serve the House of Hohenzollern?'
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "'Then why,' I asked, 'do you need a Hell?' I should have been shot for
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that but His Majesty did not see the implication. He replied coolly:
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "'We must have a Hell because there is one way that my subjects can
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: escape me. It is a sin of our race that the Eugenics Office should have
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: bred out--but they have failed. It is an inborn sin for it is chiefly
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: committed by our children before they come to comprehend the glory of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: being German. How else, if you do not have a Hell in your religion, can
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: you check suicide?'
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Of course there was logic in his contention and so I gave in and made
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the Children's Hell. It is a gruesome doctrine, that a child who kills
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: himself does not really die. It is the one thing in the whole book that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: makes me feel most intellectually unclean for writing it. But I wrote it
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and when the book was finished and His Majesty had signed the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: manuscript, for the first time in over a century we printed a bible on a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: German press. The press where the first run was made we named 'Old
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Gutenberg.'"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Gutenberg invented the printing press," explained Zimmern, fearing I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: might not comprehend.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Yes," said Hellar with a curling lip, "and Gutenberg was a German, and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: so am I. He printed a Bible which he believed, and I wrote one which I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: do not believe."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But I am glad," concluded Hellar as he arose, "that I do not believe
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Gutenberg's Bible either, for I should very much dislike to think of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: meeting him in Paradise."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: After taking leave of my companions I walked on alone, oblivious to the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: gay throng, for I had many things on which to ponder. In these two men I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: felt that I had found heroic figures. Their fund of knowledge, which
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: they prized so highly, seemed to me pitifully circumscribed and limited,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: their revolutionary plans hopelessly vague and futile. But the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: intellectual stature of a man is measured in terms of the average of his
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: race, and, thus viewed, Zimmern and Hellar were intellectual giants of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: heroic proportions.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: As I walked through a street of shops. I paused before the display
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: window of a bookstore of the level. Most of these books I had previously
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: discovered were lurid-titled tales of licentious love. But among them I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: now saw a volume bearing the title "God's Anointed," and recalled that I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: had seen it before and assumed it to be but another like its fellows.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Entering the store I secured a copy and, impatient to inspect my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: purchase, I bent my steps to my favourite retreat in the nearby Hall of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Flowers. In a secluded niche near the misty fountain I began a hasty
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: perusal of this imperially inspired word of God who had anointed the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Hohenzollerns masters of the earth. Hellar's description had prepared me
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: for a preposterous and absurd work, but I had not anticipated anything
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: quite so audacious could be presented to a race of civilized men, much
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: less that they could have accepted it in good faith as the Germans
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: evidently did.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "God's Anointed," as Hellar had scoffingly inferred, not only proclaimed
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the Germans as the chosen race, but also proclaimed an actual divinity
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of the blood of the House of Hohenzollern. That William II did have some
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: such notions in his egomania I believe is recorded in authentic history.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: But the way Eitel I had adapted that faith to the rather depressing
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: facts of the failure of world conquest would have been extremely comical
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to me, had I not seen ample evidence of the colossal effect of such a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: faith working in the credulous child-mind of a people so utterly devoid
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of any saving sense of humour.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Not unfamiliar with the history of the temporal reign of the Popes of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the middle ages, I could readily comprehend the practical efficiency of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: such a mixture of religious faith with the affairs of earth. For the God
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of the German theology exacted no spiritual worship of his people, but
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: only a very temporal service to the deity's earthly incarnation in the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: form of the House of Hohenzollern.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The greatest virtue, according to this mundane theology, was obedience,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and this doctrine was closely interwoven with the caste system of German
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: society. The virtue of obedience required the German to renounce
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: discontent with his station, and to accept not only the material status
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: into which he was born, with science aforethought, but the intellectual
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: limits and horizons of that status. The old Christian doctrine of heresy
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: was broadened to encompass the entire mental life. To think forbidden
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: thoughts, to search after forbidden knowledge, that was at once treason
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: against the Royal House and rebellion against the divine plan.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: German theology, confounding divine and human laws, permitted no dual
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: overlapping spheres of mundane and celestial rule as had all previous
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: religious and, social orders since Christ had commanded his disciples to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Render unto Caesar--" There could be no conscientious objection to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: German law on religious grounds; no problem of church and state, for the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: church was the state.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: In this book that masqueraded as the word of God, I looked in vain for
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: some revelation of future life. But it was essentially a one-world
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: theology; the most immortal thing was the Royal House for which the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: worker was asked to slave, the soldier to die that Germany might be
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: ruled by the Hohenzollerns and that the Hohenzollerns might sometime
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: rule the world.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: As the freedom of conscience and the institution of marriage had been
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: discarded so this German faith had scrapped the immortality of the soul,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: save for the single incongruous doctrine that a child taking his own
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: life does not die but lives on in ceaseless torment in a ghoulish
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Children's Hell.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: As I closed the cursed volume my mind called up a picture of Teutonic
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: hordes pouring from the forests of the North and blotting out what
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Greece and Rome had builded. From thence my roving fancy tripped over
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the centuries and lived again with men who cannot die. I stood with
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Luther at the Diet of Worms. With Kant I sounded the deeps of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: philosophy. I sailed with Humboldt athwart uncharted seas. I fought with
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Goethe for the redemption of a soul sold to the Devil. And with Schubert
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and Heine I sang:
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: _Du bist wie eine Blume,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: So hold und schoen und rein,_
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: _Betend dass Gott dich erhalte,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: So rein und schoen und hold._
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: But what a cankerous end was here. This people which the world had once
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: loved and honoured was now bred a beast of burden, a domesticated race,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: saddled and trained to bear upon its back the House of Hohenzollern as
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the ass bore Balaam. But the German ass wore the blinders that science
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: had made--and saw no angel.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: As I sat musing thus and gazing into the spray of the fountain I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: glimpsed a grey clad figure, standing in the shadows of a viney bower.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Although I could not distinguish her face through the leafy tracery I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: knew that it was Bertha, and my heart thrilled to think that she had
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: returned to the site of our meeting. Thoroughly ashamed of the faithless
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: doubts that I had so recently entertained of her innocence and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: sincerity, I arose and hastened toward her. But in making the detour
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: about the pool I lost sight of the grey figure, for she was standing
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: well back in the arbour. As I approached the place where I had seen her
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I came upon two lovers standing with arms entwined in the path at the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: pool's edge. Not wishing to disturb them, I turned back through one of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the arbours and approached by another path. As I slipped noiselessly
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: along in my felt-soled shoes I heard Bertha's voice, and quite near,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: through the leafy tracery, I glimpsed the grey of her gown.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Why with your beauty," came the answering voice of a man, "did you not
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: find a lover from the Royal Level?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Because," Bertha's voice replied, "I would not accept them. I could not
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: love them. I could not give myself without love."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But surely," insisted the man, "you have found a lover here?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But I have not," protested the innocent voice, "because I have sought
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: none."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Now long have you been here?" bluntly asked the man.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Thirty days," replied the girl.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Then you must have found a lover, your debut fund would all be gone."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But," cried Bertha, in a tearful voice, "I only eat one meal a day--do
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: you not see how thin I am?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Now that's clever," rejoined the man, "come, I'll accept it for what it
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: is worth, and look you up afterwards," and he laughingly led her away,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: leaving me undiscovered in the neighbouring arbour to pass judgment on
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: my own simplicity.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: As I walked toward the elevator, I was painfully conscious of two ideas.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: One was that Marguerite had been quite correct with her information
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: about the free women who found it profitable to play the role of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: maidenly innocence. The other was that Dr. Zimmern's precious geography
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: was in the hands of the artful, child-eyed hypocrite who had so cleverly
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: beguiled me with her role of heroic virtue. Clearly, I was trapped, and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to judge better with what I had to deal I decided to go at once to the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Place of Records, of which I had twice heard.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The Place of Records proved to be a public directory of the financial
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: status of the free women. Since the physical plagues that are propagated
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: by promiscuous love had been completely exterminated, and since there
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: were no moral standards to preserve, there was no need of other
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: restrictions on the lives of the women than an economic one.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The rules of the level were prominently posted. As all consequential
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: money exchanges were made through bank checks, the keeping of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: records was an easy matter. These rules I found forbade any woman to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: cash checks in excess of one thousand marks a month, or in excess of two
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: hundred marks from any one man. That was simple enough, and I smiled as
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I recalled that I had gone the legal limit in my first adventure.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Following the example of other men, I stepped to the window and gave the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: name: "Bertha 34 R 6." A clerk brought me a book opened to the page of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: her record. At the top of the page was entered this statement, "Bred for
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: an actress but rejected for both professional work and maternity because
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: found devoid of sympathetic emotions." I laughed as I read this, but
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: when on the next line I saw from the date of her entrance to the level
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that Bertha's thirty days was in reality nearly three years, my mirth
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: turned to anger. I looked down the list of entries and found that for
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: some time she had been cashing each month the maximum figure of a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: thousand marks. Evidently her little scheme of pensive posing in the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Hall of Flowers was working nicely. In the current month, hardly half
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: gone, she already had to her credit seven hundred marks; and last on the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: list was my own contribution, freshly entered.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "She has three hundred marks yet," commented the clerk.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Yes, I see,"--and I turned to go. But I paused and stepped again to the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: window. "There is another girl I would like to look up," I said, "but I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: have only her name and no number."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Do you know the date of her arrival?" asked the clerk.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Yes, she has been here four years and six days. The name is
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Marguerite."

title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

title: City of Endless Night

text: as The Day of the Sun.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: From the conversation of my assistants I gathered that this was an
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: birthday, and was celebrated by permitting the favoured classes to see
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the ruler himself at the Place in the Sun. For this Royal exhibition I

author: Hastings, Milo

author: Hastings, Milo

title: City of Endless Night

title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Voice, and not merely the reproducing horns."

author: Hastings, Milo

title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that the meteorologist of the Roof Observatory reported that the sun

author: Hastings, Milo

author: Hastings, Milo

text: puzzling to me. For the Place in the Sun was clearly located on the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Royal Level and some hundred metres beneath the roof of the city.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I went, at the hour announced on my ticket, to the indicated elevator;
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and, with an eager crowd of fellow scientists, stepped forth into a vast
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

title: City of Endless Night

title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: levels of the city.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: packed and standing, the multitude extended to the sides and the rear of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: my position for many hundred metres until it seemed quite lost under the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: glowing lights in the distance. Before us a huge curtain hung.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Emblazoned on its dull crimson background of subdued socialism was a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: gigantic black eagle, the leering emblem of autocracy. Above and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: extending back over us, appeared in the ceiling a deep and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: unlighted crevice.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

author: Hastings, Milo

title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

author: Hastings, Milo

title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: white, and on his head he wore a helmet of burnished platinum. Before
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

author: Hastings, Milo

author: Hastings, Milo

title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: From ten thousand throats came forth another raucous shout.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Two and a half centuries ago," now spoke His Majesty, "God appointed
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the German race, under William the Great, of the House of Hohenzollern,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to be the rulers of the world.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "For nineteen hundred years, God in his infinite patience, had awaited
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the outcome of the test of the Nazarene's doctrine of servile humility
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and effeminate peace. But the Christian nations of the earth were
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: weighed in the balance of Divine wrath and found wanting. Wallowing in
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: hypocrisy and ignorance, wanting in courage and valour; behind a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: pretence of altruism they cloaked their selfish greed for gold.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Of all the people of the earth our race alone possessed the two keys to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: power, the mastery of science and the mastery of the sword. So the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Germans were called of God to instil fear and reverence into the hearts
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of the inferior races. That was the purpose of the First World War under
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: my noble ancestor, William II.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But the envious nations, desperate in their greed, banded together to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: defy our old German God, and destroy His chosen people. But this was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: only a divine trial of our worth, for the plans of God are for eternity.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: His days to us are centuries. And we did well to patiently abide the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: complete unfoldment of the Divine plan.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Before two generations had passed our German ancestors cast off the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: yoke of enslavement and routed the oppressors in the Second World War.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Lest His chosen race be contaminated by the swinish herds of the mongrel
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: nations God called upon His people to relinquish for a time the fruits
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of conquest, that they might be further purged by science and become a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: pure-bred race of super-men.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "That purification has been accomplished for every German is bred and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: trained by science as ordained by God. There are no longer any mongrels
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: among the men of Germany, for every one of you is created for his
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: special purpose and every German is fitted for his particular place as a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: member of the super-race.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "The time now draws near when the final purpose of our good old German
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: God is to be fulfilled. The day of this fulfilment is known unto me. The
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: sun which shines upon this throne is but a symbol of that which has been
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: denied you while all these things were being made ready. But now the day
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: draws near when you shall, under my leadership, rule over the world and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the mongrel peoples. And to each of you shall be given a place in
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the sun."

text: I had ceased my poetic visioning and was looking into Marguerite's face.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The light of worship I saw in her eyes filled me with a strange
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: trembling and holy awe.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "And I saw only blackness," she faltered. "Is it that I am born blind
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and you with vision?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Perhaps what you call vision is only memory," I said--but, as I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: realized where my words were leading, I hastened to add--"Memory, from
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: another life. Have you ever heard of such a thing as the reincarnation
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of the soul?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "That means," she said hesitatingly, "that there is something in us that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: does not die--immortality, is it not?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Well, it is something like that," I answered huskily, as I wondered
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: what she might know or dream of that which lay beyond the ken of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: gross materialism of her race. "Immortality is a very beautiful idea," I

author: Hastings, Milo

text: went on, "and science has destroyed much that is beautiful. But it is a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: German Bible. Surely such a book makes no pretence of being scientific."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

title: City of Endless Night

title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

title: City of Endless Night

title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: was written."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Ah--I see." Marguerite rose and stepped toward the library. "We have a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: book here," she called, "that you have not read, and one that you cannot
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: buy. It will show you the source of Col. Hellar's inspiration."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: She brought out a battered volume. "This book," she stated, "has given
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the inspectors more trouble than any other book in existence. Though
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: they have searched for thirty years, they say there are more copies of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: it still at large than of all other forbidden books combined."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I gazed at the volume she handed me--I was holding a copy of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Christian Bible translated six centuries previous by Martin Luther. It
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: was indeed the very text from which as a boy I had acquired much of my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: reading knowledge of the language. But I decided that I had best not
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: reveal to Marguerite my familiarity with it, and so I sat down and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: turned the pages with assumed perplexity.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "It is a very odd book," I remarked presently. "Have you read it?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Oh, yes," exclaimed Marguerite. "I often read it; I think it is more
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: interesting than all these modern books, but perhaps that is because I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: cannot understand it; I love mysterious things."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "There is too much of it for a man as busy as I am to hope to read," I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: remarked, after turning a few more pages, "and so I had better not
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: begin. Will you not choose something and read it aloud to me?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Marguerite declined at first; but, when I insisted, she took the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: tattered Bible and turned slowly through its pages.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: And when she read, it was the story of a king who revelled with his
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: lords, and of a hand that wrote upon a wall.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Her voice was low, and possessed a rhythm and cadence that transmuted
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the guttural German tongue into musical poetry.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Again she read, of a man who, though shorn of his strength by the wiles
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of a woman and blinded by his enemies, yet pushed asunder the pillars
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of a city.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: At random she read other tales, of rulers and of slaves, of harlots and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of queens--the wisdom of prophets--the songs of kings.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Together we pondered the meanings of these strange things, and exulted
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: in the beauty of that which was meaningless. And so the hours passed;
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the day drew near its close and Marguerite read from the last pages of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the book, of a voice that cried mightily--"Babylon the great is fallen,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: is fallen, and is become the habitation of devils and the hold of every
title: City of Endless Night
