text: CHAPTER VIII
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: FINDING THEREIN ONE RIGHTEOUS MAN I HAVE COMPASSION ON BERLIN
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: My first call upon Marguerite had been followed by other visits when we
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: had talked of books and read together. On these occasions I had
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: carefully suppressed my desire to speak of more personal things. But,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: constantly reminded by my own troubled conscience, I grew fearful lest
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the old doctor should discover that the books were the lesser part of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the attraction that drew me to Marguerite's apartment, and my fear was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: increased as I realized that my calls on Zimmern had abruptly ceased.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Thinking to make amends I went one evening to the doctor's apartment.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I was going out shortly," said Zimmern, as he greeted me. "I have a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: dinner engagement with Hellar on the Free Level. But I still have a little
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: time; if it pleases you we might walk along to our library."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I promptly accepted the invitation, hoping that it would enable me
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: better to establish my relation to Marguerite and Zimmern in a safe
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: triangle of mutual friendship. As we walked, Zimmern, as if he read my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: thoughts, turned the conversation to the very subject that was uppermost
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: in my mind.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I am glad, Armstadt," he said with a gracious smile, "that you and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Marguerite seem to enjoy each other's friendship. I had often wished
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: there were younger men in our group, since her duties as caretaker of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: our books quite forbids her cultivating the acquaintance of any men
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: outside our chosen few. Marguerite is very patient with the dull talk of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: us old men, but life is not all books, and there is much that youth
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: may share."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: For these words of Zimmern's I was quite unprepared. He seemed to be
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: inviting me to make love to Marguerite, and I wondered to what extent
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the prevailing social ethics might have destroyed the finer
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: sensibilities that forbid the sharing of a woman's love.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: When we reached the apartment Marguerite greeted us with a perfect
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: democracy of manner. But my reassurance of the moment was presently
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: disturbed when she turned to Zimmern and said: "Now that you are here, I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: am going for a bit of a walk; I have not been out for two whole days."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Very well," the doctor replied. "I cannot remain long as I have an
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: engagement with Hellar, but perhaps Armstadt will remain until
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: you return."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Then I shall have him all to myself," declared Marguerite with quiet
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: seriousness.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Though I glanced from the old doctor to the young woman in questioning
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: amazement, neither seemed in the least embarrassed or aware that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: anything had been said out of keeping with the customary propriety
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of life.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Marguerite, throwing the blue velvet cape about her bare white
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: shoulders, paused to give the old doctor an affectionate kiss, and with
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: a smile for me was gone.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: For a few moments the doctor sat musing; but when he turned to me it was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to say: "I hope that you are making good use of our precious
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: accumulation of knowledge."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: In reply I assured him of my hearty appreciation of the library.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "You can see now," continued Zimmern, "how utterly the mind of the race
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: has been enslaved, how all the vast store of knowledge, that as a whole
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: makes life possible, is parcelled out for each. Not one of us is
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: supposed to know of those vital things outside our own narrow field.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: That knowledge is forbidden us lest we should understand the workings of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: our social system and question the wisdom of it all. And so, while each
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: is wiser in his own little cell than were the men of the old order, yet
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: on all things else we are little children, accepting what we are taught,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: doing what we are told, with no mind, no souls of our own. Scientists
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: have ceased to be men, and have become thinking machines, specialized
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: for their particular tasks."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "That is true," I said, "but what are we to do about it? You have by
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: these forbidden books acquired a realization of the enslavement of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: race--but the others, all these millions of professional men, are they
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: not hopelessly rendered impotent by the systematic Suppression of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: knowledge?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "The millions, yes," replied Zimmern, "but there are the chosen few; we
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: who have seen the light must find a way for the liberation of all."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Do you mean," I asked eagerly, "that you are planning some secret
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: rebellion--that you hope for some possible rising of the people to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: overthrow the system?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Zimmern looked at me in astonishment. "The people," he said, "cannot
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: rise. In the old order such a thing was possible--revolutions they
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: called them--the people led by heroes conceived passions for liberty.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: But such powers of mental reaction no longer exist in German minds. We
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: have bred and trained it out of them. One might as well have expected
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the four-footed beasts of burden in the old agricultural days to rebel
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: against their masters."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But," I protested, "if the people could be enlightened?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "How," exclaimed Zimmern impatiently, "can you enlighten them? You are
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: young, Armstadt, very young to talk of such things--even if a rebellion
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: was a possibility what would be the gain? Rebellion means disorder--once
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the ventilating machinery of the city and the food processes were
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: disturbed we should all perish in this trap--we should all die of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: suffocation and starvation."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Then why," I asked, "do you talk of this thing? If rebellion is
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: impossible and would, if possible, destroy us all, then is there
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: any hope?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Zimmern paced the floor for a time in silence and then, facing me
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: squarely, he said, "I have confessed to you my dissatisfaction with the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: existing state. In doing this I placed myself in great danger, but I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: risked that and now I shall risk more. I ask you now, Are you with us
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to the end?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Yes," I replied very gravely, "I am with you although I cannot fully
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: understand on what you base your hope."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Our hope," replied Zimmern, "is out there in the world from whence come
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: those flying men who rain bombs on the roof of Berlin and for ever keep
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: us patching it. We must get word to them. We must throw ourselves upon
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the humanity of our enemies and ask them to save us."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But," I questioned, in my excitement, "what can Germany expect of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: enemy? She has made war against the world for centuries--will that world
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: permit Germany to live could they find a way to destroy her?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "As a nation, no, but as men, yes. Men do not kill men as individuals,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: they only make war against a nation of men. As long as Germany is
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: capable of making war against the world so long will the world attempt
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to destroy her. You, Colonel Armstadt, hold in your protium secret the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: power of Germany to continue the war against the world. Because you were
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: about to gain that power I risked my own life to aid you in getting a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: wider knowledge. Because you now hold that power I risk it again by
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: asking you to use it to destroy Germany and save the Germans. The men
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: who are with me in this cause, and for whom I speak, are but a few. The
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: millions materially alive, are spiritually dead. The world alone can
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: give them life again as men. Even though a few million more be destroyed
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: in the giving have not millions already been destroyed? What if you do
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: save Germany now--what does it mean merely that we breed millions more
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: like we now have, soulless creatures born to die like worms in the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: ground, brains working automatically, stamping out one sort of idea,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: like machines that stamp out buttons--or mere mouths shouting like
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: phonographs before this gaudy show of royalty?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But," I said, "you speak for the few emancipated minds; what of all
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: these men who accept the system--you call them slaves, yet are they not
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: content with their slavery, do they want to be men of the world or
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: continue here in their bondage and die fighting to keep up their own
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: system of enslavement?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "It makes no difference what they want," replied Zimmern, in a voice
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that trembled with emotion; "we bred them as slaves to the _kultur_ of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Germany, the thing to do is to stop the breeding."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But how," I asked, "can men who have been beaten into the mould of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: ox ever be restored to their humanity?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "The old ones cannot," sighed Zimmern; "it was always so; when a people
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: has once fallen into evil ways the old generation can never be wholly
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: redeemed, but youth can always be saved--youth is plastic."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But the German race," I said, "has not only been mis-educated, it has
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: been mis-bred. Can you undo inheritance? Can this race with its vast
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: horde of workers bred for a maximum of muscle and a minimum of brains
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: ever escape from that stupidity that has been bred into the blood?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "You have been trained as a chemist," said Zimmern, "you despair of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: future because you do not understand the laws of inheritance. A
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: specialized type of man or animal is produced from the selection of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: extreme individuals. That you know. But what you do not know is that the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: type once established does not persist of its own accord. It can only be
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: maintained by the rigid continuance of the selection. The average
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: stature of man did not change a centimetre in a thousand years, till we
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: came in with our meddlesome eugenics. Leave off our scientific meddling
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and the race will quickly revert to the normal type.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "That applies to the physical changes; in the mental powers the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: restoration will be even more rapid, because we have made less change in
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the psychic elements of the germ plasm. The inborn capacity of the human
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: brain is hard to alter. Men are created more nearly equal than even the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: writers of democratic constitutions have ever known. If the World State
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: will once help us to free ourselves from these shackles of rigid caste
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and cultured ignorance, this folly of scientific meddling with the blood
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and brains of man, there is yet hope for this race, for we have changed
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: far less than we pretend, in the marrow we are human still."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The old man sank back in his chair. The fire in his soul had burned out.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: His hand fumbled for his watch. "I must leave you now," he said;
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Marguerite should be back shortly. From her you need conceal nothing.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: She is the soul of our hopes and our dreams. She keeps our books safe
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and our hearts fine. Without her I fear we should all have given up
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: long ago."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: And alone too with my conflicting and troubled emotions. He was a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: lovable soul, ripe with the wisdom of age, yet youthful in his hopes to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: redeem his people from the curse of this unholy blend of socialism and
title: City of Endless Night

text: nightmare of man's millennial dream.

title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: capable of a realization of their humanity. To this query there could be
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: no answer, but of one conclusion I was certain, it was not my place to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: ask what these people wanted, for their power to decide was destroyed by
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the infernal process of their making--but here at least, my democratic
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: training easily gave the answer that Dr. Zimmern had achieved by sheer
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: genius, and my answer was that for men whose desire for liberty has been
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: destroyed, liberty must be thrust upon them.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: But it remained for me to work out a plan for so difficult a salvation.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Of this I was now assured that I need no longer work alone, for as I had
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: long suspected, Dr. Zimmern and his little group of rebellious souls
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: were with me. But what could so few do amidst all the millions? My
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: answer, like Zimmern's, was that the salvation of Germany lay in the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: enemies' hands--and I alone was of that enemy. Yet never again could I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: pray for the destruction of the city at the hands of the outraged
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: god--Humanity. And I thought of Sodom and Gomorrah which the God of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Abraham had agreed to spare if there be found ten righteous men therein.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: From these far-reaching thoughts my mind was drawn sharply back to the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: fact of my presence in Marguerite's apartment and the realization that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: she would shortly return to find me there alone. I resented the fact
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that the old doctor and the young woman could conspire to place me in
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: such a situation. I resented the fact that a girl like Marguerite could
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: be bound to a man three times her age, and yet seem to accept it with
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: perfect grace. But I resented most of all the fact that both she and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Zimmern appeared to invite me to share in a triangle of love, open and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: unashamed.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: My bitter brooding was disturbed by the sound of a key turning in the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: lock, and Marguerite, fresh and charming from the exhilaration of her
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: walk, came into the room.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I am so glad you remained," she said. "I hope no one else comes and we
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: can have the evening to ourselves."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "It seems," I answered with a touch of bitterness, "that Dr. Zimmern
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: considers me quite a safe playmate for you."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: At my words Marguerite blushed prettily. "I know you do not quite
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: understand," she said, "but you see I am rather peculiarly situated. I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: cannot go out much, and I can have no girl friends here, and no men
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: either except those who are in this little group who know of our books.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: And they, you see, are all rather old, mostly staff officers like the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: doctor himself, and Col. Hellar. You rank quite as well as some of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: others, but you are ever so much younger. That is why the doctor thinks
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: you are so wonderful--I mean because you have risen so high at so early
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: an age--but perhaps I think you are rather wonderful just because you
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: are young. Is it not natural for young people to want friends of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: their own age?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "It is," I replied with ill-concealed sarcasm.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Why do you speak like that?" asked Marguerite in pained surprise.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Because a burnt child dreads the fire."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I do not understand," she said, a puzzled look in her eyes. "How could
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: a child be burned by a fire since it could never approach one. They only
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: have fires in the smelting furnaces, and children could never go
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: near them."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Despite my bitter mood I smiled as I said: "It is just a figure of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: speech that I got out of an old book. It means that when one is hurt by
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: something he does not want to be hurt in the same way again. You
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: remember what you said to me in the cafe about looking up the girl who
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: played the innocent role? I did look her up, and you were right about
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: it. She has been, here three years and has a score of lovers."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "And you dropped her?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Of course I dropped her."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "And you have not found another?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "No, and I do not want another, and I had not made love to this girl
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: either, as you think I had; perhaps I would have done so, but thanks to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: you I was warned in time. I may be even younger than you think I am,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: young at least in experience with the free women of Berlin. This is the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: second apartment I have ever been in on this level."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Why do you tell me this?" questioned Marguerite.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Because," I said doggedly, "because I suppose that I want you to know
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that I have spent most of my time in a laboratory. I also want you to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: know that I do not like the artful deceit that you all seem to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: cultivate."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "And do you think I am trying to deceive you?" cried Marguerite
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: reproachfully.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Your words may be true," I said, "but the situation you place me in is
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: a false one. Dr. Zimmern brings me here that I may read your books. He
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: leaves me alone here with you and urges me to come as often as I choose.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: All that is hard enough, but to make it harder for me, you tell me that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: you particularly want my company because you have no other young
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: friends. In fact you practically ask me to make love to you and yet you
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: know why I cannot."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: In the excitement of my warring emotions I had risen and was pacing the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: floor, and now as I reached the climax of my bitter speech, Marguerite,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: with a choking sob, fled from the room.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Angered at the situation and humiliated by what I had said, I was on the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: point of leaving at once. But a moment of reflection caused me to turn
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: back. I had forced a quarrel upon Marguerite and the cause for my anger
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: she perhaps did not comprehend. If I left now it would be impossible to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: return, and if I did not come back, there would be explanations to make
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to Zimmern and perhaps an ending of my association with him and his
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: group, which was not only the sole source of my intellectual life
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: outside my work, but which I had begun to hope might lead to some
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: enterprise of moment and possibly to my escape from Berlin.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: So calming my anger, I turned to the library and doggedly pulled down a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: book and began scanning its contents. I had been so occupied for some
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: time, when there was a ring at the bell. I peered out into the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: reception-room in time to see Marguerite come from another door. Her
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: eyes revealed the fact that she had been crying. Quickly she closed the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: door of the little library, shutting me in with the books. A moment
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: later she came in with a grey-haired man, a staff officer of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: electrical works. She introduced us coolly and then helped the old man
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: find a book he wanted to take out, and which she entered on her records.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: After the visitor had gone Marguerite again slipped out of the room and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: for a time I despaired of a chance to speak to her before I felt I must
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: depart. Another hour passed and then she stole into the library and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: seated herself very quietly on a little dressing chair and watched me as
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I proceeded with my reading.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I asked her some questions about one of the volumes and she replied with
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: a meek and forgiving voice that made me despise myself heartily. Other
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: questions and answers followed and soon we were talking again of books
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: as if we had no overwhelming sense of the personal presence of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: each other.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The hours passed; by all my sense of propriety I should have been long
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: departed, but still we talked of books without once referring to my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: heated words of the earlier evening.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: She had stood enticingly near me as we pulled down the volumes. My heart
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: beat wildly as she sat by my side, while I mechanically turned the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: pages. The brush of her garments against my sleeve quite maddened me. I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: had not dared to look into her eyes, as I talked meaningless,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: bookish words.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Summoning all my self-control, I now faced her. "Marguerite," I said
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: hoarsely, "look at me."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: She lifted her eyes and met my gaze unflinchingly, the moisture of fresh
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: tears gleaming beneath her lashes.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Forgive me," I entreated.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "For what?" she asked simply, smiling a little through her tears.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "For being a fool," I declared fiercely, "for believing your cordiality
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: toward me as Dr. Zimmern's friend to mean more than--than it
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: should mean."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But I do not understand," she said. "Should I not have told you that I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: liked you because you were young? Of course if you don't want me
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to--to--" She paused abruptly, her face suffused with a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: delicate crimson.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I stepped toward her and reached out my arms. But she drew back and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: slipped quickly around the table. "No," she cried, "no, you have said
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that you did not want me."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But I do," I cried. "I do want you."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Then why did you say those things to me?" she asked haughtily.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I gazed at her across the narrow table. Was it possible that such a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: woman had no understanding of ideals of honour in love? Could it be that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: she had no appreciation of the fight I had waged, and so nearly lost, to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: respect the trust and confidence that the old doctor had placed in me.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: With these thoughts the ardour of my passion cooled and a feeling of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: pity swept over me, as I sensed the tragedy of so fine a woman ethically
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: impoverished by false training and environment. Had she known honour,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and yet discarded it, I too should have been unable to resist the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: impulse of youth to deny to age its less imperious claims.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: But either she chose artfully to ignore my struggle or she was truly
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: unaware of it. In either case she would not share the responsibility for
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the breach of faith. I was puzzled and confounded.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: It was Marguerite who broke the bewildering silence. "I wish you would
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: go now," she said coolly; "I am afraid I misunderstood."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "And shall I come again?" I asked awkwardly.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: She looked up at me and smiled bravely. "Yes," she said, "if--you are
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: sure you wish to."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: A resurge of passionate longing to take her in my arms swept over me,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: but she held out her hand with such rare and dignified grace that I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: could only take the slender fingers and press them hungrily to my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: fevered lips and so bid her a wordless adieu.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: But despite wild longing to see her again, I did not return to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Marguerite's apartment for many weeks. A crisis in my work at the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: laboratory denied me even a single hour of leisure outside brief
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: snatches of food and sleep.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I had previously reported to the Chemical Staff that I had found means
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to increase materially the extraction percentage of the precious element
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: protium from the crude imported ore. I had now received word that I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: should prepare to make a trial demonstration before the Staff.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Already I had revealed certain results of my progress to Herr von Uhl,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: as this had been necessary in order to get further grants of the rare
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: material and of expensive equipment needed for the research, but in
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: these smaller demonstrations, I had not been called upon to disclose my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: method. Now the Staff, hopeful that I had made the great discovery,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: insisted that I prepare at once to make a large scale demonstration and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: reveal the method that it might immediately be adopted for the wholesale
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: extraction in the industrial works.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: If I now gave away the full secret of my process, I would receive
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: compensation that would indeed seem lavish for a man whose mental
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: horizon was bounded by these enclosing walls; yet to me for whom these
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: walls would always be a prison, credit at the banks of Berlin and the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: baubles of decoration and rank and social honour would be sounding
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: brass. But I wanted power; and, with the secret of protium extraction in
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: my possession, I would have control of life or death over three hundred
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: million men. Why should I sacrifice such power for useless credit and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: empty honour? If Eitel I of the House of Hohenzollern would lengthen the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: days of his rule, let him deal with me and meet whatever terms I chose
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to name, for in my chemical retorts I had brewed a secret before which
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: vaunted efficiency and hypocritical divinity could be made to bend a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: hungry belly and beg for food!
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: It was a laudable and rather thrilling ambition, and yet I was not clear
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: as to just what terms I would dictate, nor how I could enforce the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: dictation. To ask for an audience with the Emperor now, and to take any
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: such preposterous stand would merely be to get myself locked up for a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: lunatic. But I reasoned that if I could make the demonstration so that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: it would be accepted as genuine and yet not give away my secret, the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: situation would be in my hands. Yet I was expected to reveal the process
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: step by step as the demonstration proceeded. There was but one way out
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and that was to make a genuine demonstration, but with falsely
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: written formulas.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: To plan and prepare such a demonstration required more genuine invention
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: than had the discovery of the process, but I set about the task with
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: feverish enthusiasm. I kept my assistants busy with the preparation of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the apparatus and the more simple work which there was no need to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: disguise, while night after night I worked alone, altering and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: disguising the secret steps on which my great discovery hinged. As these
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: preparations were nearing completion I sent for Dr. Zimmern and Col.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Hellar to meet me at my apartment.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Comrades," I said, "you have endangered your own lives by confiding in
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: me your secret desires to overthrow the rule of the House of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Hohenzollern as it was overthrown once before. You have done this
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: because you believed that I would have power that others do not have."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The two old men nodded in grave assent.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "And you have been quite fortunate in your choice," I concluded, "for
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: not only have I pledged myself to your ends, but I shall soon possess
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the coveted power. In a few days I shall demonstrate my process on a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: large scale before the Chemical Staff. But I shall do this thing without
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: revealing the method. The formulas I shall give them will be
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: meaningless. As long as I am in charge in my own laboratory the process
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: will be a success; when it is tried elsewhere it will fail, until I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: choose to make further revelations.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "So you see, for a time, unless I be killed or tortured into confession,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I shall have great power. How then may I use that power to help you in
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the cause to which we are pledged?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The older men seemed greatly impressed with my declaration and danced
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: about me and cried with joy. When they had regained their composure
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Zimmern said: "There is but one thing you can do for us and that is to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: find some way to get word of the protium mines to the authorities of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: World State. Berlin will then be at their mercy, but whatever happens
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: can be no worse than the continuance of things as they are."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But how," I said, "can a message be sent from Berlin to the outer
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: world?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "There is only one way," replied Hellar, "and that is by the submarines
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that go out for this ore. The Submarine Staff are members of the Royal
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: House. So, indeed, are the captains. We have tried for years to gain the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: confidence of some of these men, but without avail. Perhaps through your
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: work on the protium ore you can succeed where we have failed."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "And how," I asked eagerly, "do the ore-bringing vessels get from Berlin
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to the sea?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: My visitors glanced at each other significantly. "Do you not know that?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: exclaimed Zimmern. "We had supposed you would have been told when you
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: were assigned to the protium research."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: By way of answer I explained that I knew the source of the ore but not
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the route of its coming.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "All such knowledge is suppressed in books," commented Hellar; "we older
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: men know of this by word of mouth from the days when the submarine
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: tunnel was completed to the sea, but you are younger. Unless this was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: told you at the time you were assigned the work it is not to be expected
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that you would know."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I questioned Hellar and Zimmern closely but found that all they knew was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that a submarine tunnel did exist leading from Berlin somewhere into the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: open sea; but its exact location they did not know. Again I pressed my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: question as to what I could do with the power of my secret and they
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: could only repeat that they staked their hopes on getting word to the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: outer world by way of submarines.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Much as I might admire the strength of character that would lead men to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: rebel against the only life they knew because they sensed that it was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: hopeless, I now found myself a little exasperated at the vagueness of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: their plans. Yet I had none better. To defy the Emperor would merely be
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to risk my life and the possible loss of my knowledge to the world.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Perhaps after all the older heads were wiser than my own rebellious
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: spirit; and so, without making any more definite plans, I ended the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: interview with a promise to let them know of the outcome of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: demonstration.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Returning once more to my work I finished my preparations and sent word
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to the Chemical Staff that all was ready. They came with solemn faces.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The laboratory was locked and guards were posted. The place was examined
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: thoroughly, the apparatus was studied in detail. All my ingredients were
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: tested for the presence of extracted protium, lest I be trying to "salt
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the mine." But happily for me they accepted my statement as to their
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: chemical nature in other respects. Then when all had been approved the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: test lot of ore was run. It took us thirty hours to run the extraction
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and sample and weigh and test the product. But everything went through
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: exactly as I had planned.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: With solemn faces the Chemical Staff unanimously declared that the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: problem had been solved and marvelled that the solution should come from
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the brain of so young a man. And so I received their adulation and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: worship, for I could not give credit to the chemists of the world
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: outside to whom I was really indebted for my seeming miraculous genius.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Telling me to take my rest and prepare myself for an audience with His
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Majesty three days later, the Chemical Staff departed, carrying, with
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: guarded secrecy, my false formulas.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Exultant and happy I left the laboratory. I had not slept for forty
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: hours and scarcely half my regular allotment for many weeks. And yet I was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: not sleepy now but awake and excited. I had won a great victory, and I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: wanted to rejoice and share my conquest with sympathetic ears. I could
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: go to Zimmern, but instead I turned my steps toward the elevator and,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: alighting on the Level of the Free Women, I went straightway to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Marguerite's apartment.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Despite my feeling of exhilaration, my face must have revealed something
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of my real state of exhaustion, for Marguerite cried in alarm at the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: sight of me.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "A little tired," I replied, in answer to her solicitous questions; "I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: have just finished my demonstration before the Chemical Staff."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "And you won?" cried Marguerite in a burst of joy. "You deceived them
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: just as the doctor said you would. And they know you have solved the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: protium problem and they do not know how you did it?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "That is correct," I said, sinking back into the cushions of the divan.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I have done all that. I came here first to tell you. You see I could
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: not come before, all these weeks, I have had no time for sleep or
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: anything. I would have telephoned or written but I feared it would not
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: be safe. Did you think I was not coming again?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I missed you at first,--I mean at first I thought you were staying away
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: because you did not want to see me, and then Dr. Zimmern told me what
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: you were doing, and I understood--and waited, for I somehow knew you
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: would come as soon as you could."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Yes, of course you knew. Of course, I had to come--Marguerite--" But
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Marguerite faded before my vision. I reached out my hand for her--and it
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: seemed to wave in empty space....
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: When I awoke, I was lying on a couch and a screen bedecked with cupids
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: was standing before me. At first I thought I was alone and then I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: realized that I was in Marguerite's apartment and that Marguerite
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: herself was seated on a low stool beside the couch and gazing at me out
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of dreamy eyes.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "How did I get here?" I asked.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "You fell asleep while you were talking, and then some one came for
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: books, and when the bell rang I hid you with the screen."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "How long have I slept?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "For many hours," she answered.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I ought not to have come," I said, but despite my remark I made no
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: haste to go, but reached out and ran my fingers through her massy hair.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: And then I slowly drew her toward me until her luxuriant locks were
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: tumbled about my neck and face and her head was pillowed on my breast.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I am so happy," she whispered. "I am so glad you came first to me."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: For a moment my reason was drugged by the opiate of her touch; and then,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: as the realization of the circumstances re-formed in my brain, the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: feeling of guilt arose and routed the dreamy bliss. Yet I could only
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: blame myself, for there was no guile in her act or word, nor could I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: believe there was guile in her heart. Gently I pushed her away and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: arose, stating that I must leave at once.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: It was plainly evident that Marguerite did not share my sense of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: embarrassment, that she was aware of no breach of ethics. But her ease
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: only served to impress upon me the greater burden of my responsibility
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and emphasize the breach of honour of which I was guilty in permitting
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: this expression of my love to a woman whom circumstances had bound
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to Zimmern.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Pleading need for rest and for time to plan my interview with His
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Majesty, I hastened away, feeling that I dare not trust myself alone
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: with her again.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I returned to my own apartment, and when another day had passed, food
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and sleep had fully restored me to a normal state. I then recalled my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: promise to inform Hellar and Zimmern of the outcome of my demonstration.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I called at Zimmern's quarters but he was not at home. Hence I went to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: call on Hellar, to ask of Zimmern's whereabouts.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I have an appointment to meet him tonight," said Hellar, "on the Level
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of Free Women. Will you not come along?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I could not well do otherwise than accept, and Hellar led me again to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the apartment from which I had fled twenty-four hours before. There we
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: found Zimmern, who received me with his usual graciousness.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I have already heard from Marguerite," said Zimmern, "of your success."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I glanced apprehensively at the girl but she was in no wise disturbed,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and proceeded to relate for Hellar's information the story of my coming
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to her exhausted from my work and of my falling asleep in her apartment.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: All of them seemed to think it amusing, but there was no evidence that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: any one considered it the least improper. Their matter-of-fact attitude
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: puzzled and annoyed me; they seemed to treat the incident as if it had
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: been the experience of a couple of children.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: This angered me, for it seemed proof that they considered Marguerite's
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: love as the common property of any and all.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Could it be," I asked myself, "that jealousy has been bred and trained
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: out of this race? Is it possible they have killed the instinct that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: demands private and individual property in love?" Even as I pondered the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: problem it seemed answered, for as I sat and talked with Zimmern and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Hellar of my chemical demonstration and the coming interview with His
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Majesty, Marguerite came and seated herself on the arm of my chair and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: pillowed her head on my shoulder.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Troubled and embarrassed, yet not having the courage to repulse her
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: caresses, I stared at Zimmern, who smiled on us with indulgence. In fact
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: it seemed that he actually enjoyed the scene. My anger flamed up against
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: him, but for Marguerite I had only pity, for her action seemed so
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: natural and unaffected that I could not believe that she was making
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: sport of me, and could only conclude that she had been so bred in the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: spirit of the place that she knew nothing else.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: My talk with the men ended as had the last one, without arriving at any
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: particular plan of action, and when Hellar arose first to go, I took the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: opportunity to escape from what to me was an intolerable situation.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I separated from Hellar and for an hour or more I wandered on the level.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Then resolving to end the strain of my enigmatical position I turned
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: again toward Marguerite's apartment. She answered my ring. I entered and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: found her alone.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Marguerite," I began, "I cannot stand this intolerable situation. I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: cannot share the love of a woman with another man--I cannot steal a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: woman's love from a man who is my friend--"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: At this outburst Marguerite only stared at me in puzzled amazement.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Then you do not want me to love you," she stammered.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "God knows," I cried, "how I do want you to love me, but it must not be
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: while Dr. Zimmern is alive and you--"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "So," said a voice--and glancing up I saw Zimmern himself framed in the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: doorway of the book room. The old doctor looked from me to Marguerite,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: while a smile beamed on his courtly countenance.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Sit down and calm yourself, Armstadt," said Zimmern. "It is time I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: spoke to you of Marguerite and of the relation I bear to her. As you
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: know, I brought her to this level from the school for girls of forbidden
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: birth. But what you do not know is that she was born on the Royal Level.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I knew Marguerite's mother. She was Princess Fedora, a third cousin of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the Empress. I was her physician, for I have not always been in the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Eugenic Service. But Marguerite was born out of wedlock, and the mother
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: declined to name the father of her child. Because of that the child was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: consigned to the school for forbidden love-children, which meant that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: she would be fated for the life of a free woman and become the property
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of such men as had the price to pay.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "When her child was taken away from her, the mother killed herself; and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: because I declined to testify as to what I knew of the case I lost my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: commission as a physician of Royalty. But still having the freedom of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the school levels, I was permitted to keep track of Marguerite. As soon
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: as she reached the age of her freedom I brought her here, and by the aid
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of her splendid birth and the companionship of thinking men she has
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: become the woman you now find her."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: In my jealousy I had listened to the first words of the old doctor with
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: but little comprehension. But as he talked on so calmly and kindly an
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: eager hope leaped up within me. Was it possible that it had been I who
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: had misunderstood--and that Zimmern's love for Marguerite was of another
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: sort than mine?
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Tensely I awaited his further words, but I did not dare to look at
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Marguerite, who had taken her place beside him.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I brought her here," Zimmern continued, "for there was no other place
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: where she could go except into the keeping of some man. I have given her
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the work of guarding our books, and for that I could have well afforded
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to pay for her living.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "You find in Marguerite a woman of intelligence, and there are few
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: enough like her. And she finds in you a man of rare gifts, and you are
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: both young, so it is not strange that you two should love each other.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: All this I considered before I brought you here to meet her. I was happy
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: when Marguerite told me that it was so. But your happiness is marred,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: because you, Armstadt, think that I am in the way; you have believed
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that I bear the relation to Marguerite that the fact of my paying for
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: her presence on this level would imply.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "It speaks well of your honour," the doctor went on, "that you have felt
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: as you did. I should have explained sooner, but I did not wish to speak
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of this until it was necessary to Marguerite's happiness. But now that I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: have spoken there is nothing to stand in the way of your happiness, for
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Marguerite is as worthy of your love as if she had but made her debut on
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the Royal Level to which she was born. As for what is to be between you,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I can only leave it to the best that is in yourselves, and whatever that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: may be has my blessing."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: As I listened to the doctor's words entranced with rapture, the vision
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of Marguerite floated hazily before my eyes as if she were an ethereal
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: essence that might, at any moment, be snatched away. But as the doctor's
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: words ceased my eyes met Marguerite's and all else seemed to fade but
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the love light that shone from out their liquid depths.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Forgetting utterly the presence of the man whose words had set us free,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: our hearts reached out with hungry arms to claim their own.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: For us, time lost her reckoning amidst our tears and kisses, and when my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: brain at last made known to me the existence of other souls than ours, I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: looked up and found that we were alone. A saucy little clock ticked
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: rhythmically on a mantel. I felt an absurd desire to smash it, for the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: impudent thing had been running all the while.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: CHAPTER IX
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: IN WHICH I SALUTE THE STATUE OF GOD AND A PSYCHIC
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: EXPERT EXPLORES MY BRAIN AND FINDS NOTHING
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The Chemical Staff called for me at my laboratory to conduct me to the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: presence of the Emperor. At the elevator we were met by an electric
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: vehicle manned fore and aft by pompous guards. Through the wide, high
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: streets we rolled noiselessly past the decorated facades of the spacious
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: apartments that housed the seventeen thousand members of the House of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Hohenzollern.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: At times the ample streets broadened into still more roomy avenues where
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: potted trees alternated with the frescoed columns, and beyond which were
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: luxurious gardens and vast statuary halls. On the Level of Free Women
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the life was one of crowded revelry, of the bauble and delights of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: carnival, but on the Royal Level there was an atmosphere of luxurious
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: leisure, with vast spaces given over to the privacy of aristocratic
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: idleness.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: An occasional vehicle rolled swiftly past us on the glassy smoothness of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the pavement; more rarely lonely couples strolled among the potted trees
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: or sat in dreamy indolence beside the fountains. There was no crowding,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: no mass of humanity, no narrow halls, no congested apartments. All
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: structure here was on a scale of magnificent size and distances, while
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: by comparison the men and women appeared dwarfed, but withal distinctive
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: in their costumes and regal in their leisurely idleness.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: After some kilometres of travel we came to His Majesty's palace, which
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: stood detached from all other enclosed structures and was surrounded on
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: all sides by ever-necessary columns that seemed like a forest of tree
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: trunks spaced and distanced in geometrical design.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: As we approached the massive doorway of the palace, our party paused,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and stood stiffly erect. Before us were two colossal statues of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: glistening white crystal. My fellow scientists faced one of the figures,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: which I recognized as that of William II, and I, a little tardily,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: saluted with them. And now we turned sharply on our heels and saluted
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the second figure of these twin German heroes. For German it was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: unmistakably in every feature, save for the one oddity that the Teutonic
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: face wore a flowing beard not unlike that of Michael Angelo's Moses. As
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: we moved forward my eye swept in the lettering on the pedestal, _"Unser
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Alte Deutche Gott,"_ and I was aware that I had acknowledged my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: allegience to the supreme war lord--I had saluted the Statue of God.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Entering the palace we were conducted through a long hall-way hung with
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: floral tapestries. We passed through several great metal doors guarded
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: by stalwart leaden-faced men and came at last into the imperial audience
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: room, where His Majesty, Eitel I, satellited by his ministers, sat stiff
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and upright at the head of the council table.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Though he had seemed a small man when I had seen him in the dazzling
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: beam of the reflected sunlight, I now perceived that he was of more than
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: average stature. He wore no crown and no helmet, but only a crop of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: stiff iron grey hair brushed boldly upright. His face was stern, his
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: nose beak-like, and his small eyes grey and piercing. Over the high back
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of his chair was thrown his cape, and he was clad in a jacket of white
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: cellulose velvet buttoned to the throat with large platinum buttons.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Formally presented by one of the secretaries we made our stiff bows and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo
