text: were seated at the table facing His Majesty across the unlittered
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: surface of black glass.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The Emperor nodded to the Chief of the Chemical Staff who arose and read
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the report of my solution of the protium problem. He ended by advising
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that the process should immediately replace the one then in use in the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: extraction of the ore in the industrial works and that I was recommended
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: for promotion to the place to be vacated by the retiring member of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Chemical Staff and should be given full charge of the protium industry.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Emperor Eitel listened with solemn nods of approval. When the reading
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: was finished he arose and proclaimed the retirement with honour, and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: because of his advanced age, of Herr von Uhl. The old chemist now
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: stepped forward and the Emperor removed from von Uhl's breast the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: insignia of active Staff service and replaced it with the insignia of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: honourable retirement.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: In my turn I also stood before His Majesty, who when he had pinned upon
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: my breast the Staff insignia said: "I hereby commission you as Member of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the Chemical Staff and Director of the Protium Works. Against the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: fortune, to be accredited to you and your descendants, you are
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: authorized to draw from the Imperial Bank a million marks a year. That
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: you shall more graciously befit this fortune I confer upon you the title
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of 'von' and the social privilege of the Royal Level."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: When the formal ceremonies were ended I again arose and addressed the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Emperor. "Your Majesty," I said, as I looked unflinchingly at his iron
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: visage, "I beg leave to make a personal petition."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "State it," commanded the Emperor.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I wish to ask that you restore to the Royal Level a girl who is now in
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the Level of the Free Women, and known there as Marguerite 78 K 4, but
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: who was born on the Royal Level as a daughter of Princess Fedora of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the House of Hohenzollern."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: A hush of consternation fell upon those about the table.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Your petition," said the Emperor, "cannot be granted."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Then," I said, speaking with studied emphasis, "I cannot proceed with
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the work of extracting protium."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: An angry cloud gathered on the face of Eitel I. "Herr von Armstadt," he
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: said, "the title and awards which have just been conferred upon you are
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: irrevocable. But if you decline to perform the duties of your office
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: those duties can be performed by others."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But others cannot perform them," I replied. "The demonstration I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: conducted was genuine, but the formulas I have given were not genuine.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The true formulas for my method of extracting protium are locked within
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: my brain and I will reveal them only when the petition I ask has
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: been granted."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: At these words the Emperor pounded on the table with a heavy fist. "What
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: does this mean?" he demanded of the Chemical Staff.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "It is a lie," shouted the Chief of the Staff. "We have the formulas and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: they are correct, for we saw the demonstration conducted with the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: ingredients stated in the formulas which Armstadt gave us."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Very well," I cried; "go try your formulas; go repeat the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: demonstration, if you can."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The Emperor, glaring his rage, punched savagely at a signal button on
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the arm of his chair.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Two palace guards answered the summons. "Arrest this man," shouted His
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Majesty, "and keep him in close confinement; permit him to see no one."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Without further ado I was led off by the guards, while the Emperor
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: shouted imprecations at the Chemical Staff.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The place to which I was conducted was a suite of rooms in a remote
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: corner of the Royal Palace. There was a large bedroom and bath, and a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: luxurious study or lounging room. Here I found a case of books, which
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: proved to be novels bearing the imprint of the Royal Level.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Despite the comfortable surroundings, it was evident that I was securely
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: imprisoned, for the door was of metal, the ventilating gratings were
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: long narrow slits, and the walls were of heavy concrete--and there being
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: no windows, no bars were needed. Any living apartment in the city would
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: have served equally well the jailor's purpose; for it were only
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: necessary to turn a key from without to make of it a cell in this
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: gigantic prison of Berlin.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The regular appearance of my meals by mechanical carrier was the only
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: way I had to reckon the passing of time, for it had chanced that I had
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: forgotten my watch when dressing for the audience with His Majesty. I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: wrestled with unmeasured time by perusing the novels which gave me
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: fragmentary pictures of the social life on the Royal Level.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: As I turned over the situation in my mind I reassured myself that the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: secrecy of my formulas was impregnable. The discovery of the process had
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: been rendered possible by knowledge I had brought with me from the outer
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: world. The reagents that I had used were synthetic substances, the very
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: existence of which was unknown to the Germans. I had previously prepared
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: these compounds and had used and completely destroyed them in making the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: demonstration, while I had taken pains to remove all traces of their
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: preparation. Hence I had little to fear of the Chemical Staff
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: duplicating my work, though doubtless they were making desperate efforts
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to do so, and my imprisonment was very evidently for the purpose of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: permitting them to make that effort.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: On that score I felt that I had played my cards well, but there were
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: other thoughts that troubled me, chief of which was a fear that some
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: investigation might be set on foot in regard to Marguerite and that her
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: guardianship of the library of forbidden books might be discovered. With
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: this worry to torment me, the hours dragged slowly enough.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I had been some five days in this solitary confinement when the door
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: opened and a man entered. He wore the uniform of a physician and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: introduced himself as Dr. Boehm, explaining that he had been sent by His
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Majesty to look after my health. The idea rather amused me; at least, I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: thought, the Emperor had decided that the secrets of my brain were well
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: worth preservation, and I reasoned that this was evidence that the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Chemical Staff had made an effort to duplicate my work and had reported
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: their failure to do so.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The doctor made what seemed to me a rather perfunctory physical
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: examination, which included a very minute inspection of my eyes. Then he
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: put me through a series of psychological test queries. When he had
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: finished he sighed deeply and said: "I am sorry to find that you are
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: suffering from a disturbed balance of the altruistic and the egotistic
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: cortical impulses; it is doubtless due to the intensive demands made upon
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the creative potential before you were completely recovered from the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: sub-normal psychosis due to the gas attack in the potash mines."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: This diagnosis impressed me as a palpable fraud, but I became genuinely
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: alarmed at the mention of the affair at the potash mines. I was somewhat
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: reassured at the thought that this reference was probably a part of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: record of Karl Armstadt, which was doubtless on file at the medical
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: headquarters, and had been looked up by Dr. Boehm who was in need of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: making out a plausible case for some purpose--perhaps that of confining
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: me permanently on the grounds of insanity. Whatever might be the move on
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: foot it was clearly essential for me to keep myself cool and well
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: in hand.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The doctor, after eyeing me calmly for a few moments, said: "It will be
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: necessary for me to go out for a time and secure apparatus for a more
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: searching examination. Meanwhile be assured you will not be further
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: neglected. In fact, I shall arrange for the time to share your apartment
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: with you, as loneliness will aggravate your derangement."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: In a few hours the doctor returned. He brought with him a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: complicated-looking apparatus and was followed by two attendants
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: carrying a bed.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The doctor pushed the apparatus into the corner, and, after seeing his
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: bed installed in my sleeping chamber, dismissed the attendants and sat
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: down and began to entertain me with accounts of various cases of mental
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: derangement that had come under his care. So far as I could determine
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: his object, if he had any other than killing time, it was to impress me
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: with the importance of submitting graciously to his care.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Tiring of these stories of the doctor's professional successes with meek
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and trusting patients, I took the management of the conversation into my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: own hands.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Since you are a psychic expert, Dr. Boehm, perhaps you can explain to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: me the mental processes that cause a man to prize a large bank credit
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: when there is positively no legal way in which he can expend
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the credit."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The doctor looked at me quizzically. "How do you mean," he asked, "that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: there is no legal way in which he can expend the credit?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Well, take my own case. The Emperor has bestowed upon me a credit of a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: million marks a year. But I risked losing it by demanding that a young
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: woman of the Free Level be restored to the Royal Level where she
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: was born."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Of this I am aware," replied the psychic physician. "That is why His
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Majesty became alarmed lest your mental equilibrium be disturbed. It
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: seems to indicate an atavistic reversion to a condition of romantic
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: altruism, but as your pedigree is normal, I deem it merely a temporary
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: loss of balance."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But why," I asked, "do you consider it abnormal at all? Is there
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: evidence of any great degree of unselfishness in a man desiring the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: bestowal of happiness upon a particular woman in preference to bank
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: credit which he cannot expend? What should I do with a million marks a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: year when I have been unable to expend the ten thousand a year I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: have had?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Ah," exclaimed the doctor, the light of a brilliant discovery breaking
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: over his countenance. "Perhaps this in a measure explains your case. You
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: have evidently been so absorbed in your work that you have not
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: sufficiently developed your appetite for personal enjoyment."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Perhaps I have not. But just how should I expend more funds; food,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: clothing, living quarters are all provided me, there is nothing but a few
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: tawdry amusements that one can buy, nor is there any one to give the money
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to--even if a man had children they cannot inherit his wealth. Just what
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: is money for, anyway?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The doctor nodded his head and smiled in satisfaction. "You ask
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: interesting questions," he said. "I shall try to answer them. Money or
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: bank credit is merely a symbol of wealth. In ancient times wealth was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: represented by the private ownership of physical property, which was the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: basis of capitalistic or competitive society. Racial progress was then
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: achieved by the mating of the men of superior brain with the most
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: beautiful women. Women do not appreciate the mental power of man in its
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: direct expression, or even its social use; they can only comprehend that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: power when it is translated into wealth. After the destruction of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: private property women refused to accept as mates the men of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: intellectual power, but preferred instead men of physical strength and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: personal beauty.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "At first this was considered to be a proof of the superiority of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: proletariat. For, with all men economically equal, the beautiful women
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: turned from the anemic intellectual and the sons of aristocracy, to the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: strong arms of labour. Believing themselves to be the source of all
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: wealth, and by that right vested with sole political power, and now
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: finding themselves preferred by the beautiful women, the labourer would
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: soon have eliminated all other classes from human society. Had unbridled
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: socialism with its free mating continued, we should have become merely a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: horde of handsome savages.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Such would have been the destiny of our race had not William III
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: foreseen the outcome and restored war, the blessings of which had been
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: all but lost to the world. The progress of peace depended upon the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: competition of capitalism, but in peace progress is incidental. In war
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: it is essential. Because war requires invention, it saved the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: intellectual classes, and because war requires authority it made
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: possible the restoration of our Royal House. Labour, the tyrant of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: peace, became again the slave of war, and under the plea of patriotic
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: necessity eugenics was established, which again restored the beautiful
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: women to the superior men. And thus by Imperial Socialism the race was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: preserved from deterioriation."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But surely," I said, "eugenics has more than remedied this defect of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: socialism, for the selection of men of superior mentality is much more
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: rigid than it could have been under the capricious matings of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: capitalistic society. Why then this need of wealth?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Eugenics," replied Boehm, "breeds superior children, but eugenic mating
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: is a cold scientific thing which fails to fan the flame of man's
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: ambition to do creative work. That is why we have the Level of Free
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Women and have not bred the virility out of the intellectual group. That
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: is also the reason we have retained the Free Level on a competitive
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: commercial basis, and have given the intellectual man the bank credit, a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: symbol of wealth, that he may use it, as men have always used wealth,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: for the purpose of increasing his importance in the eyes of woman. This
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: function of wealth is psychically necessary to the creative impulse, for
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the power of sexual conquest and the stimulus to creative thought are
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: but different expressions of the same instinct. Wealth, or its symbol,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: is a medium of translating the one into the other. For example, take
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: your discovery; it is important to you and to the state. Your fellow
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: scientists appreciate it, His Majesty appreciates it, but women cannot
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: appreciate it. But give it a money value and women appreciate it
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: immediately. They know that the unlimited bank credit will give you the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: power to keep as many women on your list as you choose, and this means
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that you can select freely those you wish. So the most attractive women
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: will compete for your preferment. We bow before the Emperor, we salute
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the Statue of God, but we make out our checks to buy baubles for women,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and it is that which keeps the wheels of progress turning."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "So," I said, "this is your philosophy of wealth. I see, and yet I do
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: not see. The legal limit a man may contribute to a woman is but
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: twenty-four hundred marks a year, what then does he want with
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: a million?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But there is no legal limit," replied the Doctor, "to the number of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: women a man may have on his list. His relation to them may be the most
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: casual, but the pursuit is stimulating to the creative imagination. But
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: you forget, Herr von Armstadt, that with the compensation that was to be
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: yours goes also the social privilege of the Royal Level. Evidently you
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: have been so absorbed in your research that you had no time to think of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the magnificent rewards for which you were working."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Then perhaps you will explain them to me."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "With pleasure," said Dr. Boehm; "your social privilege on the Royal
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Level includes the right to marry and that means that you should have
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: children for whom inheritance is permitted. How else did you suppose the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: ever-increasing numbers of the House of Hohenzollern should have
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: maintained their wealth?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "The question has never occurred to me," I answered, "but if it had, I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: should have supposed that their expenses were provided by appropriations
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: from the state treasury."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Dr. Boehm chuckled. "Then they should all be dependents on the state
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: like cripples and imbeciles. It would be a rather poor way to derive the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: pride of aristocracy. That can only come from inherited wealth: the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: principle is old, very old. The nobleman must never needs work to live.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Then, if he wishes to give service to the state, he may give it without
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: pay, and thus feel his nobility. You cannot aspire to full social
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: equality with the Royal House both because you lack divinity of blood
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and because you receive your wealth for that which you have yourself
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: given to the state. But because of your wealth you will find a wife of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the Royal House, and she will bear you children who, receiving the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: divine blood of the Hohenzollerns from the mother and inherited wealth
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: from the father, will thus be twice ennobled. To have such children is a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: rare privilege; not even Herr von Uhl with his thousands of descendants
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: can feel such a pride of paternity.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "It is well, Herr von Armstadt, that you talked to me of these matters.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Should you be restored to your full mental powers and be permitted to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: assume the rights of your new station, it would be most unfortunate if
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: you should seem unappreciative of these ennobling privileges."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Then, if I may, I shall ask you some further questions. It seems that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the inherited incomes of the Royal Level are from time to time
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: reinforced by marriage from without. Does that not dilute the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Royal blood?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "That question," replied Dr. Boehm, "more properly should be addressed
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to a eugenist, but I shall try to give you the answer. The blood of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: House of Hohenzollern is of a very high order for it is the blood of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: divinity in human veins. Yet since there is no eugenic control, no
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: selection, the quality of that blood would deteriorate from inbreeding,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: were there no fresh infusion. Then where better could such blood come
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: than from the men of genius? No man is given the full social privilege
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of the Royal Level except he who has made some great contribution to the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: state. This at once marks him as a genius and gives his wealth a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: noble origin."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But how is it," I asked, "that this addition of men from without does
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: not disturb the balance of the sexes?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "It does disturb it somewhat," replied the doctor, "but not seriously,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: for genius is rare. There are only a few hundred men in each generation
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: who are received into Royal Society. Of course that means some of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: young men of the Royal Level cannot marry. But some men decline marriage
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of their own free will; if they are not possessed of much wealth they
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: prefer to go unmarried rather than to accept an unattractive woman as a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: wife when they may have their choice of mistresses from the most
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: beautiful virgins intended for the Free Level. There is always an
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: abundance of marriageable women on the Royal Level and with your wealth
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: you will have your choice. Your credit, in fact, will be the largest
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that has been granted for over a decade."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "All that is very splendid," I answered. "I was not well informed on
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: these matters. But why should His Majesty have been so incensed at my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: simple request for the restoration of the rights of the daughter of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Princess Fedora?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Your request was unusual; pardon if I may say, impudent; it seems to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: imply a lack of appreciation on your part of the honours freely
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: conferred upon you--but I daresay His Majesty did not realize your
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: ignorance of these things. You are very young and you have risen to your
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: high station very quickly from an obscure position."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "And do you think," I asked, "that if you made these facts clear to him,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: he would relent and grant my request?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Dr. Boehm looked at me with a penetrating gaze. "It is not my function,"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: he said, "to intercede for you. I have only been commissioned to examine
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: carefully the state of your mentality."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I smiled complacently at the psychic expert. "Now, doctor," I said, "you
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: do not mean to tell me that you really think there is anything wrong
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: with my mentality?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: A look of craftiness flashed from Boehm's eyes. "I have given you my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: diagnosis," he said, "but it may not be final. I have already
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: communicated my first report to His Majesty and he has ordered me to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: remain with you for some days. If I should alter that opinion too
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: quickly it would discredit me and gain you nothing. You had best be
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: patient, and submit gracefully to further examination and treatment."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "And do you know," I asked, "what the chemical staff is doing about my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: formulas?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "That is none of my affair," declared Boehm, emphatically.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: There was a vigour in his declaration and a haste with which he began to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: talk of other matters that gave me a hint that the doctor knew more of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the doings of the chemical staff than he cared to admit, but I thought
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: it wise not to press the point.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The second day of Boehm's stay with me, he unmantled his apparatus and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: asked me to submit to a further examination. I had not the least
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: conception of the purpose of this apparatus and with some misgivings I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: lay down on a couch while the psychic expert placed above my eyes a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: glass plate, on which, when he had turned on the current, there
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: proceeded a slow rhythmic series of pale lights and shadows. At the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: doctor's command I fixed my gaze upon the lights, while he, in a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: monotonous voice, urged me to relax my mind and dismiss all
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: active thought.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: How long I stood for this infernal proceeding I do not know. But I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: recall a realization that I had lost grip on my thoughts and seemed to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: be floating off into a misty nowhere of unconsciousness. I struggled
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: frantically to regain control of myself; and, for what seemed an
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: eternity, I fought with a horrible nightmare unable to move a muscle or
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: even close my eyelids to shut out that sickening sequence of creeping
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: shadows. Then I saw the doctor's hand reaching slowly toward my face. It
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: seemed to sway in its stealthy movement like the head of a serpent
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: charming a bird, but in my helpless horror I could not ward it off.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: At last the snaky fingers touched my eyelids as if to close them, and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that touch, light though it was, served to snap the taut film of my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: helpless brain and I gave a blood-curdling yell and jumped up, knocking
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: over the devilish apparatus and nearly upsetting the doctor.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Calm yourself," said Boehm, as he attempted to push me again toward the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: couch. "There is nothing wrong, and you must surrender to the psychic
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: equilibrator so that I can proceed with the examination."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Examination be damned," I shouted fiercely; "you were trying to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: hypnotize me with that infernal machine."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Boehm did not reply but calmly proceeded to pick up the apparatus and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: restore it to its place in the corner, while I paced angrily about the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: room. He then seated himself and addressed me as I stood against the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: wall glaring at him. "You are labouring under hallucinations," he said.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I fear your case is even worse than I thought. But calm yourself. I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: shall attempt no further examination today."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I resumed a seat but refused to look at him. He did not talk further of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: my supposed mental state, but proceeded to entertain me with gossip of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the Royal Level, and later discussed the novels in the bookcase.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: It was difficult to keep up an open war with so charming a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: conversationalist, but I was thoroughly on my guard. I could now readily
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: see through the whole fraud of my imputed mental derangement. I knew my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: mind was sound as a schoolboy's, and that this pretence of examination
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and treatment was only a blind. Evidently the Chemical Staff had failed
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to work the formulas I had given them and this psychic manipulator had
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: been sent in here to filch the true formulas from my brain with his
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: devilish art. I knew nothing of what progress the Germans might have
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: made with hypnotism, but unless they had gone further than had the outer
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: world, now that I was on my guard, I believed myself to be safe.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: But there was yet one danger. I might be trapped in my sleep by an
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: induced somnambulistic conversation. Happily I was fairly well posted on
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: such things and believed that I could guard against that also. But the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: fear of the thing made me so nervous that I did not sleep all of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: following night.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The doctor, evidently a keen observer, must have detected that fact from
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the sound of my breathing, for the lights were turned out and we slept
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: in the pitchy blackness that only a windowless room can create.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "You did not sleep well," he remarked, as we breakfasted.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: But I made light of his solicitous concern, and we passed another day in
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: casual conversation.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: As the sleeping period drew again near, the doctor said, "I will leave
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: you tonight, for I fear my presence disturbs you because you
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: misinterpret my purpose in observing you."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: As the doctor departed, I noted that the mechanism of the hinges and the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: lock of the door were so perfect that they gave forth no sound. I was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: very drowsy and soon retired, but before I went to sleep I practised
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: snapping off and on the light from the switch at the side of my bed.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Then I repeated over and over to myself--"I will awake at the first
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: sound of a voice."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: This thought ingrained in my subconscious mind proved my salvation. I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: must have been sleeping some hours. I was dreaming of Marguerite. I saw
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: her standing in an open meadow flooded with sunlight; and heard her
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: voice as if from afar. I walked towards her and as the words grew more
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: distinct I knew the voice was not Marguerite's. Then I awoke.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I did not stir but lay listening. The voice was speaking monotonously
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and the words I heard were the words of the protium formulas, the false
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: ones I had given the Chemical Staff.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But these formulas are not correct," purred the voice, "of course, they
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: are not correct. I gave them to the Staff, but they will never know the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: real ones--Yes, the real ones--What are the real ones? Have I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: forgotten--? No, I shall never forget. I can repeat them now." Then the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: voice began again on one of the fake formulas. But when it reached the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: point where the true formula was different, it paused; evidently the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Chemical Staff had found out where the difficulty lay. And so the voice
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: had paused, hoping my sleeping mind would catch up the thread and supply
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the missing words. But instead my arm shot quickly to the switch. The
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: solicitous Doctor Boehm, flooded with a blaze of light, glared
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: blinkingly as I leaped from the bed.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Oh, I was asleep all right," I said, "but I awoke the instant I heard
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: you speak, just as I had assured myself that I would do before I fell
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: asleep. Now what else have you in your bag of tricks?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I only came--" began the doctor.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Yes, you only came," I shouted, "and you knew nothing about the work of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the Chemical Staff on my formulas. Now see here, doctor, you had your
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: try and you have failed. Your diagnosis of my mental condition is just
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: as much a fraud as the formulas on which the Chemical Staff have been
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: wasting their time--only it is not so clever. I fooled them and you have
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: not fooled me. Waste no more time, but go back and report to His Majesty
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that your little tricks have failed."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I shall do that," said Boehm. "I feared you from the start; your mind
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: is really an extraordinary one. But where," he said, "did you learn how
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to guard yourself so well against my methods? They are very secret. My
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: art is not known even to physicians."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "It is known to me," I said, "so run along and get your report ready."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The doctor shook my hand with an air of profound respect and took his
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: leave. This time I balanced a chair overhanging the edge of a table so
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that the opening of the door would push it off, and I lay down and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: slept soundly.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I was left alone in my prison until late the next day. Then came a guard
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: who conducted me before His Majesty. None of the Chemical Staff was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: present. In fact there was no one with the Emperor but a single
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: secretary.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: His Majesty smiled cordially. "It was fitting, Herr von Armstadt, for me
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to order your confinement for your demand was audacious; not that what
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: you asked was a matter of importance, but you should have made the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: request in writing and privately and not before the Chemical Staff. For
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that breach of etiquette I had to humiliate you that Royal dignity might
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: be preserved. As for the fact that you kept the formulas secret, none
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: need know that but the Chemical Staff and they will have nothing further
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to say since you made fools of them." His Majesty laughed.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "As for the request you made, I have decided to grant it. Nor do I blame
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: you for making it. The Princess Marguerite is a very beautiful girl. She
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: is waiting now nearby. I should have sent for her sooner, but it was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: necessary to make an investigation regarding her birth. The unfortunate
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Princess Fedora never confessed the father. But I have arranged that, as
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: you shall see."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The Emperor now pressed his signal button and a door opened and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Marguerite was ushered into the room. I started in fear as I saw that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: she was accompanied by Dr. Zimmern. What calamity of discovery and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: punishment, I wondered, had my daring move brought to the secret rebel
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: against the rule of the Hohenzollern?
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Marguerite stepped swiftly toward me and gave me her hand. The look in
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: her eyes I interpreted as a warning that I was not to recognize Zimmern.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: So I appeared the stranger while the secretary introduced us.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Dr. Zimmern," said His Majesty, "was physician to Princess Fedora at
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the time of the birth of the Princess Marguerite. She confessed to him
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the father of her child. It was the Count Rudolph who died unmarried
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: some years ago. There will be no questions raised. Our society will
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: welcome his daughter, for both the Count Rudolph and the Princess Fedora
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: were very popular."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: During this speech, Dr. Zimmern sat rigid and stared into space. Then
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the secretary produced a document and read a confession to be signed by
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Zimmern, testifying to these statements of Marguerite's birth.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Zimmern, his features still unmoved, signed the paper and handed it
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: again to the secretary.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: His Majesty arose and held out his hand to Marguerite. "I welcome you,"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: he said, "to the House of Hohenzollern. We shall do our best to atone
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: for what you have suffered. And to you, Herr von Armstadt, I extend my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: thanks for bringing us so beautiful a woman. It is my hope that you will
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: win her as a wife, for she will grace well the fortune that your great
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: genius brings to us. But because you have loved her under unfortunate
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: circumstances I must forbid your marriage for a period of two years.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: During that time you will both be free to make acquaintances in Royal
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Society. Nothing less than this would be fair to either of you, or to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: other women that may seek your fortune or to other men who may seek the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: beauty of your princess."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: CHAPTER X
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: A GODDESS WHO IS SUFFERING FROM OBESITY AND
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: A BRAVE MAN WHO IS AFRAID OF THE LAW OF AVERAGES
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: It was not till we had reached Marguerite's apartment that Zimmern
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: spoke. Then he and Marguerite both embraced me and cried with joy.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Ah, Armstadt," said the old doctor, "you have done a wonderful thing, a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: wonderful thing, but why did you not warn us?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Yes," I stammered, "I know. You mean the books. It worried me, but, you
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: see, I did not plan this thing. I did not know what I should do. It came
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to me like a flash as the Emperor was conferring the honours upon me. I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: had hoped to use my power to make him do my bidding, and yet we had
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: contrived no way to use that power in furtherance of our great plans to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: free a race; but I could at least use it to free a woman. Let us hope
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that it augurs progress to the ultimate goal."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "It was very noble, but it was dangerous," replied Zimmern. "It was only
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: through a coincidence that we were saved. Herr von Uhl told me that same
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: day what you had demanded. I saw Hellar immediately and he declared a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: raid on Marguerite's apartment. But he came himself with only one
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: assistant who is in his confidence, and they boxed the books and carted
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: them off. They will be turned in as contraband volumes, but the report
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: will be falsified; no one will ever know from whence they came."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Then the books are lost to you," I said; "of that I am sorry, and I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: worried greatly while I was imprisoned."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Yes," said Zimmern, "we have lost the books, but you have saved
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Marguerite. That will more than compensate. For that I can never thank
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: you enough."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "And you were called into the matter, not," I said, "as Marguerite's
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: friend, but as the physician to her mother?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "They must have looked up the record," replied Zimmern, "but nothing was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: said to me. I received only a communication from His Majesty commanding
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: me as the physician to Marguerite's mother at the time of Marguerite's
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: birth, to make statement as to her fatherhood."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But why," I asked, "did you not make this confession before, since it
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: enabled Marguerite to be restored to her rights?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The old doctor looked pained at the question. "But you forget," he said,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "that it is the power of your secret and not my confession that has
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: restored Marguerite. The confession is only a matter of form, to satisfy
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the wagging tongues of Royal Society."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Do you mean," I asked, "that she will not be well received there
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: because she was born out of wedlock?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Not at all," replied Zimmern; "it was the failure to confess the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: father, not the fact of her unwedded motherhood, that brought the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: punishment. There are many love-children born on the Royal Level and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: they suffer only a failure of inheritance of wealth from the father. But
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: if they be girls of charm and beauty, and if, as Marguerite now stands
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: credited, they be of rich Royal blood, they are very popular and much
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: sought after. But without the record of the father they cannot be
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: admitted into Royal Society, for the record of the blood lines would be
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: lost, and that, you see, is essential. Social precedent, the value in
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the matrimonial market, all rest upon it. Marguerite is indeed
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: fortunate; with His Majesty's signature attesting my confession, she has
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: nothing more to fear. But I daresay they shall try their best to win her
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: from you for some shallow-minded prince."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But when," I asked, "is she to go? His Majesty seemed very gracious,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: but do you realize that I still possess my secret of the protium
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: formulas?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "And do you still hesitate to give them up?" asked Marguerite.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "For your freedom, dear, I shall reveal them gladly."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But," cried Marguerite, "you must not give them up just for me,--if
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: there is any way you can use them for our great plan."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Nothing," spoke up Zimmern, "could be gained now by further secrecy but
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: trouble for us all; and by acceding, both you and Marguerite win your
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: places on the Royal Level, where you can better serve our cause. That
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: is, if you are still with us. It may be harder for you, now that you
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: have won the richest privileges that Germany has to offer, to remember
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: those who struggle in the darkness."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But I shall remember," I said, giving him my hand.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I believe you will," said Zimmern feelingly, "and I know I can count on
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Marguerite. You will both have opportunities to see much of the officers
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of the Submarine Service. The German race may yet be freed from this
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: sunless prison, if you can find one among them who can be won to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: our cause."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I reported the next morning to the Chemical Staff, by whom I was treated
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: with deferential respect. I was immediately installed in my new office,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: as Director of the Protium Works. While I set about supervising the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: manufacture of apparatus for the new process, other members of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: staff, now furnished with the correct formulas repeated the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: demonstration without my assistance.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: When the report of this had been made to His Majesty, I received my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: insignia of the social privilege of the Royal Level and a copy of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Royal Society Bulletin announcing Marguerite's restoration to her place
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: in the House of Hohenzollern, with the title of Princess Marguerite,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Daughter of Princess Fedora and Count Rudolf. The next day a social
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: secretary from the Royal Level came for Marguerite and conducted her to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the Apartments of the Countess Luise, under whose chaperonage she was to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: make her debut into Royal Society.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I, also, was furnished with a social secretary, an obsequious but very
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: wise little man, who took charge of all my affairs outside my chemical
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: work. Under his guidance I was removed to more commodious quarters and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: my wardrobe was supplied with numerous changes all in the uniform of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Chemical Staff. There was little time to spare from my duties in the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Protium Works, but my secretary, ever alert, snatched upon the odd
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: moments to coach me in matters of social etiquette and so prepared me to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: make my first appearance in Royal Society at the grand ball given by the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Countess Luise in honour of Marguerite's debut.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Despite the assiduous coaching of my secretary, my ignorance must have
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: been delightfully amusing to the royal idlers who had little other
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: thought or purpose in life than this very round of complicated
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: nothingness. But if I was a blundering amateur in all this, they were
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: not so much discourteous as envious. They knew that I had won my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: position by my achievements as a chemist and in a vague way they
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: understood that I had saved the empire from impending ruin, and for this
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: achievement I was lionized.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The women rustled about me in their gorgeous gowns and plied me with
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: foolish questions which I had better sense than to try to answer with
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the slightest degree of truth. But their power of sustained interest in
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: such weighty matters was not great and soon the conversation would drift
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: away, especially if Marguerite was about, when the talk would turn to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the romance of her restoration.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: One group of vivacious ladies discussed quite frankly with Marguerite
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the relative advantages of a husband of intellectual genius as compared
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: with one of a high degree of royal blood. Some contended that the added
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: prospect of superior intelligence in the children would offset the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: lowering of their degree of Hohenzollern blood. The others argued quite
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: as persistently that the "blood" was the better investment.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Through such conversation I learned of the two clans within the Royal
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: House. The one prided themselves wholly in the high degree of their
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Hohenzollern blood; the other, styling themselves "Royal Intellectuals"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: because of a greater proportion of outside blood lines, were quite as
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: proud of the fact that, while possessed of sufficient royal blood to be
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: in "the divinity," they inherited supposedly greater intelligence from
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: their mundane ancestors. This latter group, to make good their claims,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: made a great show of intellectuality, and cultivated most persistently a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: dilletante dabbling into all sorts of scientific and artistic matters.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Because of Marguerite's high credit in Royal blood she was courted by
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "purists" by whom I was only tolerated on her account. On the other
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: hand, the "intellectuals" considered me as a great asset for their cause
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and glorified particularly in the prospects of marriage of an outside
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: scientist to an eighty-degree Hohenzollern princess. This rivalry of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: clans of Royal Society made us much sought after and I was flooded with
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: invitations.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: It did not take me long to discover, however, that the reason for my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: popularity was not altogether a matter of respect for my intellectual
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: genius. I had at first been inclined to accept all invitations,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: innocently supposing that I was being feted as an honorary guest. But my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: social secretary advised against this; and, when he began bringing me
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: checks to sign, I realized that the social privileges of Royal Society
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: included the honour of paying the bills for one's own entertainment.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I had already arranged with my banker that a fourth of my income be
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: turned over to Marguerite until her marriage, for she was without income
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of her own, and it was upon my petition that she had been restored to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the Royal Level. At my banker's suggestion I had also made over ten
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: thousand marks a month to the Countess, under whose motherly wing
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Marguerite was being sheltered. I therefore soon discovered that my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: income of a million marks a year would be absorbed quite easily by Royal
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Society. The entire system appeared to me rather sordid, but such
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: matters were arranged by bankers and secretaries and the principals were
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: supposed to be quite innocent of any knowledge of, or concern for,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the details.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The Countess Luise, who was permitted to entertain so lavishly at my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: expense, was playing for the favour of both of the opposing social
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: clans. Possessing a high degree of Hohenzollern blood she stood well
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: with the purists. But her income was not all that could be desired, so
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: she had adroitly discovered in her only son a touch of intellectual
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: genius, and the young man quite dutifully had become a maker of picture
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: plots, hoping by this distinction to win as a wife one of the daughters
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of some wealthy intellectual interloper. At first I had feared the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Countess had designs upon Marguerite as a wife for her son, but as
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Marguerite had no income of her own I saw that in this I was mistaken,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and I developed a feeling of genuine friendliness for the plump and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: cordial Countess.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Do you know what I was reading last night?" I remarked one evening, as
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I chatted with Marguerite and her chaperone.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Some work on obesity, I hope," sparkled the Countess. Like many of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: House of Hohenzollern, among whom there was no weight control, she
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: carried a surplus of adipose tissue not altogether consistent
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: with beauty.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "No, indeed," I said gravely. "Nothing about your material being, but a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: treatise upon your spiritual nature. I was reading an old school book
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that I found among my forgotten relics--a book about the Divinity of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: House of Hohenzollern."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Oh, how jolly!" chuckled the Countess. "How very funny that I never
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: thought before that you, Herr von Armstadt, were once taught all those
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: delightful fables."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "And once believed them too," I lied.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Oh, dear me," replied the Countess, with a ponderous sigh, "so I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: suppose you did. And what a shock I must have been to you with an eighty
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: centimetre waist."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "You are not quite Junoesque," I admitted.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "The more reason you should use your science, Herr Chemist, to aid me to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: recover my goddess form."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "What are you folks talking about?" interrupted Marguerite.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "About our divinity, my dear," replied Luise archly.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But do you feel that it is really necessary," I asked, "that such
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: fables should be put into the helpless minds of children?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "It surely must be. Suppose your own heredity had proven tricky--it does
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: sometimes, you know--and you had been found incapable of scientific
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: thought. You would have been deranked and perhaps made a record
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: clerk--no personal reflections, but such things do happen--and if you
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo
