text: now were filing cards all day you would surely be much happier if you
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: could believe in our divinity. Why else would you submit to a loveless
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: life and the dull routine of toil? Did not all the ancients, and do not
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: all the inferior races now, have objects of religious worship?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But the other races," I said, "do not worship living people but
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: spiritual divinities and the sainted dead.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Quite so," replied the over-plump goddess, "but that is why their
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: _kulturs_ are so inefficient. Surely the worship was useless to the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: spirits and the dead, whereas we find it quite profitable to be
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: worshipped. But for this wonderful doctrine of the divinity of the blood
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of William the Great we should be put to all sorts of inconveniences."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "You might even have to work," I ventured.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The Countess bestowed on me one of her most bewitching smiles. "My dear
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Herr Chemist," she said in sugary tones, "you with your intellectual
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: genius can twit us on our psychic lacks and we must fall back on the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: divine blood of our Great Ancestor--but would you really wish the slaves
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of dull toil to think it as human as their own?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But to me it seems a little gross," I said.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Not at all; on the contrary, it is a master stroke of science and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: efficiency--inferior creatures must worship; they always have and always
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: will--then why waste the worship?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: My position as director of the protium works soon brought me into
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: conference with Admiral von Kufner who was Chief of the Submarine Staff.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Von Kufner was in his forties and his manner indicated greater talent
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: for pomp and ceremony than for administrative work. His grandfather had
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: been the engineer to whose genius Berlin owed her salvation through the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: construction of the submarine tunnel. By this service the engineer had
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: won the coveted "von," a princely fortune and a wife of the Royal Level.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The Admiral therefore carried Hohenzollern blood in his veins, which,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: together with his ample fortune and a distinguished position, made him a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: man of both social and official consequence.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: It did not take me long to decide that von Kufner was hopeless as a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: prospective convert to revolutionary doctrines. Nor did he possess any
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: great knowledge of the protium mines, for he had never visited them.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Inheriting his position as an honour to his grandfather's genius, he
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: commanded the undersea vessels from the security of an office on the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Royal Level, for journeys in ice-filled waters were entirely too
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: dangerous to appeal to one who loved so well the pleasures and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: vanities of life.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I had explained to von Kufner the distinctions I had discovered in the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: various samples of the ore brought from the mines and the necessity of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: having new surveys of the deposits made on the basis of these
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: discoveries. After he had had time to digest this information, I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: suggested that I should myself go to make this survey. But this idea the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Admiral at once opposed, insisting that the trip through the Arctic ice
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: fields was entirely too dangerous.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Very well," I replied. "I feel that I could best serve Germany by going
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to the Arctic mines in person, but if you think that is unwise, will you
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: not arrange for me to consult at once with men who have been in the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: mines and are familiar with conditions there?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: To this very reasonable request, which was in line with my obvious
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: duties, no objection could be made and a conference was at once called
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of submarine captains and furloughed engineers who had been in the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Arctic ore fields.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I was impressed by the youthfulness of these men, which was readily
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: explained by the fact that one vessel out of every five sent out was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: lost beneath the Arctic ice floes. With an almost mathematical certainty
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the men in the undersea service could reckon the years of their lives on
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the fingers of one hand.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Although the official business of the conference related to ore deposits
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and not to the dangers of the traffic, the men were so obsessed with the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: latter fact, that it crept out in their talk in spite of the Admiral's
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: obvious displeasure at such confession of fear. I particularly marked
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the outspoken frankness of one, Captain Grauble, whose vessel was the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: next one scheduled to depart to the mines.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I therefore asked Grauble to call in person at my office for the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: instructions concerning the ore investigations which were to be
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: forwarded to the Director of the Mines. Free from the restraining
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: influence of the Admiral, I was able to lead the Captain to talk freely
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of the dangers of his work, and was overjoyed to find him frankly
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: rebellious.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: That I might still further cultivate his acquaintance I withheld some of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the necessary documents; and, using this as a pretext, I later sought
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: him out at his quarters, which were in a remote and somewhat obscure
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: part of the Royal Level.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The official nature of my call disposed of, I led the conversation into
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: social matters, and found no difficulty in persuading the Captain to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: talk of his own life. He was a man well under thirty and like most of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: his fellows in the service was one of the sons of a branch of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Hohenzollern family whose declining fortune denied him all hope of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: marriage or social life. In the heroic years of his youth he had
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: volunteered for the submarine service. But now he confessed that he
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: regretted the act, for he realized that his death could not be long
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: postponed. He had made his three trips as commander of an
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: ore-bringing vessel.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I have two more trips," declared Captain Grauble. "Such is the prophecy
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of statistical facts: five trips is the allotted life of a Captain; it
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: is the law of averages. It is possible that I may extend that number a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: little, but if so it will be an exception. Trusting to exceptions is a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: poor philosophy. I do not like it. Sometimes I think I shall refuse to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: go. Disgrace, of course,--banishment to the mines. Report my treasonable
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: utterances if you like. I am prepared for that; suicide is easy
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and certain."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But is it not rather cowardly, Captain?" I asked, looking him steadily
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: in the eye.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Grauble flung out his hand with a gesture of disdain. "That is an easy
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: word for you to pronounce," he sneered. "You have hope to live by, you
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: are on the upward climb, you aspire to marry into the Royal House and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: sire children to inherit your wealth. But I was born of the Royal House,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: my father squandered his wealth. My sisters were beautiful and they have
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: married well. My brother was servile; he has attached himself to the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: retinue of a wealthy Baroness. But I was made of better stuff than that.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I would play the hero. I would face danger and gladly die to give Berlin
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: more life and uphold the House of Hohenzollern in its fat and idle
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: existence; and for me they have taken hope away!
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Oh, yes, I was proclaimed a hero. The young ladies of this house of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: idleness dance with me, but they dare not take me seriously; what one of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: them would court the certainty of widowhood without a fortune? So why
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: should I not tire of their shallow trifling? I find among the girls of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the Free Level more honest love, for they, as I, have no hope. They love
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: but for the passing hour, and pass on as I pass on, I to death, they to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: decaying beauty and an old age of servile slavery."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Surely, I exulted, here is the rebellious and daring soul that Zimmern
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and Hellar have sought in vain. Even as they had hoped, I seemed to have
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: discovered a man of the submarine service who was amenable to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: revolutionary ideas. Could I not get him to consider the myriad life of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Berlin in all its barren futility, to grasp at the hope of succour from
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: a free and merciful world, and then, with his aid, find a way out of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Berlin, a way to carry the message of Germany's need of help to the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Great God of Humanity that dwelt without in the warmth and joy of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the sun?
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The tide of hope surged high within me. I was tempted to divulge at once
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: my long cherished plan of escape from Berlin. "Why," I asked, thinking
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to further sound his sincerity, "if you feel like this, have you never
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: considered running your craft to the surface during the sea passage and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: beaching her on a foreign shore? There at least is life and hope and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: experience."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "By the Statue of God!" cried Grauble, his body shaking and his voice
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: quavering, "why do you, in all your hope and comfort here, speak of that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to me? Do you think I have never been tempted to do that very thing? And
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: yet you call me a coward. Have I not breathed foul air for days, fearful
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to poke up our air tube in deserted waters lest by the millionth chance
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: it might lead to a capture? And yet you speak of deliberate surrender!
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Even though I destroyed my charts, the capture of a German submarine in
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: those seas would set the forces of the outer world searching for the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: passage. If they found and blocked the passage I should be guilty of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: destruction of three hundred million lives--Great God! God of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Hohenzollern! God of the World! could this thing be?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Captain," I said, placing my hand on the shoulder of the palsied man,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "you and I have great secrets and the burden of great sorrows in common.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: It is well that we have found each other. It is well that we have spoken
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of these things that shake our souls. You have confessed much to me and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I have much that I shall confess to you. I must see you again before
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: you leave."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Grauble gave me his hand. "You are a strange man," he said. "I have met
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: none before like you. I do not know at what aims you are driving. If you
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: plotted my disgrace by leading me into these confessions, you have found
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: me easy prey. But do not credit yourself too much. I have often vowed I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: would go to Admiral von Kufner, and say these things to him. But the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: formal exterior of that petty pompous man I cannot penetrate. If I have
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: confessed to you, it is merely because you are a man without that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: protecting shield of bristling authority and cold formality. You seemed
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: merely a man of flesh and blood, despite your decorations, and so I have
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: talked. What is to be made of it by you or by me I do not know, but I am
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: not afraid of you."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I shall leave you now," I said, "for I have pressing duties, but I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: shall see you soon again. So calm yourself and get hold of your reason.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I shall want you to think clearly when I talk with you again. Perhaps I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: can yet show you a gleam of hope beyond this mathematical law of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: averages that rattles the dice of death."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: CHAPTER XI
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: IN WHICH THE TALKING DELEGATE IS ANSWERED BY THE
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: ROYAL VOICE AND I LEARN THAT LABOUR KNOWS NOT GOD
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I had delayed in speaking to Grauble of our revolutionary plans, because
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I wished first to arrange a meeting with Zimmern and Hellar and secure
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the weight of their calmer minds in initiating Grauble into our plans of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: sending a message to the World State authorities. I was prevented from
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: doing this immediately by difficulties in the Protium Works. Meanwhile
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: unbeknown to me the sailing date of Grauble's vessel was advanced, and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: he departed to the Arctic.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Although my position as Director of the Protium Works had been more of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: an honour than an assignment of active duties, I made it my business to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: assume the maximum rather than the minimum of the functions of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: office as I wished to learn more of the labour situation in Berlin, of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: which as yet I had no comprehensive understanding.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: In a general way I understood that German labour differed not only in
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: being eugenically created as a distinct breed, but that the labour group
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: was also a very distinct caste economically and politically. The
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: labourer, being denied access to the Level of Free Women, had no need
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: for money or bank credit in any form. This seemed to me to reduce him to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: a condition of pure slavery--since he received no pay for his services
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: other than the bare maintenance supplied by the state.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Because of this evidence of economic inferiority, I had at first
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: supposed that labour was in every way an inferior caste. But in this I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: had been gravely mistaken, nor had I been able fully to comprehend my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: error until this brewing labour trouble revealed in concrete form the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: political superiority of labour. In my failure to comprehend the true
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: state of affairs I had been a little stupid, for the political basis of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: German society is revealed to the seeing eye in the Hohenzollern eagle
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: emblazoned on the red flag, the emblem of the rule of labour.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Historically I believe this belies the origin of the red flag for it was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: first used as the emblem of democratic socialism, a Nineteenth Century
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: theory of a social order in which all social and economic classes were
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to be blended into a true democracy differing somewhat in its economic
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: organization, but essentially the same politically as the true democracy
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: which we have achieved in the World State. But with the Bolshevist
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: regime in Russia after the First World War, the red flag was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: appropriated as the emblem of the political supremacy and rule of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: proletariat or labour class.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I make these references to bygone history because they throw light on
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the peculiar status of the German Labour Caste, which is possessed of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: political superiority combined with social and economic inferiority. It
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: was the Bolshevist brand of socialism that finally overran Germany in
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the era of loose and ineffective rule of the world by the League of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Nations. Though I make no pretence of being an accurate authority on
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: history, the League of Nations, if I remember rightly, was humanity's
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: first timid conception of the World State. Rather weakly born, it was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: promptly emasculated by the rise in America of a political party founded
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: on the ideas of a great national hero who had just died. The
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: obstructionist policy of this party was inherent in its origin, for it
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: was inspired and held together by the ideas of a dead man, whose
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: followers could only repeat as their test of faith a phrase that has
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: come down to us as an idiom--"What would He do?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "He" being dead could do nothing, neither could he change his mind, but
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: having left an indelible record of his ideas by the strenuous verbiage
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of his virile and inspiring rhetoric, there was no room for doubt. As in
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: all political and religious faiths founded on the ideas of dead heroes,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: this made for solidarity and power and quite prevented any adaptation of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the form of government to the needs of the world that had arisen since
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: his demise.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I have digressed here from my theme of the political status of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: German labour caste, but it is fascinating to trace things to their
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: origin to find the links of the chain of cause and effect. So, if I have
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: read my history aright, the emasculation of the League of Nations by the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: American obstructionists caused, or at least permitted the rise, and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: dominance of the Bolshevists in Twentieth-Century Germany. Had the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Germans been democrats at heart the pendulum would have swung back as it
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: did with other peoples, and been stayed at the point of equilibrium
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: which we recognized as the stable mean of democracy.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: But in the old days before the modern intermingling of the races it
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: seems that there were certain tastes that had become instinctive in
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: racial groups. Thus, just as the German stomach craved the rich flavour
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of sausage, so the German mind craved the dazzling show of Royal
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: flummery. Had it not been for this the First World War could have never
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: been, for the socialists of that time were bitterly opposed to war and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Germany was the world's greatest stronghold of socialism, yet when their
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: beloved imperial poser, William the Great, called for war the German
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: socialists, with the exception of a few whom they afterwards murdered,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: went forth to war almost without protest.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: When I first began to hear of the political rights of Labour, I went to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: my friend Hellar and asked for an explanation.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Is not the chain of authority absolute," I asked, "up through the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: industrial organization direct to the Emperor and so to God himself?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But," said Hellar, "the workers do not believe in God!"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "What," I stammered, "workers not believe in God! It is impossible. Have
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: not the workers simple trusting minds?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Certainly," said Hellar, "it is the natural mind of man! Scepticism,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: which is the basis of scientific reasoning, is an artificial thing,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: first created in the world under the competitive economic order when it
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: became essential to self-preservation in a world of trade based on
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: deceit. In our new order we have had difficulty in maintaining enough of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: it for scientific purposes even in the intellectual classes. There is no
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: scepticism among the labourers now, I assure you. They believe as easily
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: as they breathe."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Then how," I demanded in amazement, "does it come that they do not
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: believe in God?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Because," said Hellar, "they have never heard of God.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "The labourer does not know of God because we have restored God since
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the perfection of our caste system, and hence it was easy to promulgate
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the idea among the intellectuals and not among the workers. It was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: necessary to restore God for the intellectuals in order to give them
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: greater respect for the power of the Royal House, but the labourers need
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: no God because they believe themselves to be the source from which the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Royal House derives its right to rule. They believe the Emperor to be
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: their own servant ruling by their permission."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "The Emperor a servant to labour!" I exclaimed; "this is absurd."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Certainly," said Hellar; "why should it be otherwise? We are an absurd
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: people, because we have always laughed at the wrong things. Still this
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: principle is very old and has not always been confined to the Germans.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: After the revolutions in the Twentieth Century the American plutocrats
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: employed poverty-stricken European nobility for servants and exalted
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: them to high stations and obeyed them explicitly in all social matters
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: with which their service was concerned.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "The labourers restored William III because they wished to have an
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: exalted servant. He led them to war and became a hero. He reorganized
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the state and became their political servant, also their emperor and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: their tyrant. It is not an impossible relation, for it is not unlike the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: relation between the mother and the child or between a man and his
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: mistress. And yet it is different, more formal, with functions
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: better defined.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "The Emperor is the administrative head of the government and we
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: intellectuals are merely his hirelings. We are merely the feathers of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the Royal eagle, our colour is black, we have no part in the red blood
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of human brotherhood, we are outcasts from the socialistic labour
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: world--for we receive money compensation to which labourers would not
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: stoop. But labour owns the state. This roof of Berlin over our heads and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: all that is therein contained, is the property of the workers who
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: produced it."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I shook my head in mute admission of my lack of comprehension.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "And who," asked Hellar, "did you think owned Berlin?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I confessed that I had never thought of that.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Few of our intellectual class have ever thought of that," replied
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Hellar, "unless they are well read in political history. But at the time
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of the Hohenzollern restoration labour owned all property in true
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: communal ownership. They did not release it to the Royal House, but
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: merely turned over the administration of the property to the Emperor as
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: an agent."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: These belated explanations of the fundamental ideas of German society
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: quite confused and confounded me, though Hellar seemed in no wise
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: surprised at my ignorance, since as a chemist I had originally been
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: supposed to know only of atoms and valences and such like matters.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Seeking a way out of these contradictions I asked: "How is it then that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: labour is so powerless, since you say that it owns the state, and even
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the Emperor rules by its permission?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Napoleon--have you ever heard of him?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Yes," I admitted--and then recalling my role as a German chemist I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: hastened to add--"Napoleon was a directing chemist who achieved a plan
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: for increasing the food supply in his day by establishing the sugar beet
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: industry."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Is that so?" exclaimed Hellar. "I didn't know that. I thought he was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: only an Emperor--anyway, Napoleon said that if you tell men they are
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: equal you can do as you please with them. So when William III was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: elected to the throne by labour, he insisted that they retain the power
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and re-elect him every five years. He was very popular because he
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: invented the armoured city--our new Berlin--some day I will tell you of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that--and so of course he was re-elected, and his son after him. Though
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: most of the intellectuals do not know that it exists the ceremony of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: election is a great occasion on the labour levels. The Emperor speaks
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: all day through the horns and on the picture screens. The workers think
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: he is actually speaking, though of course it is a collection of old
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: films and records of the Royal Voice. When they have seen and heard the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: speeches, the labourers vote, and then go back to their work and are
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: very happy."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But suppose they should sometime fail to re-elect him?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "No danger," said Hellar; "there is only one name on the ballot and the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: ballots are dumped into the paper mill without inspection."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Most extraordinary," I exclaimed.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Most ordinary," contradicted Hellar; "it is not even an exclusively
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: German institution; we have merely perfected it. Voting everywhere is a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: very useful device in organized government. In the cruder form used in
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: democracies there were two or more candidates. It usually made little
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: difference which was elected; but the system was imperfect because the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: voters who voted for the candidate which lost were not pleased. Then
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: there was the trouble of counting the ballots. We avoid all this."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "It is all very interesting," I said, "but who is the real authority?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Ah," said Hellar, "this matter of authority is one of our most subtle
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: conceptions. The weakness of ancient governments was in the fact that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the line of authority was broken. It came somewhere to an end. But now
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: authority flows up from labour to the Emperor and then descends again to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: labour through the administrative line of which we are one link. It is
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: an unbroken circuit."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: But I was still unsatisfied, for it annoyed me not to be able to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: understand the system of German politics, as I had always prided myself
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that, for a scientist, I understood politics remarkably well.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I had gone to Hellar for enlightenment because I was gravely alarmed
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: over the rumours of a strike among the labourers in the Protium Works. I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: had read in the outside world of the murder and destruction of these
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: former civil wars of industry. With a working population so cruelly held
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to the treadmill of industrial bondage the idea of a strike conjured up
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: in my fancy the beginning of a bloody revolution. With so vast a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: population so utterly dependent upon the orderly processes of industry
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the possible terrors of an industrial revolution were horrible beyond
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: imagining; and for the moment all thoughts of escape, or of my own plans
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: for negotiating the surrender of Berlin to the World State, were swept
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: aside by the stern responsibilities that devolved upon me as the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Director of Works wherein a terrible strike seemed brewing.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The first rumour of the strike of the labourers in the Protium Works had
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: come to me from the Listening-in-Service. Since Berlin was too
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: complicated and congested a spot for wireless communication to be
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: practical, the electrical conduct of sound was by antiquated means of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: metal wires. The workers' Free Speech Halls were all provided with
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: receiving horns by which they made their appeals to His Majesty, of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: which I shall speak presently. These instruments were provided with
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: cut-offs in the halls. They had been so designed by the electrical
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: engineers, who were of the intellectual caste, that not even the workers
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: who installed and repaired them knew that the cut-offs were a blind and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that the Listening-in-Service heard every word that was said at their
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: secret meetings, when all but workers were, by law and custom, excluded
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: from the halls.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: And so the report came to me that the workers were threatening strike.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Their grievance came about in this fashion. My new process had reduced
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the number of men needed in the works. This would require that some of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the men be transferred to other industries. But the transfer was a slow
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: process, as all the workers would have to be examined anatomically and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: their psychic reflexes tested by the labour assignment experts and those
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: selected re-trained for other labour. That work was proceeding
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: slowly, for there was a shortage of experts because some similar need of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: transfers existed in one of the metal industries. Moreover, my labour
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: psychologist considered it dangerous to transfer too many men, as they
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: were creatures of habit, and he advised that we ought merely to cease to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: take on new workers, but wait for old age and death to reduce the number
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of our men, meanwhile retaining the use of the old extraction process in
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: part of the works.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Impossible," I replied, "unless you would have your rations cut and the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: city put on a starvation diet. Do you not know that the reserve store of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: protium that was once enough to last eight years is now reduced to less
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: than as many months' supply?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "That is none of my affair," said the labour psychologist; "these
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: chemical matters I do not comprehend. But I advise against these
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: transfers, for our workers are already in a furor about the change of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: operations in the work."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But," I protested, "the new operations are easier than the old; besides
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: we can cut down the speed of operations, which ought to help you take
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: care of these surplus men."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Pardon, Herr Chief," returned the elderly labour psychologist, "you are
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: a great chemist, a very great chemist, for your invention has upset the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: labour operation more than has anything that ever happened in my long
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: experience, but I fear you do not realize how necessary it is to go slow
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: in these matters. You ask men who have always opened a faucet from left
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to right to now open one that moves in a vertical plane. Here, I will
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: show you; move your arm so; do you not see that it takes
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: different muscles?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Yes, of course, but what of it? The solution flows faster and the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: operation is easier."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "It is easy for you to say that; for you or me it would make no
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: difference since our muscles have all been developed indiscriminately."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But what are your labour gymnasiums for, if not to develop all
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: muscles?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Now do not misunderstand me. I serve as an interpreter between the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: minds of the workers and your mind as Director of the Works. As for the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: muscles developed in the gymnasium, those were developed for sport and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: not for labour. But that is not the worst of it; you have designed the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: new benches so low that the mixers must stoop at their work. It is
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: very painful."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Good God," I cried, "what became of the stools? The mixers are to sit
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: down--I ordered two thousand stools."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "That I know, Herr Chief, but the equipment expert consulted me about
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the matter and I countermanded the order. It would never do. I did not
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: consult you, it is true, but that was merely a kindness. I did not wish
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to expose your lack of knowledge, if I may call it such."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Call it what you please," I snapped, for at the time I thought my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: labour psychologist was a fool, "but get those stools, immediately."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But it would never do."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Why not?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Because these men have always stood at their work."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But why can they not sit down now?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Because they never have sat down."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Do they not sit down to eat?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Yes, but not to work. It is very different. You do not understand the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: psychic immobility of labour. Habits grow stronger as the mentality is
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: simplified. I have heard that there are animals in the zoological garden
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that still perform useless operations that their remote ancestors
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: required in their jungle life."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Then do you infer that these men who must stand at their work inherited
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the idea from their ancestors?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "That is a matter of eugenics. I do not know, but I do know that we are
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: preparing for trouble with these changes. Still I hope to work it out
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: without serious difficulty, if you do not insist on these transfers.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: When workmen have already been forced to change their habitual method of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: work and then see their fellows being removed to other and still
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: stranger work it breeds dangerous unrest."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "One thing is certain," I replied; "we cannot delay the installation of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the new method; as fast as the equipment is ready the new operation must
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: replace the old."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But the effect of that policy will be that there will not be enough
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: work, and besides the work is, as you say, lighter and that will result
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: in the cutting down of the food rations."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But I have already arranged that," I said triumphantly; "the Rationing
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Bureau have adjusted the calorie standards so that the men will get as
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: much food as they have been used to."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "What! you have done that?" exclaimed the labour psychologist; "then
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: there will be trouble. That will destroy the balance of the food supply
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and the expenditure of muscular energy and the men will get fat. Then
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the other men will accuse them of stealing food and we shall have
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: bloodshed."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "A moment ago," I smiled, "you told me I did not know your business. Now
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I will tell you that you do not know mine. We ordered special food
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: bulked up in volume; the scheme is working nicely; you need not worry
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: about that. As for the other matter, this surplus of men, it seems to me
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that the only thing is to cut down the working hours temporarily until
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the transfers can be made."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The psychologist shook his head. "It is dangerous," he said, "and very
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: unusual. I advise instead that you have the operation engineers go over
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the processes and involve the operations, both to make them more nearly
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: resemble the old ones, and to add to the time and energy consumption of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the tasks."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "No," I said emphatically, "I invented a more economical process for
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: this industry and I do not propose to see my invention prostituted in
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: this fashion. I appreciate your advice, but if we cannot transfer the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: workers any faster, then the labour hours must be cut. I will issue the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: order tomorrow. This is my final decision."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I was in authority and that settled the matter. The psychologist was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: very decent about it and helped me fix up a speech and that next night
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the workers were ordered to assemble in their halls and I made my speech
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: into a transmitting horn. I told them that they had been especially
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: honoured by their Emperor, who, appreciating their valuable service, had
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: granted them a part-time vacation and that until further notice their
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: six-hour shifts were to be cut to four. I further told them that their
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: rations would not be reduced and advised them to take enough extra
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: exercise in the gymnasium to offset their shorter hours so they would
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: not get fat and be the envy of their fellows.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: For a time the workers seemed greatly pleased with their shorter hours.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: And then, from the Listening-in-Service, came the rumour of the strike.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The first report of the strike gave me no clue to the grievance and I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: asked for fuller reports. When these came the next day I was shocked
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: beyond belief. If I had anticipated anything in that interval of terror
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: it was that my workers were to strike because their communications had
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: been shut off or that they were to strike in sympathy for their fellows
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and demand that all hours be shortened like their own. But the grievance
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: was not that. My men were to go on strike for the simple reason that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: their hours had been shortened!
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The catastrophe once started came with a rush, for when I reached the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: office the next day the psychologist was awaiting me and told me that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the strike was on. I rushed out immediately and went down to the works.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The psychologist followed me. As I entered the great industrial
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: laboratories I saw all the men at their usual places and going through
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: their usual operations. I turned to my companion who was just coming up,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and said: "What do you mean; I thought you told me the strike was on,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that the men had already walked out?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "What do you mean by 'walked out'?" he returned, as puzzled as I.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Walked out of the works," I explained; "away from their duties, quit
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: work. Struck!"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But they have struck. Perhaps you have never seen a strike before, but
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: do you not see the strike badges?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: And then I looked and saw that every workman wore a tiny red flag, and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the flag bore no imperial eagle.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "It means," I gasped, "that they have renounced the rule of the Royal
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: House. This is not a strike, this is rebellion, treason!"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "It is the custom," said the labour psychologist, "and as for rebellion
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and treason that you speak of I hardly think you ought to call it that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: for rebellion and treason are forbidden."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Then just what does it mean?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "It means that this particular group of workers have temporarily
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: withdrawn their allegiance to the Royal House, and they have, in their
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: own minds, restored the old socialist regime, until they can make
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: petition to the Emperor and he passes on their grievance. They will do
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that in their halls tonight. We, of course, will be connected up and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: listen in."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Then they are not really on strike?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Certainly they are on strike. All strikes are conducted so."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Then why do they not quit work?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But why should they quit work? They are striking because their hours
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: are already too short--pardon, Herr Chief, but I warned you!
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I think I know what you mean," he added after a pause; "you have
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: probably read some fiction of old times when the workers went on strike
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: by quitting work."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Yes, exactly. I suppose that is where I did get my ideas; and that is
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: now forbidden--by the Emperor?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Not by the Emperor, for you see these men wear the flags without the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: eagle. They at present do not acknowledge his authority."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Then all this strike is a matter of red badges without eagles and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: everything else will go on as usual?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "By no means. These men are striking against the descending authority
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: from the Royal House. They not only refuse to wear the eagle until their
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: grievance is adjusted but they will refuse to accept further education,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: for that is a thing that descends from above. If you will go now to the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: picture halls, where the other shift should be, you will find the halls
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: all empty. The men refuse to go to the moving pictures."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: That night we "listened in." A bull-throated fellow, whom I learned was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the Talking Delegate, addressed the Emperor, and much to my surprise I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: thought I heard the Emperor's own voice in reply, stating that he was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: ready to hear their grievance.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Then the bull voice of the Talking Delegate gave the reason for the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: strike: "The Director of the Works, speaking for your Majesty, has
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: granted us a part time vacation, and shortened our hours from six to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: four. We thank you for this honour but we have decided we do not like
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: it. We do not know what to do during those extra two hours. We had our
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: games and amusements but we had our regular hours for them. If we play
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: longer we become tired of play. If we sleep longer we cannot sleep as
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: well. Moreover we are losing our appetite and some of us are afraid to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: eat all our portions for fear we will become fat. So we have decided
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that we do not like a four-hour day and we have therefore taken the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: eagles off our flags and will refuse to replace them or to go to the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: educational pictures until our hours are restored to the six-hour day
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that we have always had."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: And now the Emperor's voice replied that he would take the matter under
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: consideration and report his decision in three days and, that meanwhile
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: he knew he could trust them to conduct themselves as good socialists who
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: were on strike, and hence needed no king.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The next day the psychologist brought a representative of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Information Staff to my office and together we wrote the reply that the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Emperor was to make. It would be necessary to concede them the full six
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: hours and introduce the system of complicating the labour operations to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: make more work. Much chagrined, I gave in, and called in the motion
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: study engineers and set them to the task. Meanwhile the Royal Voice was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: sent for and coached in the Emperor's reply to the striking workmen, and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: a picture film of the Emperor, timed to fit the length of the speech,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: was ordered from stock.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The Royal Voice was an actor by birth who had been trained to imitate
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: His Majesty's speech. This man, who specialized in the Emperor's
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: speeches to the workers, prided himself that he was the best Royal Voice
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: in Berlin and I complimented him by telling him that I had been deceived
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: by him the evening before. But considering that the workers, never
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: having heard the Emperor's real voice, would have no standard of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: comparison, I have never been able to see the necessity of the accuracy
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of his imitation, unless it was on the ground of art for art's sake.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: CHAPTER XII
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: THE DIVINE DESCENDANTS OF WILLIAM THE GREAT GIVE A BENEFIT
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: FOR THE CANINE GARDENS AND PAY TRIBUTE TO THE PIGGERIES
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The strike that I had feared would be the beginning of a bloody
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: revolution had ended with an actor shouting into a horn and the shadow
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of an Emperor waving his arms. But meanwhile Capt. Grauble, on whom I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: staked my hopes of escape from Berlin, had departed to the Arctic and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: would not return for many months. That he would return I firmly
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: believed; statistically the chances were in his favour as this was his
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: fourth trip, and hope was backing the favourable odds of the law of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: chance.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: So I set myself to prepare for that event. My faith was strong that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Grauble could be won over to the cause of saving the Germans by
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: betraying Germany. I did not even consider searching for another man,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: for Grauble was that one rare man in thousands who is rebellious and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: fearless by nature, a type of which the world makes heroes when their
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: cause wins and traitors when it fails--a type that Germany had all but
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: eliminated from the breed of men.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: But, if I were to escape to the outer world through Grauble's
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: connivance, there was still the problem of getting permission to board
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the submarine, ostensibly to go to the Arctic mines. Even in my exalted
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: position as head of the protium works I could not learn where the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: submarine docks or the passage to them was located. But I did learn
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: enough to know that the way was impenetrable without authoritative
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: permission, and that thoughts of escape as a stowaway were not worth
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: considering. I also learned that Admiral von Kufner had sole authority
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to grant permission to make the Arctic trip.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The Admiral had promptly turned down my first proposal to go to the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Arctic ore fields, and had by his pompous manner rebuffed the attempts I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: made to cultivate his friendship through official interviews. I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: therefore decided to call on Marguerite and the Countess Luise to see
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: what chance there was to get a closer approach to the man through social
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: avenues. The Countess was very obliging in the matter, but she warned me
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: with lifted finger that the Admiral was a gay bachelor and a worshipper
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of feminine charms, and that I might rue the day I suggested his being
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: invited into the admiring circle that revolved about Marguerite. But I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: laughingly disclaimed any fears on that score and von Kufner was bidden
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to the next ball given by the Countess.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Marguerite was particularly gracious to the Admiral and speedily led him
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: into the inner circle that gathered informally in the salon of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Countess Luise. I made it a point to absent myself on some of these
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: occasions, for I did not want the Admiral to guess the purpose that lay
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: behind this ensnaring of him into our group.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: And yet I saw much of Marguerite, for I spent most of my leisure in the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: society of the Royal Level, where thought, if shallow, was comparatively
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: free. I took particular pleasure in watching the growth of Marguerite's
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: mind, as the purely intellectual conceptions she had acquired from Dr.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Zimmern and his collection of books adjusted itself to the absurd
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: realities of the celestial society of the descendants of William
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the Great.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: It may be that charity is instinctive in the heart of a good woman, or
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: perhaps it was because she had read the Christian Bible; but whatever
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the origin of the impulse, Marguerite was charitably inclined and wished
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to make personal sacrifice for the benefit of other beings less well
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: situated than herself. While she was still a resident of the Free Level
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: she had talked to me of this feeling and of her desire to help others.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: But the giving of money or valuables by one woman to another was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: strictly forbidden, and Marguerite had not at the time possessed more
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: than she needed for her own subsistence. But now that she was relatively
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: well off, this charitable feeling struggled to find expression. Hence
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: when she had learned of the Royal Charity Society she had straightway
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: begged the Countess to present her name for membership, without stopping
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to examine into the detail of the Society's activities.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The Society was at that time preparing to hold a bazaar and sent out
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: calls for contributions of cast off clothing and ornaments. Marguerite
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: as yet possessed no clothes or jewelry of Royal quality except the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: minimum which the demands of her position made necessary; and so she
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: timidly asked the Countess if her clothing which she had worn on the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Free Level would suffice as gifts of charity. The Countess had assured
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: her that it would do nicely as the destination of all the clothing
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: contributed was for the women of the Free Level. Thinking that an
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: opportunity had at last arisen for her to express her compassion for the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: ill-favoured girls of her own former level, Marguerite hastened to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: bundle up such presentable gowns as she had and sent them to the bazaar
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: by her maid.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Later she had attended the meeting of the society when the net results
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of the collections were announced. To her dismay she found that the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: clothing contributed had been sold for the best price it would bring to
title: City of Endless Night
