author: Hastings, Milo

text: the women of the Free Level and that the purpose of the sacrifices, of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that which was useless to the possessors but valuable to others, was the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: defraying of the expense of extending the romping grounds for the dogs
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of the charitably maintained canine garden.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Marguerite was vigorously debating the philosophy of charity with the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: young Count Rudolph that evening when I called. She was maintaining that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: human beings and not animals should be the recipients of charity and the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: young Count was expounding to her the doctrine of the evil effects of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: charity upon the recipient.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Moreover," explained Count Rudolph, "there are no humans in Berlin that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: need charity, since every class of our efficiently organized State
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: receives exactly what it should receive and hence is in need of nothing.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Charity is permissible only when poverty exists."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But there is poverty on the Free Level," maintained Marguerite; "many
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of the ill-favoured girls suffer from hunger and want better clothes
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: than they can buy."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "That may be," said the Count, "but to permit them gifts of charity
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: would be destructive of their pride; moreover, there are few women on
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the Royal Level who would give for such a purpose."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But surely," said Marguerite, "there must be somewhere in the city,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: other women or children or even men to whom the proceeds of these gifts
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: would mean more than it does to dogs."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "If any group needed anything the state would provide it," repeated the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Count.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Then why," protested Marguerite, "cannot the state provide also for the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: dogs, or if food and space be lacking why are these dogs allowed to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: breed and multiply?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Because it would be cruel to suppress their instincts."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Marguerite was puzzled by this answer, but with my more rational mind I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: saw a flaw in the logic of this statement. "But that is absurd," I said,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "for if their number were not checked in some fashion, in a few decades
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the dogs would overswarm the city."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: It was now the Count's turn to look puzzled. "You have inferred an
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: embarrassing question," he stated, "one, in fact, that ought not to be
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: answered in the presence of a lady, but since the Princess Marguerite
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: does not seem to be a lover of dogs, I will risk the explanation. The
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Medical Level requires dogs for purposes of scientific research. Since
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the women are rarely good mathematicians, it is easily possible in this
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: manner to keep down the population of the Canine Garden."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But the dogs required for research," I suggested, "could easily be bred
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: in kennels maintained for that purpose."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "So they could," said the Count, "but the present plan serves a double
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: purpose. It provides the doctors with scalpel practise and it also
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: amuses the women of the Royal House who are very much in need of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: amusement since we men are all so dull."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Woman's love," continued Rudolph, waxing eloquent, "should have full
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: freedom for unfoldment. If it be forcibly confined to her husband and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: children it might burst its bounds and express too great an interest in
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: other humans. The dogs act as a sort of safety valve for this instinct
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of charity."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The facetious young Count saw from Marguerite's horror-stricken face
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that he was making a marked impression and he recklessly continued: "The
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: keepers at the Canine Gardens understand this perfectly. When funds
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: begin to run low they put the dogs in the outside pens on short rations,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and the brutes do their own begging; then we have another bazaar and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: everybody is happy. It is a good system and I would advise you not to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: criticize it since the institution is classic. Other schemes have been
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: tried; at one time women were permitted to knit socks for soldiers--we
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: always put that in historical pictures--but the socks had to be melted
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: up again as felted fibre is much more durable; and then, after the women
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: were forbidden to see the soldiers, they lost interest. But the dog
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: charity is a proven institution and we should never try to change
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: anything that women do not want changed since they are the conservative
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: bulwark of society and our best protection against the danger of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the untried."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Blocked in her effort to relieve human poverty by the discovery that its
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: existence was not recognized, Marguerite's next adventure in doing good
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: in the world was to take up the battle against ignorance by contributing
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to the School for the Education of Servants.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The Servant problem in Berlin, and particularly on the Royal Level, had
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: been solved so far as male servants were concerned, for these were a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: well recognized strain eugenically bred as a division of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: intellectual caste. I had once taken Dr. Zimmern to task on this
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: classification of the servant as an intellectual.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "The servant is not intellectual creatively," the Eugenist replied, "yet
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: it would never do to class him as Labour since he produces nothing.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Moreover, the servant's mind reveals the most specialized development of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the most highly prized of all German intellectual characteristics
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: --obedience.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "It might interest you to know," continued Zimmern, "that we use this
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: servant strain in outcrossing with other strains when they show a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: tendency to decline in the virtue of obedience. If I had not chosen to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: exempt you from paternity when your rebellious instincts were reported
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to me, and the matter had been turned over to our Remating Board they
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: might have reassigned you to mothers of the servant class. This practice
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of out-crossing, though rare, is occasionally essential in all
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: scientific breeding."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Then do you mean," I asked in amazement, "that the highest intellectual
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: strains have servant blood in them?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Certainly. And why not, since obedience is the crowning glory of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: German mind? Even Royal blood has a dash of the servant strain."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "You mean, I suppose, from illegitimate children?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Not at all; that sort of illegitimacy is not recognized. I mean from
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the admission of servants into Royal Society, just as you have been
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: admitted."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Impossible!"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "And why impossible, since obedience is our supreme racial virtue? Go
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: consult your social register. The present Emperor, I believe, has
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: admitted none, but his father admitted several and gave them princely
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: incomes. They married well and their children are respected, though I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: understand they are not very much invited out for the reason that they
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: are poor conversationalists. They only speak when spoken to and then
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: answer, 'Ja, Mein Herr.' I hear they are very miserable; since no one
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: commands them they must be very bored with life, as they are unable to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: think of anything to do to amuse themselves. In time the trait will be
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: modified, of course, since the Royal blood will soon predominate, and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the strongest inherent trait of Royalty is to seek amusement."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: This specialized class of men servants needed little education, for, as
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I took more interest in observing after this talk with Zimmern, they
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: were the most perfectly fitted to their function of any class in Berlin.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: But there was also a much more numerous class of women servants on the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Royal Level. These, as a matter of economy, were not specially bred to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the office, but were selected from the mothers who had been rejected for
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: further maternity after the birth of one or two children. Be it said to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the credit of the Germans that no women who had once borne a child was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: ever permitted to take up the profession of Delilah--a statement which
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: unfortunately cannot be made of the rest of the world. These mothers
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: together with those who had passed the child bearing age more than
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: supplied the need for nurses on the maternity levels and teachers in
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: girls' schools.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: As a result they swarmed the Royal Level in all capacities of service
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: for which women are fitted. Originally educated for maternity they had
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to be re-educated for service. Not satisfied with the official education
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: provided by the masculine-ordered state, the women of the Royal Level
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: maintained a continuation school in the fine art of obedience and the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: kindred virtues of the perfect servant.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: So again it was that Marguerite became involved in a movement that in no
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: wise expressed the needs of her spirit, and from which she
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: speedily withdrew.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The next time she came to me for advice. "I want to do something," she
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: cried. "I want to be of some use in the world. You saved me from that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: awful life--for you know what it would have been for me if Dr. Zimmern
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: had died or his disloyalty had been discovered--and you have brought me
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: here where I have riches and position but am useless. I tried to be
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: charitable, to relieve poverty, but they say there is no poverty to be
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: relieved. I tried to relieve ignorance, but they will not allow that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: either. What else is there that needs to be relieved? Is there no good
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I can do?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Your problem is not a new one," I replied, thinking of the world-old
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: experience of the good women yoked to idleness by wealth and position.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "You have tried to relieve poverty and ignorance and find your efforts
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: futile. There is one thing more I believe that is considered a classic
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: remedy for your trouble. You can devote yourself to the elimination of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: ugliness, to the increase of beauty. Is there no organization devoted to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that work?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "There is," returned Marguerite, "and I was about to join it, but I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: thought this time I had better ask advice. There is the League to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Beautify Berlin."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Then by all means join," I advised. "It is the safest of all such
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: efforts, for though poverty may not exist and ignorance may not be
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: relieved, yet surely Berlin can be more beautiful. But of course your
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: efforts must be confined to the Royal Level as you do not see the rest
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of the city."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: So Marguerite joined the League to Beautify Berlin and I became an
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: auxiliary member much appreciated because of my liberal contributions.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: It proved an excellent source of amusement. The League met weekly and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: discussed the impersonal aspects of the beauty of the level in open
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: meetings, while a secret complaint box was maintained into which all
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: were invited to deposit criticisms of more personal matters. It was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: forbidden even in this manner to criticize irremedial ugliness such as
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the matter of one's personal form or features, but dress and manners
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: came within the permitted range and the complaints were regularly mailed
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to the offenders. This surprised me a little as I would have thought
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that such a practice would have made the League unpopular, but on the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: contrary, it was considered the mainstay of the organization, for the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: recipient of the complaint, if a non-member, very often joined the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: League immediately, hoping thereby to gain sweet revenge.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: But aside from this safety valve for the desire to make personal
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: criticism, the League was a very creditable institution and it was there
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that we met the great critics to whose untiring efforts the rare
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: development of German art was due.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Cut off from the opportunity to appropriate by purchase or capture the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: works of other peoples, German art had suffered a severe decline in the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: first few generations of the isolation, but in time they had developed
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: an art of their own. A great abundance of cast statues of white crystal
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: adorned the plazas and gardens and, being unexposed to dust or rain,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: they preserved their pristine freshness so that it appeared they had all
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: been made the day before. Mural paintings also flourished abundantly and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: in some sections the endless facade of the apartments was a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: continuous pageant.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: But it was in landscape gardening that German art had made its most
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: wonderful advancement. Having small opportunity for true architecture
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: because of the narrow engineering limitations of the city's
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: construction, talent for architecture had been turned to landscape
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: gardening. I use the term advisedly for the very absence of natural
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: landscape within a roofed-in city had resulted in greater development of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the artificial product.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The earlier efforts, few of which remained unaltered, were more inclined
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: toward imitation of Nature as it exists in the world of sun and rocks
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and rain. But, as the original models were forgotten and new generations
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of gardeners arose, new sorts of nature were created. Artificial rocks,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: artificial soil, artificially bred and cultured plants, were combined in
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: new designs, unrealistic it is true, but still a very wonderful
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: development of what might be called synthetic or romantic nature. The
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: water alone was real and even in some cases that was altered as in the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: beautifully dyed rivulets and in the truly remarkable "Fountain of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Blood," dedicated to one of the sons of William the Great--I have
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: forgotten his name--in honour of his attack upon Verdun in the First
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: World War.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: In these wondrous gardens, with the Princess Marguerite strolling by my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: side, I spent the happiest hours of my sojourn in Berlin. But my joy was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: tangled with a thread of sadness for the more I gazed upon this
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: synthetic nature of German creation the more I hungered to tell her of,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and to take her to see, the real Nature of the outside world--upon
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: which, in my opinion, with all due respect to their achievements, the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Germans had not been able to improve.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: While the women of the Royal House were not permitted of their own
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: volition to stray from the Royal Level, excursions were occasionally
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: arranged, with proper permits and guards. These were social events of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: consequence and the invitations were highly prized. Noteworthy among
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: them was an excursion to the highest levels of the city and to the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: roof itself.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The affair was planned by Admiral von Kufner in Marguerite's honour;
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: for, having spent her childhood elsewhere, she had never experienced the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: wonder of this roof excursion so highly prized by Royalty, and for ever
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: forbidden to all other women and to all but a few men of the teeming
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: millions who swarmed like larvae in this vast concrete cheese.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The formal invitations set no hour for the excursion as it was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: understood that the exact time depended upon weather conditions of which
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: we would later be notified. When this notice came the hour set was in
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the conventional evening of the Royal Level, but corresponding to about
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: three A.M. by solar time. The party gathered at the suite of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Countess Luise and numbered some forty people, for whom a half dozen
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: guides were provided in the form of officers of the Roof Guard. The
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: journey to our romantic destination took us up some hundred metres in an
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: elevator, a trip which required but two minutes, but would lead to a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: world as different as Mount Olympus from Erebus.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: But we did not go directly to the roof, for the hour preferred for that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: visit had not yet arrived and our first stop was at the swine levels,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: which had so aroused my curiosity and strained belief when I had first
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: discovered their existence from the chart of my atlas.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: As the door of the elevator shaft slid open, a vast squealing and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: grunting assaulted our ears. The hours of the swine, like those of their
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: masters, were not reckoned by either solar or sidereal time, but had
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: been altered, as experiment had demonstrated, to a more efficient cycle.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The time of our trip was chosen so that we might have this earthly music
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of the feeding time as a fitting prelude to the visioning of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: silent heavens.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: On the visitors' gangway we walked just above the reach of the jostling
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: bristly backs, and our own heads all but grazed the low ceiling of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: level. To economize power the lights were dim. Despite the masterful
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: achievement of German cleanliness and sanitation there was a permeating
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: odour, a mingling of natural and synthetic smells, which added to the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: gloom of semi-darkness and the pandemonium of swinish sound produced a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: totality of infernal effect that thwarts description.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: But relief was on the way for the automatic feed conveyors were rapidly
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: moving across our section. First we heard a diminution of sound from one
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: direction, then a hasty scuffling and a happy grunting beneath us and,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: as the conveyors moved swiftly on, the squealing receded into the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: distance like the dying roar of a retreating storm.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The Chief Swineherd, immaculately dressed and wearing his full quota of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: decorations and medals, honoured us with his personal presence. With the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: excusable pride that every worthy man takes in his work, he expounded
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the scientific achievements and economic efficiency of the swinish world
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: over which he reigned. The men of the party listened with respect to his
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: explanations of the accomplishments of sanitation and of the economy of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the cycle of chemical transformation by which these swine were
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: maintained without decreasing the capacity of the city for human
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: support. Lastly the Swineherd spoke of the protection that the swine
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: levels provided against the effects of an occasional penetrating bomb
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that chanced to fall in the crater of its predecessor before the damage
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: could be repaired.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Pursuant to this fact the uppermost swine level housed those unfortunate
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: animals that were nearest the sausage stage. On the next lower level, to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: which we now descended by a spiral stair through a ventilating opening,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: were brutes of less advanced ages. On the lowest of the three levels
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: where special lights were available for our benefit even the women
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: ceased to shudder and gave expression to ecstatic cries of rapture, as
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: all the world has ever done when seeing baby beasts pawing contentedly
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: at maternal founts.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Is it not all wonderful?" effused Admiral von Kufner, with a sweeping
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: gesture; "so efficient, so sanitary, so automatic, such a fine example
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of obedience to system and order. This is what I call real science and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: beauty; one might almost say Germanic beauty."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But I do not like it," replied Marguerite with her usual candour. "I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: wish they would abolish these horrid levels."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But surely," said the Countess, "you would not wish to condemn us to a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: diet of total mineralism?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But the Herr Chemist here could surely invent for us a synthetic
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: sausage," remarked Count Rudolph. "I have eaten vegetarian kraut made of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: real cabbage from the Botanical Garden, but it was inferior to the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: synthetic article."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Do not make light, young people," spoke up the most venerable member of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: our party, the eminent Herr Dr. von Brausmorganwetter, the historian
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: laureate of the House of Hohenzollern. "It is not as a producer of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: sausages alone that we Germans are indebted to this worthy animal. I am
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: now engaged in writing a book upon the influence of the swine upon
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: German Kultur. In the first part I shall treat of the Semitic question.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The Jews were very troublesome among us in the days before the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: isolation. They were a conceited race. As capitalists, they amassed
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: fortunes; as socialists they stirred up rebellion; they objected to war;
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: they would never have submitted to eugenics; they even insisted that we
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Germans had stolen their God!
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "We tried many schemes to be rid of these troublesome people, and all
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: failed. Therefore I say that Germany owes a great debt to the noble
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: animal who rid us of the disturbing presence of the Jews, for when pork
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: was made compulsory in the diet they fled the country of their
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: own accord.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "In the second part of my book I shall tell the story of the founding of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the New Berlin, for our noble city was modelled on the fortified
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: piggeries of the private estates of William III. In those days of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: open war the enemy bombed the stock farms. Synthetic foods were as yet
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: imperfectly developed. Protein was at a premium; the emperor did not
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: like fish, so he built a vast concrete structure with a roof heavily
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: armoured with sand that he might preserve his swine from the murderous
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: attacks of the enemy planes.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "It was during the retreat from Peking. The German armies were being
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: crowded back on every side. The Ray had been invented, but William the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: III knew that it could not be used to protect so vast a domain and that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Germany would be penned into narrow borders and be in danger of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: extermination by aerial bombardment. In those days he went for rest and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: consolation to his estates, for he took great pleasure in his
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: thoroughbred swine. Some traitorous spy reported his move to the enemy
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and a bombing squadron attacked the estates. The Emperor took refuge in
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: his fortified piggery. And so the great vision came to him.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I have read the exact words of this thoughts as recorded in his diary
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: which is preserved in the archives of the Royal Palace: 'As are these
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: happy brutes, so shall my people be. In safety from the terrors of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: sky--protected from the vicissitudes of nature and the enmity of men, so
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: shall I preserve them.'
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "That was the conception of the armoured city of Berlin. But that was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: not all. For the bombardment kept up for days and the Emperor could not
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: escape. On the fourth day came the second idea--two new ideas in less
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: than a week! William III was a great thinker.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Thus he recorded the second inspiration: 'And even as I have bred these
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: swine, some for bacon and some for lard, so shall the German Blond
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Brutes be bred the super-men, some specialized for labour and some
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: for brains.'
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "These two ideas are the foundation of the kultur of our Imperial
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Socialism, the one idea to preserve us and the other to re-create us as
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the super-race. And both of these ideas we owe to this noble animal. The
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: swine should be emblazoned with the eagle upon our flag."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: As the Historian finished his eulogy, I glanced surreptitiously at the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: faces of his listeners, and caught a twinkle in Marguerite's eyes; but
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the faces of the others were as serious as graven images.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Finally the Countess spoke: "Do I understand, then, that you consider
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the swine the model of the German race?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Only of the lower classes," said the aged historian, "but not the House
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of Hohenzollern. We are exalted above the necessities of breeding, for
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: we are divine."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Eyes were now turned upon me, for I was the only one of the company not
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of Hohenzollern blood. Unrelieved by laughter the situation was painful.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But," said Count Rudolph, coming to my rescue, "we also seek safety in
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the fortified piggeries."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Exactly," said the Historian; "so did our noble ancestor."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: From the piggeries, we went to the green level where, growing beneath
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: eye-paining lights, was a matted mass of solid vegetation from which
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: came those rare sprigs of green which garnished our synthetic dishes.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: But this was too monotonous to be interesting and we soon went above to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the Defence Level where were housed vast military and rebuilding
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: mechanisms and stores. After our guides had shown us briefly about among
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: these paraphernalia, we were conducted to one of the sloping ramps which
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: led through a heavily arched tunnel to the roof above.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Marguerite clung close to my arm, quivering with expectancy and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: excitement, as we climbed up the sloping passage-way and felt on our
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: faces the breath of the crisp air of the May night.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The sky came into vision with startling suddenness as we walked out upon
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the soft sand blanket of the roof. The night was absolutely clear and my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: first impression was that every star of the heavens had miraculously
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: waxed in brilliancy. The moon, in the last quarter, hung midway between
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the zenith and the western horizon. The milky way seemed a floating band
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of whitish flame. About us, in the form of a wide crescent, for we were
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: near the eastern edge of the city, swung the encircling band of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: searchlights, but the air was so clear that this stockade of artificial
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: light beams was too pale to dim the points of light in the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: blue-black vault.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: In anticipating this visit to the roof I had supposed it would seem
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: commonplace to me, and had discussed it very little with Marguerite,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: lest I might reveal an undue lack of wonder. But now as I thrilled once
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: more beneath their holy light, the miracle of unnumbered far-flung
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: flaming suns stifled again the vanity of human conceit and I stood with
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: soul unbared and worshipful beneath the vista of incommensurate space
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: wherein the birth and death of worlds marks the unending roll of time.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: And at my side a silent gazing woman stood, contrite and humble and the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: thrill and quiver of her body filled me with a joy of wordless delight.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: A blundering guide began lecturing on astronomy and pointing out with
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: pompous gestures the constellations and planets. But Marguerite led me
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: beyond the sound of his voice. "It is not the time for listening to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: talk," she said. "I only want to see."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: When the astronomer had finished his speech-making, our party moved
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: slowly toward the East, where we could just discern the first faint
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: light of the coming dawn. When we reached the parapet of the eastern
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: edge of the city's roof, the stars had faded and pale pink streaked the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: eastern sky. The guides brought folding chairs from a nearby tunnel way
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and most of the party sat down on a hillock of sand, very much as men
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: might seat themselves in the grandstand of a race course. But I was so
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: interested in what the dawn would reveal beneath the changing colours of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the sky, that I led Marguerite to the rail of the parapet where we could
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: look down into the yawning depths upon the surface of German soil.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: My first vision over the parapet revealed but a mottled grey. But as the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: light brightened the grey land took form, and I discerned a few scraggly
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: patches of green between the torn masses of distorted soil.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The stars had faded now and only the pale moon remained in the bluing
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: sky, while below the land disclosed a sad monotony of ruin and waste,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: utterly devoid of any constructive work of man.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Marguerite, her gaze fixed on the dawn, was beginning to complain of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: light paining her eyes, when one of the guides hurried by with an open
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: satchel swung from his shoulders. "Here are your glasses," he said; "put
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: them on at once. You must be very careful now, or you will injure
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: your eyes."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: We accepted the darkened protecting lenses, but I found I did not need
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: mine until the sun itself had appeared above the horizon.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Did you see it so in your vision?" questioned Marguerite, as the first
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: beams glistened on the surface of the sanded roof.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "This," I replied, "is a very ordinary sunrise with a perfectly
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: cloudless sky. Some day, perhaps, when the gates of this prison of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Berlin are opened, we will be able to see all the sunrises of my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: visions, and even more wonderful ones."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Karl," she whispered, "how do you know of all these things? Sometimes I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: believe you are something more than human, that you of a truth possess
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the blood of divinity which the House of Hohenzollern claims."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "No," I answered; "not divinity,--just a little larger humanity, and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: some day very soon I am going to tell you more of the source of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: my visions."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: She looked at me through her darkened glasses. "I only know," she said,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "that you are wonderful, and very different from other men."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Had we been alone on the roof of Berlin, I could not have resisted the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: temptation to tell her then that stars and sun were familiar friends to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: me and that the devastated soil that stretched beneath us was but the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: wasted skeleton of a fairer earth I knew and loved. But we were
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: surrounded by a host of babbling sightseers and so the moment passed and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I remained to Marguerite a man of mystery and a seer of visions.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The sun fully risen now, we were led to a protruding observation
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: platform that permitted us to view the wall of the city below. It was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: merely one vast grey wall without interruption or opening in the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: monotonous surface.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Amid the more troubled chaos of the ground immediately below we could
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: see fragments of concrete blown from the parapet of the roof. The wall
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: beneath us, we were told, was only of sufficient thickness to withstand
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: fire of the aircraft guns. The havoc that might be wrought, should the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: defence mines ever be forced back and permit the walls of Berlin to come
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: within range of larger field pieces, was easily imagined. But so long as
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the Ray defence held, the massive fort of Berlin was quite impervious to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: attacks of the world forces of land and air and the stalemate of war
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: might continue for other centuries.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: With the coming of daylight we had heard the rumbling of trucks as the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: roof repairing force emerged to their task. Now that our party had
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: become tired of gazing through their goggles at the sun, our guides led
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: us in the direction where this work was in progress. On the way we
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: passed a single unfilled crater, a deep pit in the flinty quartz sand
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that spread a protecting blanket over the solid structure of the roof.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: These craters in the sand proved quite harmless except for the labour
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: involved in their refilling. Further on we came to another, now
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: half-filled from a spouting pipe with ground quartz blown from some
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: remote subterranean mine, so to keep up the wastage from wind
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and bombing.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Again we approached the edge of the city and this time found more of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: interest, for here an addition to the city was under construction. It
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: was but a single prism, not a hundred metres across, which when
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: completed would add but another block to the city's area. Already the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: outer pillars reached the full height and supported the temporary roof
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that offered at least a partial protection to the work in progress
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: beneath. Though I watched but a few minutes I was awed with the evident
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: rapidity of the building. Dimly I could see the forms below being swung
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: into place with a clock-like regularity and from numerous spouts great
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: streams of concrete poured like flowing lava.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: It is at these building sections that the bombs were aimed and here
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: alone that any effectual damage could be done, but the target was a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: small one for a plane flying above the reach of the German guns. The
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: officer who guided our group explained this to us: these bombing raids
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: were conducted only at times of particular cloud formations, when the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: veil of mist hung thick and low in an even stratum above which the air
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: was clear. When such formation threatened, the roof of Berlin was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: cleared and the expected bombs fell and spent their fury blowing up the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: sand. It had been a futile warfare, for the means of defence were equal
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to the means of offence.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Our visit to the roof of Berlin was cut short as the sun rose higher,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: because the women, though they had donned gloves and veils, were fearful
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of sunburn. So we were led back to the covered ramp into the endless
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: night of the city.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Have we seen it all?" sighed Marguerite, as she removed her veil and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: glasses and gazed back blinkingly into the last light of day.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Hardly," I said; "we have not seen a cloud, nor a drop of rain nor a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: flake of snow, nor a flash of lightning, nor heard a peal of thunder."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Again she looked at me with worshipful adoration. "I forget," she
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: whispered; "and can you vision those things also?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: But I only smiled and did not answer, for I saw Admiral von Kufner
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: glaring at me. I had monopolized Marguerite's company for the entire
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: occasion, and I was well aware that his only reason for arranging this,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to him a meaningless excursion, had been in the hopes of being with her.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: But Admiral von Kufner, contending fairly for that share of Marguerite's
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: time which she deigned to grant him, seemed to bear me no malice; and,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: as the months slipped by, I was gratified to find him becoming more
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: cordial toward me. We frequently met at the informal gatherings in the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: salon of the Countess Luise. More rarely Dr. Zimmern came there also,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: for by virtue of his office he was permitted the social rights of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Royal Level. I surmised, however, that this privilege, in his case, had
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: not included the right to marry on the level, for though the head of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Eugenic Staff, he had, so far as I could learn, neither wife
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: nor children.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: But Dr. Zimmern did not seem to relish royal society, for when he
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: chanced to be caught with me among the members of the Royal House the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: flow of his brilliant conversations was checked like a spring in a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: drought, and he usually took his departure as soon as it was seemly.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: On one of these occasions Admiral von Kufner came in as Zimmern sat
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: chatting over cups and incense with Marguerite and me, and the Countess
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and her son. The doctor dropped quietly out of the conversation, and for
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: a time the youthful Count Ulrich entertained us with a technical
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: elaboration of the importance of the love passion as the dominant appeal
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of the picture. Then the Countess broke in with a spirited exposition of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the relation of soul harmony to ardent passion.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Admiral von Kufner listened with ill-disguised impatience. "But all this
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: erotic passion," he interrupted, "will soon again be swept away by the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: revival of the greater race passion for world rule."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "My dear Admiral," said the Countess Luise, "your ideas of race passion
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: are quite proper for the classes who must be denied the free play of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: love element in their psychic life, but your notion of introducing these
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: ideas into the life of the Royal Level is wholly antiquated."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "It is you who are antiquated," returned the Admiral, "for now the day
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: is at hand when we shall again taste of danger. His Majesty has--"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Of course His Majesty has told us that the day is at hand," interrupted
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the Countess. "Has not His Majesty always preserved this allegorical
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: fable? It is part of the formal kultur."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But His Majesty now speaks the truth," replied the Admiral gravely,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "and I say to you who are so absorbed with the light passions of art and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: love that we shall not only taste of danger but will fight again in the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: sea and air and on the ground in the outer world. We shall conquer and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: rule the world."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "And do you think, Admiral," inquired Marguerite, "that the German
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: people will then be free in the outer world?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "They will be free to rule the outer world," replied the Admiral.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But I mean," said Marguerite calmly, "to ask if they will be free again
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to love and marry and rear their own children."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: At this naive question the others exchanged significant glances.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "My dear child," said the Countess, blushing with embarrassment, "your
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: defective training makes it extremely difficult for you to understand
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: these things."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Of course it is all forbidden," spoke up the young Count, "but now, if
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: it were not, the Princess Marguerite's unique idea would certainly make
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: capital picture material."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "How clever!" cried the Countess, beaming on her intellectual son.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Nothing is forbidden for plot material for the Royal Level. You shall
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: make a picture showing those great beasts of labour again liberated for
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: unrestricted love."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "There is one difficulty," Count Rudolph considered. "How could we get
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: actors for the parts? Our thoroughbred actors are all too light of bone,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: too delicate of motion, and our actresses bred for dainty beauty would
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: hardly caste well for those great hulking round-faced labour mothers."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Then," remarked the Admiral, "if you must make picture plays why not
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: one of the mating of German soldiers with the women of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: inferior races?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Wonderful!" exclaimed the plot maker; "and practical also. Our
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: actresses are the exact counterpart of those passionate French beauties.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I often study their portraits in the old galleries. They have had no
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Eugenics, hence they would be unchanged. Is it not so, Doctor?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Without Eugenics, a race changes with exceeding slowness," answered
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Zimmern in a voice devoid of expression. "I should say that the French
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: women of today would much resemble their ancestral types."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But picturing such matings of military necessity would be very
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: disgusting," reprimanded the Countess.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "It will be a very necessary part of the coming day of German dominion,"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: stated the Admiral. "How else can we expect to rule the world? It is,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: indeed, part of the ordained plan."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But how," I questioned, "is such a plan to be executed? Would the men
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of the World State tolerate it?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "We will oblige them to tolerate it; the children of the next generation
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of the inferior races must be born of German sires."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But the Germans are outnumbered ten to one," I replied.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Polygamy will take care of that, among the white races; the coloured
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: races must be eliminated. All breeding of the coloured races must cease.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: That, also, is part of the ordained plan."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The conversation was getting on rather dangerous ground for me as I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: realized that I dare not show too great surprise at this talk, which of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: all things I had heard in Germany was the most preposterous.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: But Marguerite made no effort to disguise her astonishment. "I thought,"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: she said, "that the German rule of the world was only a plan for
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: military victory and the conquering of the World Government. I supposed
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the people would be left free to live their personal lives as
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: they desired."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "That was the old idea," replied the Admiral, "in the days of open war,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: before the possibilities of eugenic science were fully realized. But the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: ordained plan revealed to His Majesty requires not only the military and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: political rule by the Germans, but the biologic conquest of the inferior
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: races by German blood."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I think our German system of scientific breeding is very brutal," spoke
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: up Marguerite with an intensity of feeling quite out of keeping with the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: calloused manner in which the older members of the Royal House discussed
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the subject.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The Admiral turned to her with a gracious air. "My lovely maiden," he
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: said, "your youth quite excuses your idealistic sentiments. You need
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: only to remember that you are a daughter of the House of Hohenzollern.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The women of this House are privileged always to cultivate and cherish
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the beautiful sentiments of romantic love and individual maternity. The
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: protected seclusion of the Royal Level exists that such love may bloom
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: untarnished by the grosser affairs of world necessity. It was so
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: ordained."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "It was so ordained by men," replied Marguerite defiantly, "and what are
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: these privileges while the German women are prostituted on the Free
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Level or forced to bear children only to lose them--and while you plan
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to enforce other women of the world into polygamous union with a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: conquering race?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "My dear child," said the Countess, "you must not speak in this wild
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: fashion. We women of the Royal House must fully realize our
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: privileges--and as for the Admiral's wonderful tale of world
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: conquest--that is only his latest hobby. It is talked, of course, in
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: military circles, but the defensive war is so dull, you know, especially
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: for the Royal officers, that they must have something to occupy
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: their minds."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "When the day arrives," snapped the Admiral, "you will find the Royal
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: officers leading the Germans to victory like Atilla and William the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Great himself."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Then why," twitted the Countess, "do you not board one of your
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: submarines and go forth to battle in the sea?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I am not courting unnecessary danger," retorted the Admiral; "but I am
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: not dead to the realities of war. My apartments are directly connected
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: with the roof."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "So you can hear the bomb explosions," suggested the Countess.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "And why not?" snapped the Admiral; "we must prepare for danger."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But you have not been bred for danger," scoffed the Countess. "Perhaps
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: you would do well to have your reactions to fear tested out in the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: psychic laboratories; if you should pass the test you might be elected
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: as a father of soldiers; it would surely set a good example to our
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: impecunious Hohenzollern bachelors for whom there are no wives."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The young Count evidently did not comprehend his mother's spirit of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: raillery. "Has that not been tried?" he asked, turning toward
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Dr. Zimmern.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "It has," stated the Eugenist, "more than a hundred years ago. There was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: once an entire regiment of such Hohenzollern soldiers in the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Bavarian mines."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "And how did they turn out?" I asked, my curiosity tempting me into
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: indiscretion.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "They mutinied and murdered their officers and then held an election--"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Zimmern paused and I caught his eye which seemed to say, "We have gone
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: too far with this."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Yes, and what happened?" queried the Countess.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "They all voted for themselves as Colonel," replied the Doctor drily.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: At this I looked for an outburst of indignation from the orthodox
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Admiral, but instead he seemed greatly elated. "Of course," he enthused;
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "the blood breeds true. It verily has the quality of true divinity. No
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: wonder we super-men repudiated that spineless conception of the soft
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Christian God and the servile Jewish Jesus."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But Jesus was not a coward," spoke up Marguerite. "I have read the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: story of his life; it is very wonderful; he was a brave man, who met his
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: death unflinchingly."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But where did you read it?" asked the Countess. "It must be very new. I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: try to keep up on the late novels but I never heard of this 'Story
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of Jesus.'"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "What you say is true," said the Admiral, turning to Marguerite, "but
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: since you like to read so well, you should get Prof. Ohlenslagger's book
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and learn the explanation of the fact that you have just stated. We have
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: long known that all those great men whom the inferior races claim as
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: their geniuses are of truth of German blood, and that the fighting
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: quality of the outer races is due to the German blood that was scattered
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: by our early emigrations.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But the distinctive contribution that Prof. Ohlenslagger makes to these
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: long established facts is in regard to the parentage of this man Jesus.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: In the Jewish accounts, which the Christians accepted, the truth was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: crudely covered up with a most unscientific fable, which credited the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: paternity of Jesus to miraculous interference with the laws of nature.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But now the truth comes out by Prof. Ohlenslagger's erudite reasoning.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: This unknown father of Jesus was an adventurer from Central Asia, a man
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of Teutonic blood. On no other conception can the mixed elements in the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: character of Jesus be explained. His was the case of a dual personality
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of conflicting inheritance. One day he would say: 'Lay up for yourself
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: treasures'--that was the Jewish blood speaking. The next day he would
title: City of Endless Night
