author: Hastings, Milo

text: say: 'I come to bring a sword'--that was the noble German blood of a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Teutonic ancestor. It is logical, it must be true, for it was reasoned
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: out by one of our most rational professors."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The Countess yawned; Marguerite sat silent with troubled brows; Dr.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Ludwig Zimmern gazed abstractedly toward the cold electric imitation of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: a fire, above which on a mantle stood two casts, diminutive
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: reproductions of the figures beside the door of the Emperor's palace,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the one the likeness of William the Great, the other the Statue of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: German God. But I was thinking of the news I had heard that afternoon
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: from my Ore Chief--that Captain Grauble's vessel had returned to Berlin.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: CHAPTER XIII
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: IN WHICH A WOMAN ACCUSES ME OF MURDER AND
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I PLACE A RUBY NECKLACE ABOUT HER THROAT
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Anxious to renew my acquaintance with Captain Grauble at the earliest
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: opportunity, I sent my social secretary to invite him to meet me for a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: dinner engagement in one of the popular halls of the Free Level.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: When I reached the dining hall I found Captain Grauble awaiting me. But
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: he was not alone. Seated with him were two girls and so strange a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: picture of contrast I had never seen. The girl on his right was an
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: extreme example of the prevailing blonde type. Her pinkish white skin
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: seemed transparent, her eyes were the palest blue and her hair was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: bright yet pale gold. About her neck was a chain of blue stones linked
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: with platinum. She was dressed in a mottled gown of light blue and gold,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and so subtly blended were the colours that she and her gown seemed to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: be part of the same created thing. But on Grauble's left sat a woman
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: whose gown was flashing crimson slashed with jetty black. Her skin was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: white with a positive whiteness of rare marble and her cheeks and lips
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: flamed with blood's own red. The sheen of her hair was that of a raven's
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: wing, and her eyes scintillated with the blackness of polished jade.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The pale girl, whom Grauble introduced as Elsa, languidly reached up her
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: pink fingers for me to kiss and then sank back, eyeing me with mild
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: curiosity. But as I now turned to be presented to the other, I saw the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: black-eyed beauty shrink and cower in an uncanny terror. Grauble again
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: repeated my name and then the name of the girl, and I, too, started in
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: fear, for the name he pronounced was "Katrina" and there flashed before
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: my vision the page from the diary that I had first read in the dank
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: chamber of the potash mine. In my memory's vision the words flamed and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: shouted: "In no other woman have I seen such a blackness of hair and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: eyes, combined with such a whiteness of skin."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The girl before me gave no sign of recognition, but only gripped the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: table and pierced me with the stare of her beady eyes. Nervously I sank
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: into a seat. Grauble, standing over the girl, looked down at her in
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: angry amazement. "What ails you?" he said roughly, shaking her by
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the shoulder.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: But the girl did not answer him and annoyed and bewildered, he sat down.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: For some moments no one spoke, and even the pale Elsa leaned forward and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: seemed to quiver with excitement.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Then the girl, Katrina, slowly rose from her chair. "Who are you?" she
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: demanded, in a hoarse, guttural voice, still gazing at me with
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: terrified eyes.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I did not answer, and Grauble again reached over and gripped the girl's
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: arm. "I told you who he was," he said. "He is Herr Karl von Armstadt of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the Chemical Staff."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: But, the girl did not sit down and continued to stare at me. Then she
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: raised a trembling hand and, pointing an accusing finger at me, she
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: cried in a piercing voice:
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "You are not Karl Armstadt, but an impostor posing as Karl Armstadt!"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: We were located in a well-filled dancing cafe, and the tragic voice of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the accuser brought a crowd of curious people about our table. Captain
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Grauble waved them back. As they pushed forward again, a street guard
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: elbowed in, brandishing his aluminum club and asking the cause of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: commotion. The bystanders indicated Katrina and the guard, edging up,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: gripped her arm and demanded an explanation.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Katrina repeated her accusation.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Evidently," suggested Grauble, "she has known another man of the same
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: name, and meeting Herr von Armstadt has recalled some tragic memory."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Perhaps," said the guard politely, "if the gentleman would show the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: young lady his identification folder, she would be convinced of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: her error."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: For a moment I hesitated, realizing full well what an inquiry might
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: reveal.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "No," I said, "I do not feel that it is necessary."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "He is afraid to show it," screamed the girl. "I tell you he is trying
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to pass for Armstadt but he is some one else. He looks like Karl
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Armstadt and at first I thought he was Karl Armstadt, but I know he
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: is not."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I looked swiftly at the surrounding faces, and saw upon them suspicion
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and accusation. "There may be something wrong," said a man in a military
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: uniform, "otherwise why should the gentleman of the staff hesitate to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: show his folder?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Very well," I said, pulling out my folder.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The guard glanced at it. "It seems to be all right," he said, addressing
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the group about the table; "now will you kindly resume your seats and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: not embarrass these gentlemen with your idle curiosity?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Let me see the folder!" cried Katrina.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Pardon," said the guard to me, "but I see no harm," and he handed her
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the folder.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: She glanced over it with feverish haste.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Are you satisfied now?" questioned the guard.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Yes," hissed the black-eyed girl; "I am satisfied that this is Karl
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Armstadt's folder. I know every word of it, but I tell you that the man
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: who carries it now is not the real Karl Armstadt." And then she wheeled
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: upon me and screamed, "You are not Karl Armstadt, Karl Armstadt is dead,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and you have murdered him!"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: In an instant the cafe was in an uproar. Men in a hundred types of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: uniform crowded forward; small women, rainbow-garbed, stood on the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: chairs and peered over taller heads of ponderous sisters of the labour
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: caste. Grauble again waved back the crowd and the guard brandished his
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: club threateningly toward some of the more inquisitive daughters
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of labour.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: When the crowd had fallen back to a more respectful distance, the guard
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: recovered my identification folder from Katrina and returned it to me.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Perhaps," he said, "you have known the young lady and do not again care
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to renew the acquaintance? If so, with your permission, I shall take her
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: where she will not trouble you again this evening."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "That may be best," I replied, wondering how I could explain the affair
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to Captain Grauble.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "The incident is most unfortunate," said the Captain, evidently a little
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: nettled, "but I think this rude force unnecessary. I know Katrina well,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: but I did not know she had previously known Herr von Armstadt. This
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: being the case, and he seeming not to wish to renew the acquaintance, I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: suggest that she leave of her own accord."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: But Katrina was not to be so easily dismissed. "No," she retorted, "I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: will not leave until this man tells me how he came by that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: identification folder and what became of the man I loved, whom he now
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: represents himself to be."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: At these words the guard, who had been about to leave, turned back.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I glanced apprehensively at Grauble who, seeing that I was grievously
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: wrought up over the affair, said quietly to the officer, "You had best
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: take her away."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Katrina, with a black look of hatred at Grauble, went without further
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: words, and the curious crowd quickly melted away. The three of us who
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: remained at the table resumed our seats and I ordered dinner.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "My, how Katrina frightened me!" exclaimed the fragile Elsa.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "She does have temper," admitted Grauble. "Odd, though, that she would
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: conceive that idea that you were some one else. I have heard of all
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: sorts of plans of revenge for disappointments in love, but that is a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: new one."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "You really know her?" questioned Elsa, turning her pale eyes upon me.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Oh, yes, I once knew her," I replied, trying to seem unconcerned; "but
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I did not recognize her at first."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "You mean you didn't care to," smiled Grauble. "Once a man had known
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that woman he would hardly forget her."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But you must have had a very emotional affair with her," said Elsa, "to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: make her take on like that. Do tell us about it."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I would rather not; there are some things one wishes to forget."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Grauble chided his dainty companion for her prying curiosity and tried
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to turn the conversation into less personal channels. But Elsa's
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: appetite for romance had been whetted and she kept reverting to the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: subject while I worried along trying to dismiss the matter. But the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: ending of the affair was not to be left in my hands; as we were sitting
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: about our empty cups, we saw Katrina re-enter the cafe in company with a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: high official of the level and the guard who had taken her away.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I am sorry to disturb you," said the official, addressing me
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: courteously, "but this girl is very insistent in her accusation, and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: perhaps, if you will aid us in the matter, it may prevent her making
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: further charges that might annoy you."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "And what do you wish me to do?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I suggest only that you should come to my office. I have telephoned to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: have the records looked up and that should satisfy all and so end
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the matter."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "You might come also," added the official, turning to Grauble, but he
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: waved back the curious Elsa who was eager to follow.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: When we reached his office in the Place of Records, the official who had
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: brought us thither turned to a man at a desk. "You have received the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: data on missing men?" he inquired.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The other handed him a sheet of paper.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The official turned to Katrina. "Will you state again, please, the time
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that you say the Karl Armstadt you knew disappeared?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Katrina quite accurately named the date at which the man whose identity
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I had assumed had been called to the potash mines.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Very well," said the official, taking up the sheet of paper, "here we
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: have the list of missing men for four years compiled from the weighers'
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: records. There is not recorded here the disappearance of a single
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: chemist during the whole period. If another man than a chemist should
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: try to step into a chemist's shoes, he would have a rather difficult
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: time of it." The official laughed as if he thought himself very clever.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But that man is not Karl Armstadt," cried Katrina in a wavering voice.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Do you think I would not know him when every night for--"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Shut up," said the official, "and get out of here, and if I hear
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: anything more of this matter I shall subtract your credit."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Katrina, now whimpering, was led from the room. The official beamed upon
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Capt. Grauble and myself. "Do you see," he said, "how perfectly our
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: records take care of these crazy accusations? The black haired one is
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: evidently touched in the head with jealousy, and now that she has
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: chanced upon you, she makes up this preposterous story, which might
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: cause you no end of annoyance, but here we have the absolute refutation
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of the charge. Before a man can step into another's shoes, he must step
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: out of his own. Murdered bodies can be destroyed, although that is
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: difficult, but one man cannot be two men!"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: We left the official chuckling over his cleverness.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "The Keeper of Records was wise after his kind," mused Grauble, "but it
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: never occurred to him that there might be chemists in the world who are
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: not registered in the card files of Berlin."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Grauble's voice sounded a note of aloofness and suspicion. Had he
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: penetrated my secret? Did I dare make full confession? Had Grauble given
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: me the least encouragement I should have done so, but he seemed to wish
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to avoid further discussion and I feared to risk it.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: My hope of a fuller understanding with Grauble seemed destroyed, and we
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: soon separated without further confidences.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: When I returned home from my offices one evening some days later, my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: secretary announced that a visitor was awaiting me.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I entered the reception-room and found Holknecht, who had been my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: chemical assistant in the early days of my work in Berlin. Holknecht had
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: seemed to me a servile fawning fellow and when I received my first
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: promotion I had deserted him quite brutally for the very excellent
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: reason that he had known the other Armstadt and I feared that his dulled
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: intelligence might at any time be aroused to penetrate my disguise. That
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: he should look me up in my advancement and prosperity, doubtless to beg
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: some favour, seemed plausible enough, and therefore with an air of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: condescending patronage, I asked what I could do for him.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "It is about Katrina," he said haltingly, as he eyed me curiously.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Well, what about her?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "She wants me to bring you to her."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But suppose I do not choose to go?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Then there may be trouble."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "She has already tried to make trouble," I said, "but nothing came of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: it."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But that," said Holknecht, "was before she saw me."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "And what have you told her?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I told her about Armstadt's going to the mines and you coming back to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the hospital wearing his clothes and possessed of his folder and of your
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: being out of your memory."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "You mean," I replied, determined not to acknowledge his assumption of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: my other identity, "that you explained to her how the illness had
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: changed me; and did that not make clear to her why she did not recognize
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: me at first?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "There is no use," insisted Holknecht, "of your talking like that. I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: never could quite make up my mind about you, though I always knew there
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: was something wrong. At first I believed the doctor's story, and that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: you were really Armstadt, though it did seem like a sort of magic, the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: way you were changed. But when you came to the laboratory and I saw you
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: work, I decided that you were somebody else and that the Chemical Staff
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: was working on some great secret and had a reason for putting some one
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: else in Armstadt's place. And now, of course, I know very well that that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: was so, for the other Karl Armstadt would never have become a von of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Royal Level. He didn't have that much brains."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: As Holknecht was speaking I had been thinking rapidly. The thing I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: feared was that the affair of the mine and hospital should be
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: investigated by some one with intelligence and authority. Since Katrina
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: had learned of that, and this Holknecht was also aware that I was a man
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of unknown identity, it was very evident that they might set some
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: serious investigation going. But the man's own remarks suggested a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: way out.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "You are quite right, Holknecht," I said; "I am not Karl Armstadt; and,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: just as you have surmised, there were grave reasons why I should have
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: been put into his place under those peculiar circumstances. But this
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: matter is a state secret of the Chemical Staff and you will do well to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: say nothing about it. Now is there anything I can do for you? A
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: promotion, perhaps, to a good position in the Protium Works?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "No," said Holknecht, "I would rather stay where I am, but I could use a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: little extra money."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Of course; a check, perhaps; a little gift from an old friend who has
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: risen to power; there would be no difficulty in that, would there?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I think it would go through all right."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I will make it now; say five thousand marks, and if nothing more is
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: said of this matter by you or Katrina, there will be another one like it
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: a year later."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The young man's eyes gloated as I wrote the check, which he pocketed
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: with greedy satisfaction. "Now," I said, "will this end the affair for
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the present?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "This makes it all right with me," replied Holknecht, "but what about
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Katrina?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But you are to take care of her. She can only accept two hundred marks
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: a month and I have given you enough for that four times over."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But she doesn't want money; she already has a full list."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Then what does she want?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Jewels, of course; they all want them; jewels from the Royal Level, and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: she knows you can get them for her."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Oh, I see. Well, what would please her?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "A necklace of rubies, the best they have, one that will cost at least
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: twenty thousand marks."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "That's rather expensive, is it not?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But her favourite lover disappeared," fenced Holknecht, "and his death
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: was never entered on the records. It may be the Chemical Staff knows
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: what became of him and maybe they do not; whatever happened, you seem to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: want it kept still, so you had best get the necklace."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: After a little further arguing that revealed nothing, I went to the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Royal Level, and searching out a jewelry shop, I purchased a necklace of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: very beautiful synthetic rubies, for which I gave my check for twenty
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: thousand marks.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Returning to my apartment, I found Holknecht still waiting. He insisted
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: on taking the necklace to Katrina, but I feared to trust a man who
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: accepted bribes so shamelessly, and decided to go with him and deliver
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: it in person.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Sullenly, Holknecht led the way to her apartment.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Katrina sensuously gowned in flaming red was awaiting the outcome of her
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: blackmailing venture. She motioned me to a chair near her, while
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Holknecht, utterly ignored, sank obscurely into a corner.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "So you came," said the lady of black and scarlet, leaning back among
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: her pillows and gazing at me through half closed eyes.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Yes," I said, "since you have looked up Holknecht and he has explained
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to you the reason for the disappearance of the man you knew, I thought
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: best to see you and have an understanding."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But that dumb fellow explained nothing," declared Katrina, "except that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: he told me that Armstadt went to the mines and you came back and took
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: his place. He wasn't even sure you were not the other Karl Armstadt
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: until I convinced him, and then he claimed that he had known it all the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: time; and yet he had never told it. Some men are as dull as books."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "On the contrary, Holknecht is very sensible," I replied. "It is a grave
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: affair of state and one that it is best not to probe into."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "And just what did become of the other Armstadt?" asked Katrina, and in
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: her voice was only a curiosity, with no real concern.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "To tell you the truth, your lover was killed in the mine explosion," I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: replied, for I thought it unwise to state that he was still alive lest
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: she pursue her inquiries for him and so make further trouble.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "That is too bad," said Katrina. "You see, when I knew him he was only a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: chemical captain. And when he deserted me I didn't really care much. But
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: when the Royal Captain Grauble asked me to meet a Karl von Armstadt of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the Chemical Staff, at first I could not believe that it was the same
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: man I had known, but I made inquiries and learned of your rapid rise and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: traced it back and I thought you really were my old Karl. And when I saw
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: you, you seemed to be he, but when I looked again I knew that you were
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: another and I was so disappointed and angry that I lost control of my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: temper. I am sorry I made a scene, and that official was so stupid--as
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: if I would not know one man from another! How I should like to tell him
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that I knew more than his stupid records."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But that is not best," I said; "your former lover is dead and there are
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: grave reasons why that death should not be investigated further--" The
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: argument was becoming a little difficult for me and I hastened to add:
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Since you were so discourteously treated by the official, I feel that I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: owe you some little token of reparation."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I now drew out the necklace and held it out to the girl.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Her black eyes gleamed with triumph at the sight of the bauble. Greedily
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: she grasped it and held it up between her and the light, turning it
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: about and watching the red rays gleaming through the stones. "And now,"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: she gloated, "that faded Elsa will cease to lord it over me--and to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: think that another Karl Armstadt has brought me this--why that stingy
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: fellow would never have bought me a blue-stone ring, if he had been made
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the Emperor's Minister."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: round my neck?" she asked, holding out the necklace.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Nor daring to give offence, I took the chain of rubies and attempted to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: fasten it round her neck. The mechanism of the fastening was strange to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: me and I was some time in getting the thing adjusted. Just as I had
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: succeeded in hooking the clasp, I heard a curdled oath and the neglected
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Holknecht hurled himself upon us, striking me on the temple with one
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: fist and clutching at the throat of the girl with the other hand.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The blow sent me reeling to the floor but in another instant I was up
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and had collared him and dragged him away.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Damn you both," he whimpered; "where do I come in?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Put him out," said Katrina, with a glance of disdain at the cowering
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: man.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I will go," snarled Holknecht, and he wrenched from my grasp and darted
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: toward the door. I followed, but he was fairly running down the passage
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and pursuit was too undignified a thing to consider.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "You should have paid him," said Katrina, "for delivering my message."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I have paid him," I replied. "I paid him very well."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I wonder if he thought," she laughed, "that I would pay any attention
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to a man of his petty rank. Why, I snubbed him unmercifully years ago

author: Hastings, Milo

text: when the other Armstadt had the audacity to introduce me."

author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Of course," I replied, "he does not understand."

author: Hastings, Milo

author: Hastings, Milo

text: could get away without giving offence to the second member of my pair of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: blackmailers. But a little later I managed it, as it has been managed
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: for centuries, by looking suddenly at my watch and recalling a forgotten
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: appointment.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "You will come again?" purred Katrina.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Of course," I said, "I must come again, for you are very charming, but
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I am afraid it will not be for some time as I have very important duties
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and just at present my leisure is exceedingly limited."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: And so I made my escape, and hastened home. After debating the question
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: pro and con I typed a note to Holknecht in which I assured him that I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: had not the least interest in Katrina. "Perhaps," I wrote, "when she has
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: tired a bit of the necklace, she would appreciate something else. But it

author: Hastings, Milo

text: would not be wise to hurry this; but if you will call around in a month
title: City of Endless Night

text: or so, I think I can arrange for you to get her something and present it
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: yourself, as I do not care to see her again."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: CHAPTER XIV
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: THE BLACK SPOT IS ERASED FROM THE MAP OF THE WORLD AND
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: THERE IS DANCING IN THE SUNLIGHT ON THE ROOF OF BERLIN
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The relative ease with which I had so long passed for the real Karl
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Armstadt had lulled me into a feeling of security. But now that my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: disguise had been penetrated, my old fears were renewed. True, the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: weigher's records had seemingly cleared me, but I knew that Grauble had
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: seen the weak spot in the German logic of the stupid official, who had
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: so lightly dismissed Katrina's accusations. Moreover, I fancied that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Grauble had guessed the full truth and connected this uncertainty of my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: identity with the seditious tenor of the suggestions I had made to him.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Even though he might be willing to discuss rebellious plans with a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: German, could I count on him to consider the treasonable urging coming
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: from a man of another and an enemy race?
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: So fearing either to confess to him my identity or to proceed without
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: confessing, I postponed doing anything. The sailing date of his fifth
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: trip to the Arctic was fast approaching; if I was ever to board a vessel
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: leaving Berlin I would need von Kufner's permission. Marguerite reported
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the growing cordiality of the Admiral. Although I realized that his
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: infatuation for her was becoming rather serious, with the confidence of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: an accepted lover, I never imagined that he could really come between
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Marguerite and myself.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: But one evening when I went to call upon Marguerite she was "not at
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: home." I repeated the call with the same result. When I called her up by
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: telephone, her secretary bluntly told me that the Princess Marguerite
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: did not care to speak to me. I hastened to write an impassioned note,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: pleading to see her at once, for the days were passing and there was now
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: but a week before Grauble's vessel was due to depart.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: In desperation I waited two more days, and still no word came. My
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: letters of pleading, like my calls and telephone efforts, were
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: still ignored.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Then a messenger came bearing a note from Admiral von Kufner, asking me
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to call upon him at once.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I have been considering," began von Kufner, when I entered his office,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "the request you made of me some time ago to be permitted to go in
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: person to make a survey of the ore deposits. At first I opposed this, as
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the trip is dangerous, but more recently I have reconsidered the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: importance of it. As others are now fully able to continue your work
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: here, I can quite conceive that your risking the trip to the mines in
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: person would be a very courageous and noble sacrifice. So I have taken
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the matter up with His Majesty."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: With mocking politeness von Kufner now handed me a document bearing the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: imperial seal.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I held it with a trembling hand as I glanced over the fateful words that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: commissioned me to go at once to the Arctic.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: My smouldering jealousy of the oily von Kufner now flamed into
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: expression. "You have done this thing from personal motives," I cried.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "You have revoked your previous decision because you want me out of your
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: way. You know I will be gone for six months at least. You hope in your
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: cowardly heart that I will never come back."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Von Kufner's lips curled. "You see fit," he answered, "to impugn my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: motives in suggesting that the order be issued, although it is the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: granting of your own request. But the commission you hold in your hand
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: bears the Imperial signature, and the Emperor of the Germans never
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: revokes his orders."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Very well," I said, controlling my rage, "I will go."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Upon leaving the Admiral's office my first thought was to go at once to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Marguerite. Whatever might be the nature of her quarrel with me I was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: now sure that von Kufner was at the bottom of it, and that it was in
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: some way connected with this sudden determination of his to send me to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the Arctic, hoping that I would never return.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: But before I had gone far I began to consider other matters. I was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: commissioned to leave Berlin by submarine and that too by the vessel in
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: command of Captain Grauble, whom I knew to be nursing rebellion and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: mutiny in his heart. If deliverance from Berlin was ever to come, it had
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: come now. To refuse to embrace it would mean to lose for ever this
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: fortunate chance to escape from this sunless Babylon.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I would therefore go first to Grauble and determine without delay if he
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: could be relied on to make the attempt to reach the outer world. Once I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: knew that, I could go then to Marguerite with an invitation for her to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: join me in flight--if such a thing were humanly possible.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: But recalling the men who had done so much to fill me with hope and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: faith in the righteousness of my mission, I again changed my plan and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: sought out Dr. Zimmern and Col. Hellar and arranged for them to meet me
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that evening at Grauble's quarters.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: At the hour appointed I, who had first arrived at the apartment, sat
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: waiting for the arrival of Zimmern. When he came, to my surprise and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: bewildered joy he was not alone, for Marguerite was with him.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: She greeted me with distress and penitence in her eyes and I exulted in
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the belief that whatever her quarrel with me might be it meant no
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: irretrievable loss of her devotion and love.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: We sat about the room, a very solemn conclave, for I had already
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: informed Grauble of my commission to go to the Arctic, and he had sensed
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: at once the revolutionary nature of the meeting. I now gave him a brief
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: statement of the faith of the older men, who from the fulness of their
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: lives had reached the belief that the true patriotism for their race was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to be expressed in an effort to regain for the Germans the citizenship
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of the world.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The young Captain gravely nodded. "I have not lived so long," he said,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "but my life has been bitter and full of fear. I am not out of sympathy
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: with your argument, but before we go further," and he turned to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Marguerite, "may I not ask why a Princess of the House of Hohenzollern
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: is included in such a meeting as this?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I turned expectantly to Zimmern, who now gave Grauble an account of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: tragedy and romance of Marguerite's life.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Very well," said Grauble; "she has earned her place with us; now that I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: understand her part, let us proceed."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: For some hours Hellar and Zimmern explained their reasons for believing
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the life of the isolated German race was evil and defended their faith
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: in the hope of salvation through an appeal to the mercy and justice of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the World State.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Of all this I am easily convinced," said Grauble, "for it is but a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: logically thought-out conclusion of the feeling I have nourished in my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: blind rebellion. I am ready to go with Herr von Armstadt and surrender
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: my vessel to the enemy; but the practical question is, will our risk
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: avail anything? What hope can we have that we will even be able to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: deliver the message you wish to send? How are we to know that we will
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: not immediately be killed?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The hour had come. "I will answer that question," I said, and there was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: a tenseness in my tone that caused my hearers to look at me with eager,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: questioning eyes.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Barring," I said, "the possibility of destruction before I can gain
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: opportunity to speak to some one in authority, there is nothing to fear
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: in the way of our ungracious reception in the outer world--" As I paused
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and looked about me I saw Marguerite's eyes shining with the same
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: worshipful wonder as when I had visioned for her the sunlight and the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: storms of the world outside Berlin--"because I am of that world. I speak
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: their language. I know their people. I never saw the inside of Berlin
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: until I was brought here from the potash mines of Stassfurt, wearing the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: clothes and carrying the identification papers of one Karl Armstadt who
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: was killed by gas bombs which I myself had ordered dropped into
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: those mines."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: At these startling statements the older men could only gasp in
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: incredulous astonishment, but Captain Grauble nodded wisely--"I half
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: expected as much," he said.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I turned to Marguerite. Her eyes were swimming in a mist of tears.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Then your visions were real memories," she cried,--"and not miracles. I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: knew you had seen other worlds, but I thought it was in some spirit
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: life." She reached out a trembling hand toward me and then shrinkingly
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: drew it back. "But you are not Karl Armstadt," she stammered, as she
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: realized that I was a nameless stranger.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "No," I said, going to her and placing a reassuring arm about her
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: shoulder, "I am not Karl Armstadt. My name is Lyman de Forrest. I am an
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: American, a chemical engineer from the city of Chicago, and if Captain
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Grauble does not alter his purpose, I am going back there and will take
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: you with me."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Zimmern and Hellar were listening in consternation. "How is it," asked
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Hellar, "that you speak German?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: By way of answer I addressed him in English and in French, while he and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Zimmern glanced at each other as do men who see a miracle and strive to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: hold their reason while their senses contradict their logic.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I now sketched the story of my life and adventures with a fulness of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: convincing detail. One incident only I omitted and that was of the near
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: discovery of my identity by Armstadt's former mistress. Of that I did
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: not speak for I felt that Marguerite, at least in the presence of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: others, would not relish that part of the story. Nor did I wish to worry
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: them with the fear that was still upon me that I had not seen the last
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of that affair.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: After answering many questions and satisfying all doubts as to the truth
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of my story, I again turned the conversation to the practical problem of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the escape from Berlin. "You can now see," I declared, "that I deserve
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: no credit for genius or courage. I am merely a prisoner in an enemy city
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: where my life is in constant danger. If any one of you should speak the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: word, I would be promptly disposed of as a spy. But if you are sincere
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: in your desire to send a message to my Government, I am here to take
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that message."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "It almost makes one believe that there is a God," cried Hellar, "and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that he has sent us a deliverer."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "As for me," spoke up Captain Grauble, "I shall deliver your messenger
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: into the hands of his friends, and trust that he can persuade them to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: deal graciously with me and my men. I should have made this break for
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: liberty before had I not believed it would be fleeing from one death
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to another."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Then you will surely leave us," said Zimmern. "It is more than we have
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: wished and prayed for, but," he added, turning a compassionate glance
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: toward Marguerite, "it will be hard for her."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But she is going with us," I affirmed. "I will not leave her behind. As
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: for you and Col Hellar, I shall see you again when Berlin is free. But
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the risks are great and the time may be long, and if Marguerite will go
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I will take her with me as a pledge that I shall not prove false in my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: mission for you, her people."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I read Marguerite's answer in the joy of her eyes, as I heard Col.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Hellar say: "That would be fine, if it were possible."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: But Zimmern shook his head. "No," he said, as if commanding. "Marguerite
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: must not go now even if it were possible. You may come back for her if
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: you succeed in your mission, but we cannot lose her now; she must not go
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: now,--" and his voice trembled with deep emotion. At his words of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: authority concerning the girl I loved I felt a resurge of the old
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: suspicion and jealousy.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I am sorry," spoke up Captain Grauble, "but your desire to take the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Princess Marguerite with you is one that I fear cannot be realized. I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: would be perfectly willing for her to go if we could once get her
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: aboard, but the approach of the submarine docks are very elaborately
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: guarded. To smuggle a man aboard without a proper permit would be
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: exceedingly difficult, but to get a woman to the vessel is quite
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: impossible."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I suppose that it cannot be," I said, for I saw the futility of arguing
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the matter further at the time, especially as Zimmern was opposed to it.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The night was now far spent and but four days remained in which to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: complete my preparations for departure. In this labour Zimmern and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Hellar could be of no service and I therefore took my leave of them,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: lest I should not see them again. "Within a year at most," I said, "we
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: may meet again, for Berlin will be open to the world. Once the passage
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: is revealed and the protium traffic stopped, the food stores cannot last
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: longer. When these facts are realized by His Majesty and the Advisory
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Council, let us hope they will see the futility of resisting. The
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: knowledge that Germany possesses will increase the world's food supply
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: far more than her population will add to the consumptive demands, hence if
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: reason and sanity prevail on both sides there will be no excuse for war
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and suffering."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: And so I took my leave of the two men from whose noble souls I had
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: achieved my aspirations to bring the century-old siege of Berlin to a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: sane and peaceful end without the needless waste of life that all the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: world outside had always believed would be an inevitable part of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: capitulation of the armoured city.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I now walked with Marguerite through the deserted tree-lined avenues of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the Royal Level.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "And why, dear," I asked, "have you refused to see me these five days
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: past?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Oh, Karl," she cried, "you must forgive me, for nothing matters now--I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: have been crazed with jealousy. I was so hurt that I could see no one,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: for I could only fight it out alone."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "And what do you mean?" I questioned. "Jealous? And of whom could you be
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: jealous, since there is no other woman in this unhappy city for whom I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: have ever cared?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Yes, I believe that. I haven't doubted that you loved me with a nobler
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: love than the others, but you told me there were no others, and I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: believed you. So it was hard, so very hard. The Doctor--I saw Dr.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Zimmern this morning and poured out my heart to him--insisted that I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: should accept the fact that until marriage all men were like that, and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: it could not be helped. But I never asked you, Karl, about other women;
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: you yourself volunteered to tell me there were no others, and what you
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: told me was not true. I must forgive you, for now I may lose you, but
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: why does a man ever need to lie to a woman? I somehow feel that love
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: means truth--"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But," I insisted, "it was the truth. I bear no personal relation to any
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: other woman."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: She drew back from me, breathing quickly, faith and doubt fighting a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: battle royal in her eyes. "But the checks, Karl?" she stammered; "those
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: checks the girl on the Free Level cashes each month, and worse than that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the check at the Jeweller's where you bought a necklace for twenty
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: thousand marks?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Quite right, there are such checks, and I shall explain them. But
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: before I begin, may I ask just how you came to know about those checks?
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Not that I care; I am glad you do know; but the fact of your knowledge
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: puzzles me, for I thought the privacy of a man's checking account was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: one of the unfair privileges that man has usurped for himself and not
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: granted to women."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But I did not pry into the matter. I would never have thought of such a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: thing until he forced the facts upon me."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "He? You mean von Kufner?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Yes, it was five days ago. I was out walking with him and he insisted
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: on my going into a jewellery store we were passing. I at first refused
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to go as I thought he wished to buy me something. But he insisted that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: he merely wanted me to look at things and I went in. You see, I was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: trying not to offend him."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Of course," I said, "there was no harm in that. And--"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "The Admiral winked at the Jeweller. I saw him do that; and the jeweller
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: set out a tray of ruby necklaces and began to talk about them, and then
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: von Kufner remarked that since they were so expensive he must not sell
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: many. 'Oh, yes,' said the Jeweller, 'I sell a great number to young men
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: who have just come into money. I sold one the other day to Herr von
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Armstadt of the Chemical Staff,' and he reached for his sales book and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: opened it to the page with a record of the sale. He had the place
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: marked, for I saw him remove a slip as he opened the book."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Rather clever of von Kufner," I commented; "how do you suppose he got
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: trail of it?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "He admitted his trailing quite frankly," said Marguerite, "for as soon
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: as we were out of the shop, I accused him of preparing the scene. 'Of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: course,' he said, 'but I had to convince you that your chemist was not
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: so saintly as you thought him. His banker is a friend of mine, and I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: asked him about von Armstadt's account. He is keeping a girl on the Free
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Level and evidently also making love to one of better caste, or he would
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: hardly be buying ruby necklaces.' I told von Kufner that he was a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: miserable spy, but he only laughed at me and said that all men were
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: alike and that I ought to find it out while I was young--and then he
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: asked if I would like him to have the young woman's record sent up from
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the Free Level for my inspection. I ordered him to leave me at once and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I have not seen or heard from him since, until I received a note from
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: him today telling me of the Royal order for you to go to the Arctic."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I first set Marguerite's mind at ease about the checks to Bertha by
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: explaining the incident of the geography, and then told the story of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Katrina and the meeting in the cafe, and the later affair of Holknecht
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and the necklace.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "And you will promise me never to see her again?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But you have forgotten," I said, "that I am leaving Berlin in four
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: days."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Oh, Karl," she cried, "I have forgotten everything--I cannot even
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: remember that new name you gave us--I believe I must be dreaming--or
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that it is all a wild story you have told us to see how much we in our
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: simplicity and ignorance will believe."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "No," I said gently, "it is not a dream, though I could wish that it
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: were, for Grauble says that there is no hope of taking you with me; and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: yet I must go, for the Emperor has ordered me to the Arctic and von
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Kufner will see to it that I make no excuses. If I once leave Berlin by
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: submarine with Grauble I do not see how I can refuse to carry out my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: part of this project to which I am pledged, and make the effort to reach
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the free world outside."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Marguerite turned on me with a bitter laugh. "The free world," she
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: cried, "your world. You are going back to it and leave me here. You are
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: going back to your own people--you will not save Germany at all--you
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: will never come back for me!"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "You are very wrong," I said gently. "It is because I have known you and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: known such men as Dr. Zimmern and Col. Hellar that I do want to carry
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the message that will for ever end this sunless life of your
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: imprisoned race."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But," cried Marguerite, "you do not want to take me; you could find a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: way if you would--you made the Emperor do your bidding once--you could
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: do it again if you wanted to."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I very much want to take you; to go without you would be but a bitter
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: success."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But have you no wife, or no girl you love among your own people?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "No."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But if I should go with you, the people of your world would welcome you
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: but they would imprison me or kill me as a spy."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "No," and I smiled as I answered, "they do not kill women."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: During four brief days that remained until Capt. Grauble's vessel was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: due to depart my every hour was full of hurried preparations for my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: survey of the Arctic mines. Clothing for the rigours and rough labour of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that fearful region had to be obtained and I had to get together the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: reports of previous surveys and the instruments for the ore analyses
