title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that would be needed. Nor was I altogether faithless in these
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: preparations for at times I felt that my first duty might be thus to aid
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: in the further provisioning of the imprisoned race, for how was I to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: know that I would be able to end the state of war that had prevailed in
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: spite of the generations of pacifist efforts? At times I even doubted
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that this break for the outer world would ever be made. I doubted that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Capt. Grauble, though he solemnly assured us that he was ready for the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: venture, was acting in good faith. Could he, I asked, persuade his men
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to their part of the adventure? Would not our traitorous design be
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: discovered and we both be returned as prisoners to Berlin? Granted even
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that Grauble could carry out his part and that the submarine proceeded
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: as planned to rise to the surface or attempt to make some port, with the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: best of intentions of surrendering to the World State authorities, might
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: not we be destroyed before we could make clear our peaceful and friendly
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: intentions? Could I, coming out of Germany with Germans prove my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: identity? Would my story be believed? Would I have believed such a story
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: before the days of my sojourn among the Germans? Might I not be
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: consigned to languish in prison as a merely clever German spy, or be
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: consigned to an insanity ward?
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: At times I doubted even my own desire to escape from Berlin if it meant
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the desertion of Marguerite, for there could be no joy in escape for me
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: without her. Yet I found small relish in looking forward to life as a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: member of that futile clan of parasitical Royalty. Had Germany been a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: free society where we might hope to live in peace and freedom perhaps I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: could have looked forward to a marriage with Marguerite and considered
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: life among the Germans a tolerable thing. But for such a life as we must
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: needs live, albeit the most decent Berlin had to offer, I could find no
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: relish--and the thought of escape and call of duty beyond the bomb proof
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: walls and poisoned soil called more strongly than could any thought of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: love and domesticity within the accursed circle of fraudulent divinity.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: There was also the danger that lurked for me in Holknecht's knowledge of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: my identity and the bitterness of his anger born of his insane and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: stupid jealousy.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Rather than remain longer in Berlin I would take any chance and risk any
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: danger if only Marguerite were not to be left behind. And yet she must
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: be left behind, for such a thing as getting a woman aboard a submarine
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: or even to the submarine docks had never been heard of. I thought of all
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the usual tricks of disguising her as a man, of smuggling her as a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: stowaway amidst the cargo, but Grauble's insistence upon the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: impossibility of such plans had made it all too clear that any such wild
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: attempt would lead to the undoing of us all.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: If escape were possible with Marguerite--! But cold reason said that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: escape was improbable enough for me alone. For a woman of the House of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Hohenzollern the prison of Berlin had walls of granite and locks
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of steel.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The time of departure drew nearer. I had already been passed down by the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: stealthy guards and through the numerous locked and barred gates to the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: subterranean docks where Grauble's vessel, the _Eitel 3_, rested on the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: heavy trucks that would bear her away through the tunnel to the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: pneumatic lock that would float her into the passage that led to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the open sea.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: My supplies and apparatus were stored on board and the crew were making
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: ready to be off. But three hours were left until the time of our
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: departure and these hours I had set aside for my final leave-taking of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Marguerite. I hastened back through the guarded gates to the elevator
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and was quickly lifted to the Royal Level where Marguerite was to be
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: waiting for me.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: With fast beating and rebellious heart I rang the bell of the Countess'
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: apartment. I could scarcely believe I heard aright when the servant
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: informed me that the Princess Marguerite had gone out.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I demanded to see the Countess and was ushered into the reception-room
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and suffered unbearably during the few minutes till she appeared. To my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: excited question she replied with a teasing smile that Marguerite had
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: gone out a half hour before with Admiral von Kufner. "I warned you,"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: said the Countess as she saw the tortured expression of my face, "but
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: you would not believe me, when I told you the Admiral would prove a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: dangerous man."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But it is impossible," I cried. "I am leaving for the Arctic mines. I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: have only a couple of hours; surely you are hiding something. Did you
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: see her go? Did she leave no word? Do you know where they have gone or
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: when they will return?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The Countess shook her head. "I only know," she replied more
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: sympathetically, "that Marguerite seemed very excited all morning. She
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: talked with me of your leaving and seemed very wrought up over it, and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: then but an hour or so ago she rushed into her room and telephoned--it
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: must have been to the Admiral, for he came shortly afterwards. They
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: talked together for a little while and then, without a word to me they
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: went out, seeming to be in a great hurry. Perhaps she felt so upset over
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: your leaving that she thought it kinder not to risk a parting scene. She
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: is so honest, poor child, that she probably did not wish to send you
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: away with any false hopes."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But do you mean," I cried, "that you think she has gone out with von
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Kufner to avoid seeing me?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I am sorry," consoled the Countess, "but it looks that way. It was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: cruel of her, for she might have sent you away with hope to live on till
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: your return, even if she felt she could not wait for you."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I strove not to show my anger to the Countess, for, considering her
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: ignorance of the true significance of the occasion, I could not expect a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: full understanding.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Miserably I waited for two hours as the Countess tried to entertain me
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: with her misplaced efforts at sympathy while I battled to keep my faith
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: in Marguerite alive despite the damaging evidence that she had deserted
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: me at the last hour.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I telephoned to von Kufner's office and to his residence but could get
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: no word as to his whereabouts, and Marguerite did not return.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I dared not wait any longer--asking for envelope and paper, I penned a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: hasty note to Marguerite: "I shall go on to the Arctic and come back to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: you. The salvation of Berlin must wait till you can go with me. I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: cannot, will not, lose you."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: And then I tore myself away and hastened to the elevator and was dropped
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to a subterranean level and passed again through the locked and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: guarded gates.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: As I came to the vessel no one was in sight but the regular guards
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: pacing along the loading docks. I mounted the ladder to the deck. The
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: second officer stood by the open trap. "They are waiting for you," he
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: said. "The Admiral himself is below. He came with his lady to see
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: you off."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I hastened to descend and saw von Kufner and Marguerite chatting with
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Captain Grauble.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Why the delay?" asked von Kufner. "It is nearly the hour of departure,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and I have brought the Princess to bid you farewell. We have been
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: showing her the vessel."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "It is all very wonderful," said Marguerite with a calm voice, but her
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: eyes spoke the feverish excitement of a great adventure.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "The Princess Marguerite," said von Kufner, "is the only woman who has
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: ever seen a submarine since the open sea traffic was closed. But she has
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: seen it all and now we must take our leave for it is time that you
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: should be off."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: As he finished speaking the Admiral politely stepped away to give me
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: opportunity for a farewell word with Marguerite. Grauble followed him
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and, as he passed me, he gave me a look of gloating triumph and then
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: opened the door of his cabin, which the Admiral entered.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I am going with you," whispered Marguerite. "Grauble understands."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: There was the sound of a scuffle and a strangled oath. Grauble's head
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: appeared at the cabin door. "Here, Armstadt; be quick, and keep
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: him quiet."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I plunged into the cabin and saw von Kufner crumpled against the bunk;
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: his hands were manacled behind him and his mouth stuffed with a cloth.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: With an exulting joy I threw myself upon the man as he struggled to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: rise. I easily held him down, and whipping out my own kerchief I bound
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: it tightly across his mouth to more effectively gag him.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Then rolling him over I planted my knee on his back while I ripped a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: sheet from the bunk and bound his feet.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: From without I heard Grauble's voice in command: "Close the hatch." Then
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I felt the vessel quiver with machinery in motion and I knew that we
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: were moving along the tunnel toward the sea.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Grauble appeared again in the door of the cabin. "The mate understands,"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: he said, "and the crew will obey. I told them that the Admiral was going
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: out with us to inspect the lock. But the presence of a woman aboard will
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: puzzle them. I have placed the Princess in the mate's cabin so no one
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: can molest her. We have other things to keep us occupied."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: With Grauble's help I now bound von Kufner to the staunch metal leg of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the bunk and we left him alone in the narrow room to ponder on the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: meaning of what he had heard.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Outside Grauble led me over to the instrument board where the mate was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: stationed.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Any unusual message?" asked Grauble.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "None," said the mate. "I think we will go through without interruption
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: at least until we reach the lock; if anything is suspicioned we will be
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: held up there for examination."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Do you think the guards at the dock suspected anything?" questioned
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Grauble.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "It is not likely," replied the mate. "They saw him come aboard, but he
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: spoke to none of them. They will presume he is going out to the lock.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The presence of a woman will puzzle them; but, as she was with the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Admiral, they will not dare interfere or even report the fact."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Then what do you think we have to fear?" asked Grauble.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Only the chance that the Admiral's absence may be noted at his office
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and inquiry be made."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Of that the Princess could tell us something," said Grauble. "We will
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: talk with her."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Grauble now led me to the mate's snug cabin, where we found Marguerite
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: seated on the bunk, looking very pale and anxious.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Everything is going nicely, so far," the Captain assured her. "We have
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: only one thing to fear, and that is that inquiry from the Administration
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Office for the Admiral may be addressed to the Commander of the Lock."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But how will they know that he is with us?" asked Marguerite. "Will the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: guards report it?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I do not think so," said Grauble, "but does any one at his office know
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that he came to the docks?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I do not see how they could," replied Marguerite; "he was at his
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: apartment when I called him. He came to me at once, not knowing why I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: wished to see him. I begged him to take me to see you off. I swore that
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: if he did not I should never speak to him again, and he agreed to do so.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: He seemed to think himself very generous and talked much of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: distinctive privilege he was conferring upon me by acceding to my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: request. But he told no one where we were going. He communicated with no
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: one from the time he came to me until we arrived at the vessel. The
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: guards and gate-keepers let us pass without question."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "That is fine," cried Grauble; "von Kufner often stays away from his
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: office for days at a time. Unless some chance information leaks back
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: from the guards, he will not be missed. Our chance of being passed
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: speedily out the lock is good--there is a vessel due to lock in this
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: very day and we could not be held back to block the tunnel. That is why
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the Admiral was impatient when Armstadt failed to appear; he knew our
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: departure ought not be delayed."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "And what," I asked, "do you propose to do with the Admiral?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I suppose we must take him with us as a prisoner," replied the Captain.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Your World State Government would appreciate a prisoner of the House of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Hohenzollern."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: At this suggestion Marguerite shook her head emphatically. "I do not
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: like that," she said. "Is there not some way to leave him behind?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I do not like it either," said Grauble, "because I fear his presence
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: aboard may make trouble among my men. I do not think they will object to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: deserting with us to the free world. Their life in this service is
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: hopeless enough and this is my fifth trip; they have a belief that the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Captain's fifth trip is an ill-fated one; not a man aboard but trembles
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: in the dire fear that he will never see Berlin again. They will welcome
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: with joy a proposal to escape with us, but to ask them to make the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: attempt with the Admiral himself on board as a prisoner is a different
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: thing. These men are cowed by authority and I know not what notions they
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: might have of their fate if they are to kidnap the Admiral."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But," I questioned, "is there no possible way to leave him behind?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Grauble sat thinking for a moment. "Yes," he said, "there is one way we
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: might do it. We could shave his beard and clip his hair, dress him in a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: machinist's garb and smear his hands and face with grease. Then I could
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: drug him and we could carry him off at the lock and put him in a cell. I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: would report that one of my men had gone raving mad, and I had drugged
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: him to keep him from doing injury to himself and others. It would create
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: no great surprise. Men in this service frequently go mad; and I am
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: provided with a sleep producing drug for just such emergencies."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Then go ahead," I said.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "But you will lose the satisfaction of delivering him prisoner to your
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: government," smiled Grauble.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I have no love for the Admiral," I replied, "but I think his punishment
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: will be more appropriately attended to in Berlin. When our escape is
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: known he will indeed have a rather difficult time explaining to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: His Majesty."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: This suggestion of the pompous Admiral's predicament if thus left behind
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: seemed to amuse Grauble and he at once led the way back to his
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: own cabin.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Von Kufner was lying very quietly in his bonds and glared up at us with
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: a weak and futile rage. Grauble smiled cynically at his prostrate chief.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I had thought to take you along with us," he said, "but I am afraid the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: excitement of the voyage would be unpleasant for you so I have decided
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to leave you at the lock to take our farewell back to His Majesty."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Von Kufner, helpless and gagged was given no opportunity to reply, for
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Grauble, unlocking his medicine case took out a small hypodermic syringe
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and plunged the needle into the prisoner's thigh.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: In a few minutes the Admiral was unconscious. The Captain now brought a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: suit of soiled mechanic's clothes and a clipper and razor, and in a half
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: hour the prim Admiral in his fancy uniform had been reduced to the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: likeness of an oiler. His face roughly shaved, but pale and sallow, gave
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: a very good simulation of illness of mind and body.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "He will remain like that for at least twelve hours," said Grauble. "I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: gave him a heavy dose."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Again we went out, locking the unconscious Admiral in the cabin. "You
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: may go and keep the Princess company," said Grauble, "while I talk with
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: my men and give them an inkling of what we are planning. If there is any
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: trouble at the lock it is better that they comprehend that hope of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: freedom is in store for them."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Amid tears of joy Marguerite now told me of her belated conception of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the desperate plan to induce von Kufner to bring her to the docks to see
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: us depart, and how she had pretended to disbelieve that I was really
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: going and bargained to marry him within sixty days if she could be
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: assured by her own eyes that I had really departed for the Arctic.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: As we waited feverishly for the first nerve-racking part of the journey
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: to be over, we spoke of the hopes and dangers of the great adventure
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: upon which we were finally embarked. And so the hours passed.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: At last we felt the rumble of the motors die and knew that the movement
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of the vessel had ceased.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The voice of the mate spoke at the door: "Remain quiet inside," he said,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and a key turned and clicked the bolt of the lock. The tense minutes
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: passed. Again the key turned in the door and the mate stuck his head
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: inside. "Come quick," he said to me.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I followed him into Capt. Grauble's cabin, but saw Grauble nowhere.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Remove your clothing," said the mate, as he seized a sponge and soap
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and began washing the blackened oil from the hands and face of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: unconscious Admiral. "We must dress him in your uniform. The Commander
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of the Lock has orders to take you off the vessel. We must pass the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Admiral off for you. He will never be recognized. The Commander has
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: never seen you."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Obeying, without fully comprehending, I helped to quickly dress the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: unconscious man in my own clothing. We had barely finished when we heard
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: voices outside.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Quick, under the bunk," whispered the mate. As I obediently crawled
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: into the hiding place, the mate kicked in after me the remainder of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: oiler's clothing which I had been trying to put on and pulled the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: disarranged bedding half off the bunk the better to hide me. Then he
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: opened the door and several men entered.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I had to drug him," said Grauble's voice, "because he was so violent
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: with fear when I had him manacled that I thought he might attempt to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: beat out his brains."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Let me see his papers," said a strange voice.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: After a brief interval the same voice spoke again--"These are identical
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: with the description given by His Majesty's secretary. There can be no
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: doubt that this is the man they want, but I do not see how an enemy spy
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: could ever pass for a German, even if he had the clothing and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: identification. He does not even look like the description in the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: folder. The chemists must be very stupid to have accepted him as one
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of them."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "It is strange," replied the voice of Capt. Grauble, "but this man was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: very clever."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "It is only that most men are very dull," replied the other voice. "Now
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I should have suspected at once that the man was not a German. But he
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: shall answer for his cleverness. Let him be removed at once. We have
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: word from the vessel outside that they are short of oxygen, and you must
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: be locked out and clear the passage."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: With a shuffling of many feet the form of the third bearer of Karl
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Armstadt's pedigree was carried from the cabin, and the door was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: kicked shut.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I was still lying cramped in my hiding place when I felt the vessel
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: moving again. Then a sailor came, bringing a case from which I took
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: fresh clothing. As I was dressing I felt my ear drums pain from the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: increased air pressure, and I heard, as from a great distance, the roar
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: of the water being let into the lock. From the quiet swaying of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: floor beneath me I soon sensed that we were afloat. I waited in the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: cabin until I felt the quiver of motors, now distinguished by the lesser
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: throb and smoother running, from the drive on the wheeled trucks through
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the tunnel.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I opened the cabin door and went out. Grauble was at the instrument
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: board. The mate stood aft among the motor controls; all men were at
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: their posts, for we were navigating the difficult subterranean passage
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that led to the open sea.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: As I approached Grauble he spoke without lifting his eyes from his
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: instruments. "Go bring the Princess out of her hiding; I want my men to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: see her now. It will help to give them faith."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Marguerite came with me and stood trembling at my side as we watched
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Grauble, whose eyes still riveted upon the many dials and indicators
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: before him.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Watch the chart," said Grauble. "The red hand shows our position."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The chart before him was slowly passing over rolls. For a time we could
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: only see a straight line thereon bordered by many signs and figures.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Then slowly over the topmost roll came the wavy outlines of a shore, and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the parallel lines marking the depths of the bordering sea. Tensely we
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: watched the chart roll slowly down till the end of the channel passed
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the indicator.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Grauble breathed a great sigh of relief and for the first time turned
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: his face towards us. "We are in the open sea," he said, "at a depth of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: 160 metres. I shall turn north at once and parallel the coast. You had
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: better get some rest; for the present nothing can happen. It is night
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: above now but in six more hours will be the dawn, then we shall rise and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: take our bearings through the periscope."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I led Marguerite into the Captain's cabin and insisted that she lie down
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: on the narrow berth. Seated in the only chair, I related what I knew of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the affair at the locks. "It must have been," I concluded, after much
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: speculation, "that Holknecht finally got the attention of the Chemical
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Staff and related what he knew of the incident of the potash mines. They
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: had enough data about me to have arrived at the correct conclusion long
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: ago. It was a question of getting the facts together."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "It was that," said Marguerite, "or else I am to blame."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "And what do you mean?" I asked.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I mean," she said, "that I took a great risk about which I must tell
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: you, for it troubles my conscience. After I had sent for the Admiral and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: he had promised to come, I telephoned to Dr. Zimmern of my intention to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: get von Kufner to take me to the docks and my hope that I could come
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: with you. And it may be that some one listened in on our conversation."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I do not see," I said, "how such a conversation should lead to the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: discovery of my identity--the Holknecht theory is more reasonable--but
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: you did take a risk. Why did you do it?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "I wanted to tell him good-bye," said Marguerite. "It was hard enough
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: that I could not see him." And she turned her face to the pillow and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: began to weep.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "What is it, my dear?" I pleaded, as I knelt beside her. "It was all
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: right, of course. Why are you crying--you do not think, do you, that Dr.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Zimmern betrayed us?"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Marguerite raised herself upon her elbow and looked at me with hurt
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: surprise. "Do you think that?" she demanded, almost fiercely.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "By no means," I hastened to assure her, "but I do not understand your
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: grief and I only thought that perhaps when you told him he was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: angered--I never understood why he seemed so anxious not to have you
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: go with me."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Oh, my dear," sobbed Marguerite. "Of course you never understood,
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: because we too had a secret that has been kept from you, and you have
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: been so apologetic because you feared so long to confide in me and I
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: have been even slower to confide in you."
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: For a moment black rebellion rose in my heart, for though with my
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: reasoning I had accepted the explanation that Zimmern had given for his
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: interest in Marguerite, I had never quite accepted it in my unreasoning
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: heart. And in the depths of me the battle between love and reason and
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the dark forces of jealous unreason and suspicion had smouldered, to
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: break out afresh on the least provocation.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I fought again to conquer these dark forces, for I had many times
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: forgiven her even the thing which suspicion charged. And as I struggled
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: now the sound of Marguerite's words came sweeping through my soul like a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: great cleansing wind, for she said--"The secret that I have kept back
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: from you and that I have wanted so often to tell you is that Dr. Zimmern
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: is my father!"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: In the early dawn of a foggy morning we beached the _Eitel 3_ on a sandy
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: stretch of Danish shore within a few kilometres of an airdome of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: World Patrol. A native fisherman took Grauble, Marguerite and myself in
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: his hydroplane to the post, where we found the commander at his
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: breakfast. He was a man of quick intelligence. Our strange garb was
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: sufficient to prove us Germans, while a brief and accurate account of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the attempted rescue of the mines of Stassfurt, given in perfect
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: English, sufficed to credit my reappearance in the affairs of the free
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: world as a matter of grave and urgent importance.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: A squad of men were sent at once to guard the vessel that had been left
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: in charge of the mate. Within a few hours we three were at the seat of
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the World Government at Geneva.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Grauble surrendered his charts of the secret passage and was made a
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: formal prisoner of state, until the line of the passage could be
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: explored by borings and the reality of its existence verified.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I was in daily conference with the Council in regard to momentous
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: actions that were set speedily a-going. The submarine tunnel was located
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and the passage blocked. A fleet of ice crushers and exploring planes

text: Marguerite and I had taken up our residence in a cottage on the lake
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: shore, and there as I slept late into the sunlit hours of a July
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: morning, I heard the clatter of a telephone annunciator. I sat bolt
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: upright listening to the words of the instrument--
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: "Berlin has shut off the Ray generators of the defence mines--all over
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the desert of German soil men are pouring forth from the ventilating
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: shafts--the roof of Berlin is a-swarm with a mass of men frolicking in
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: the sunlight--the planes of the World Patrol have alighted on the roof
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: and have received and flashed back the news of the abdication of the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: Emperor and the capitulation of Berlin--the world armies of the mines
title: City of Endless Night

text: are out and marching forth to police the city--"
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The voice of the instrument ceased.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: I looked about for Marguerite and saw her not. I was up and running
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: through the rooms of the cottage. I reached the outer door and saw her
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: in the garden, robed in a gown of gossamer white, her hair streaming
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: loose about her shoulders and gleaming golden brown in the quivering
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: light. She was holding out her hands to the East, where o'er the
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: far-flung mountain craigs the God of Day beamed down upon his
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: worshipper.
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: In a frenzy of wild joy I called to her--"Babylon is fallen--is fallen!
title: City of Endless Night
author: Hastings, Milo

text: The black spot is erased from the map of the world!"
